Matchsummary.MatchName: Chennai Super Kings vs Gujarat Titans
Matchsummary.Commentss: Chennai Super Kings Won by 5   Wickets   (D/L Method) (Winners)
Matchsummary.TossDetails: Chennai Super Kings Won The Toss And Elected To Field
Matchsummary.TossText: Won The Toss And Elected To Field
Matchsummary.Comments: Chennai Super Kings Won by 5   Wickets   (D/L Method) (Winners)
Matchsummary.PreMatchCommentary:
After close to two months of exhilarating cricket It is time for the most anticipated season finale where the four times champions take on the Defending champs at the Narendra Modi Stadium in Ahmedabad in front of over 1 lac spectators. The home team is heading into this game after a comprehensive win against the in qualifier 2 whereas Chennai qualified for the finals after going past  GT in a  convincing manner in qualifier 1. The two sides having shown balance in all their departments have rightfully earned the opportunity to compete for the gold. MSD who is playing his 250th IPL game would be looking to win his 5th Title while his prodigy Hardik Pandya would look to defend his title on home soil. If he does so he will become the third captain in the history of the league to do so. Looking at Top performers from both sides, Shubman Gill holds the Orange cap while Mohammad Shami, Rashid Khan, and Mohit Sharma top the list of highest wicket-takers this season. Looking at CSK, Devon Conway and Ruturaj Gaikwad have been doing the bulk of the scoring while Tushar Deshpande has been amongst the wickets.  Can CSK beat GT and equal Mumbai Indians as the team with the most IPL trophies or will  Hardik Pandya become the third skipper to lift the cup in two successive years?

 

What was supposed to be an exciting day of cricket yesterday turned out to be a pretty damp day with heavy rains continuing for several hours eventually, there wasn't a ball bowled and the match between the and was rescheduled to the reserve day. 

 

We are live from the Narendra Modi Stadium for IPL 2023 finale to be conducted on a reserve day. It is the first occasion when a final is going to be played on a reserve day. The weather at the moment seems pretty favorable for a game of Cricket as it hasn't rained since last night.

 

                                                                                                                            

 

 

Ground Dimensions : 

 

 

                                                                                                                                 

 

PITCH REPORT: 
Simon Doull & Matthew Hayden: "We are playing on the Center pitch. The dimensions are as follows: 66-meter square boundaries and 74 meters downtown. It is a bit cooler than yesterday. I think that's going to help the ball swing around a bit. Not much has changed since yesterday. If anything, remember last night we had those grass clippings that were rolled in. Maybe they've been removed a little bit which could bring in the slow-pace bowlers, especially on a good length where guys like Mohit hit it hard, and take the pace off. We have got quality spinners in both sides. Looks like 180 can be a par score here. Whatever happens though, you have to have a bat first, especially CSK"

 

                                                                                                                               

 

KEY BATTLES TO WATCH OUT:

SHUBMAN GILL VS DEEPAK CHAHAR

SHIVAM DUBE VS RASHID KHAN

 

TOSS:
CSK WINS THE TOSS AND ELECT TO FIRST

 

                                                                                                                                  

 

MS DHONI, Skipper: "We will want to bowl first with the rain forecast being around. Yesterday we were in the dressing room. As a cricketer, you always want to play. It was the crowd that suffered the most. Hopefully, we can entertain them. The pitch has been under cover for a long time, but throughout the tournament, the pitch has behaved well over here. Quite happy it will be a 20-over game we will be playing. Serves justice to the tournament like this. we are playing the same squad"

 

                                                                                                                                         

 

 

                                                                                                                                          

Hardik Pandya,Skipper: " We Would have bowled first as well, but my heart wanted to bat so I don't mind losing the toss. We spoke that the weather is something out of our control. Whichever team plays better will have their hands on the trophy. I like keeping the boys cool, and they repay me. It's a flat track and we are going with the same team."
Matchsummary.PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-6 Overs) :-                     

GT- 62/0 (10.3 rpo, 9x4, 1x6)  || CSK- 52/0 (13.0 rpo, 7x4, 2x6) (1-4 Overs)

Middle Overs (7-15 Overs) :- 

GT- 81/2 (9.0 rpo, 5x4, 3x6)  || CSK- 66/3 (9.4 rpo, 2x4, 3x6) (5-11 Overs)

Death Overs (16-20 Overs) :- 

GT- 71/1 (14.2 rpo, 6x4, 5x6)  || CSK- 53/2 (13.2 rpo, 2x4, 5x6) (12-15 Overs)

 

A match worthy of being the Final of the most decorated T20 League in the world.  The Defending Champions got off to a flying start after being asked to bat first by MSD. Shubman Gill's 39 from 20 and Wriddhiman Saha's 54 at a strike rate of 138 set the tone for to post a huge total. The impetus came from Sai Sudharsan who played his best T20 knock scoring 96 at a strike rate of 204 in an all-important final. GT put up a mammoth target of 215 which was never going to be an easy chase, especially in a finale. Rain playing spoil sport for a while resulted in the target being revised to 171 from 15 overs. opening pair of Devon Conway & Ruturaj Gaikwad once again got the team off to a solid start setting the tone for the run chase. Conway scored 47 which included 4 boundaries and 2 sixes. Just when it looked easy for CSK, Noor Ahmed picking up 2 wickets in the 7th Over tilted the momentum in the home team's favor. But Shivam Dube was going goof from one end while some vital cameos from Rahane and Rayudu brought the chase back on track. It was left to Ravindra Jadeja when 10 runs were needed from the last 2 balls. The champion All-rounder held his nerves and struck A six off the second-last delivery and a boundary off the last to finish things off in style. CSK win their fifth IPL title under Mahendra Singh Dhoni! 

 

Devon Conway is Player of the Match

 

Devon Conway : "It was a long time to wait, I was very nervous but Ruturaj and myself plotted how we will go about it. Personally, this is the greatest win in my career. IPL final doesn't get bigger than that. Lot of credit to Mike Hussey, the fellow left-handed player. Nice to be in his shoes"

 

 

Shubman Gill is the winner after scoring 890 runs from 17 matches and Mohammad Shami is the  winner after picking 28 wickets from 17 matches

 

Hardik Pandya, Skipper:  "I think we tick a lot of boxes as a team. We play with a lot of heart, really proud of the way we kept fighting. We have a motto - we win together, we lose together. I'm not going to make excuses, CSK played the better cricket. We batted really well, special mention to Sai Sudarshan, not easy to play that well at this level. We have been backing the boys and trying to make sure we get the best out of them. But their success is their success. The way they have put their hand up and delivered - Mohit, Rashid, Shami everyone.  I'm very happy for him, destiny had this written. If I had to lose, I'd rather lose to him. Good things happen to good people, and he's been one of the best people I know. God has been kind, and God has been kind to me as well but today was his night". 

 

MS Dhoni, Skipper: "If you ask me for an answer. This is the best time to announce my retirement. But the amount of love I have received all over. The easy thing would be to walk away from here, but the harder thing would be working hard for 9 months and trying to play another IPL. It would be a gift from me, and won't be easy on the body. You do get emotional, the first game at CSK everyone was chanting my name. My eyes were full of water, I needed to take some time off in the dugout. I realized I need to enjoy this. I think they love me for what I am, they love that I am so grounded, I don't try to portray something I'm not. Just keep it simple. Every trophy is special, but what is special about IPL is every crunch game you need to be ready. There were lapses today, the bowling department didn't work, but it was the batting department that took the pressure off them today. I do get frustrated, it is human but I try to step into their shoes, every individual deals with pressure differently. Ajinkya and a few others are experienced, so you don't worry. If anyone is confused, then can always ask. The special thing about Rayudu is he will always give his 100% when he is on his field. But with him in the team, I will never win the Fairplay award. I've been playing with him for a long time, since the India A tours. He's a player who can play spin and pace equally well. It is something really special. I felt he would do something really special today",

Matchsummary.MatchName: Gujarat Titans vs Mumbai Indians
Matchsummary.TossDetails: Mumbai Indians Won The Toss And Elected To Field
Matchsummary.TossText: Won The Toss And Elected To Field
Matchsummary.PreMatchCommentary:
Good evening Ladies and Gentlemen. We are Live from the Narendra Modi stadium in Ahmedabad where the Defending champions take on the five times champions in Qualifier 2 of IPL 2023. The Titans are coming into the game after a closely fought loss of 15 runs against the in Qualifier 1 at the MA Chidambaram Stadium. Whereas Mumbai Indians are heading into this game after a comprehensive victory against the in the eliminator. Both the teams played against each other in the league stage where both won one game apiece.  This should be an exciting contest and the team that loses is knocked out of the competition while the winner of will qualify for the finals and take on the Chennai super kings on Sunday at narendra modi stadium. 

 

                                                                                                                                             

 

 

Ground Dimensions :

 

 

                                                                                                           

 

 

PITCH REPORT: 
Simon Doull & Matthew Hayden: "The dimensions go as 63m on one side and 68m on the other side. It is 74m downtown and has some reasonable side pockets as well. There have been plenty of runs scored on pitch No. 7 - 204, 207 & 227 batting first in the three games played. The wicket looks very patchy. Earlier in the season there was a lot more grass cover on it. Right now it looks like just rolled in grass which kind of gives the illusion that it is not too bad. Some quality spinners in both games and some upfront bowlers in the powerplay as well. This venue is the top 5 in the list of fours and sixes, but I am not convinced we will get those big numbers tonight. I think it is a 180 wicket at best."

 

 

                                                                                                       

 

KEY BATTLES TO WATCH OUT:

SHUBMAN GILL VS AKASH MADHWAL

SURYAKUMAR YADAV VS RASHID KHAN 

 

TOSS:
MI WINS THE TOSS AND ELECT TO FIRST

 

                                                                                                     

 

Rohit Sharma, Skipper: "We are gonna chase. The Wicket looks a little sticky. We want to make the best use of the pitch. The pitch will get better as the match goes on. It's our comfort, what we want to do. We have chased well this season. This is a different team, we have a lot of new faces in the squad. As a team, we have come across many situations like this. It's important to put your best foot forward. There were a bit of nerves at the start of the tournament, but it's settled now. Just one change. Hrithik Shokeen misses out and Kumar Kartikeya comes in."

 

Hardik Pandya, Skipper: " We would have loved to bowl as well, but it's okay. Knockouts and qualifiers are fun, you have to be on your top. It's important to enjoy. If we play to our strengths, we will be satisfied irrespective of the result. I know how the fans will be supporting us. Gujarati people are loyal.  Yeah, I will bowl at full throttle. Two changes. Josh Little and Sai Sudharsan come in for Dasun Shanaka and Darshan Nalkande."
Matchsummary.PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-6 Overs) :-

GT- 50/0 (8.3 rpo, 6x4, 1x6)  || MI- 72/3 (12.0 rpo, 10x4, 3x6)

Middle Overs (7-15 Overs) :- 

GT- 116/1 (12.9 rpo, 4x4, 10x6)  || MI- 84/3 (9.3 rpo, 6x4, 4x6)

Death Overs (16-20 Overs) :- 

GT- 67/2 (13.4 rpo, 8x4, 2x6)  ||  MI- 15/4 (4.7 rpo, 1x4, 0x6)

 

The Defending Champions   have qualified for the finals for the second time in a row and they will take on the Chennai Super Kings on Sunday at the Narendra Modi stadium in Ahmedabad. After being asked to bat first GT posted a mammoth total of 234 runs Courtesy of Shubhman Gill's blistering knock of 129 runs from just 60 balls. This was Gill's third ton of the season. Sai Sudharsan being involved in 138 run stand did well to compliment Gill from the other end. Hardik Pandya's cameo of 28 from 13 balls helped GT reach a total of 234. In reply, MI in the absence of Ishan Kishan started poorly losing their top order within the powerplay. Tilak Varma smashing 43 from 14 kept MI's scoring rate at par with the target. Suryakumar Yadav once again showed his class by being able to deliver under pressure. Sky amassed 61 from just 38 but fell short of support from the other end. Rashid Khan was the bowler that got the prize wicket of Tilak Varmav while Mohit Sharma introduced at the death accounted for Yadav's dismissal and ran through the MI lower order in no time. MI succumbing to the pressure fell short by 62 runs in the end.  

 

Rohit Sharma, Skipper: "It was a great total, Shubman batted really well. The wicket was really good. They got 25 extra, and with the batting we had we were quite positive when we went in. Couldn't stitch enough partnerships. Green and Surya batted well but we lost our way. We spoke about giving it a good crack, we lost a couple of wickets in the powerplay and did not get the momentum when chasing a target like that. We have been talking about adapting to different conditions and different situations. I won't look into that, we did not play well to win the game. Playing this game and qualifying as 3rd gives us a lot of confidence, our batting has been the biggest positive, some of the younger players especially and take it to next season and see what you can do. Got to give credit to Shubman, he is in great form and I hope he continues that. Gujarat played well. Credit to them"


 
Hardik Pandya, Skipper: " I think a lot of hard work goes behind the team doing well. They keep practicing, and that reflects. I think the clarity and confidence that Shubman Gill is carrying is amazing. Today his innings were one of the finest, he never looked rushed. It felt like someone was throwing balls and he was hitting. Shubhman will be a superstar in International and franchise cricket. I do have conversations with him, I try that people to feed off my energy. Everyone takes responsibility for themselves and performs at their best. We have to play good cricket and put in 100% effort. Knockouts could go either way, but I am very excited for the final."

 

Shubman Gill is the Player of the Match

Shubman Gill:  "For me, it is playing ball to ball and over to over. The over when I hit three sixes gave me the momentum to go for big runs. That's when I realized it could be my day. It was a good surface to bat on as well. Not a conscious decision, you keep inventing as a batter but for me, the belief is more important. I am coming off a good international season as well. Had a good season last time as well. When I start well, I feel confident that I can score well. Expectations are something that follows you outside the ropes, but once you step on the field it is all about trying how to contribute to the team. I think this was probably my best innings so far in the Indian Premier League."

Matchsummary.MatchName: Lucknow Super Giants vs Mumbai Indians
Matchsummary.TossDetails: Mumbai Indians Won The Toss And Elected To Bat
Matchsummary.TossText: Won The Toss And Elected To Bat
Matchsummary.PreMatchCommentary:
Good evening Ladies and Gentlemen. After an exciting Qualifier One between & it is time for Eliminator One which will see two formidable sides going head to head at the Chidambaram Stadium in Chennai. and finished at the third and fourth spot respectively with 8 wins to their credit. LSG came out on top when the two sides clashed at the Ekana Stadium in Lucknow. The five-time champions MI had to wait till the last over of the clash between RCB & GT to secure the fourth spot while LSG went past KKR in a last-over finish to make it to the playoffs. Two sides are evenly poised and would look to put their best foot forward in this all-important eliminator. The Winner of this match will go on to face GT in Qualifier Two at the Narendra Modi Stadium in Ahmedabad.

 

 

PITCH REPORT: 


Matthew Hayden: "It's a different surface than yesterday, the boundaries are different. The off-side boundary is 61 metres, while the leg-side boundary is 70 metres and 77 metres down the ground. The pitch used for this game is similar to the one used in the match between CSK and GT. The wicket looks dry,  so there is lots of in it for the spinners. There will be a bit of swing with the new ball, but apart from that, it's going to be spin to win. Batting first is a good option on this wicket".

 

GROUND DIMENSIONS:

 

KEY BATTLES TO WATCH OUT:

MARCUS STOINIS VS PIYUSH CHAWLA

SURYAKUMAR YADAV VS RAVI BISHNOI

 

 

TOSS:
WINS THE TOSS AND ELECTS TO FIRST

 

 

Rohit Sharma, Skipper: "We want to bat first. This looks like a typical Chennai Pitch, but I don't know how much wear and tear will happen as the game goes on. Back in Mumbai, we have been chasing all the while, this ground here with a longer boundary, so it's better to put up a score on the board. The boys are upbeat about it too. There have been ups and downs, but we have learnt a lot and learnt what we can do as a team. We are ready for this game. We have one change to our side, Kumar Karthikeya is out, and Hrithik Shokeen is in."

 


 
Krunal Pandya, Skipper: " It has been a season full of ups & down for us, but we have fought and never given up. We have match-winners on our side, it's a team effort from us which has got us here, and that's a really good sign. We have covered all bases and just need to execute our skills tonight. We would have batted first as well, but does not matter now we have to play some good cricket."
Matchsummary.PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-6 Overs) :-

MI- 62/2 (10.3 rpo, 9x4, 2x6)  || LSG- 54/2 (9.0 rpo, 7x4, 1x6)

Middle Overs (7-15 Overs) :- 

MI- 69/2 (7.6 rpo, 3x4, 3x6)  || LSG- 100/7 (5.1 rpo, 2x4, 1x6)

Death Overs (16-20 Overs) :- 

MI- 51/4 (10.2 rpo, 3x4, 3x6)  ||  LSG- 1/1 (0.8 rpo, 0x4, 0x6)

 

Five times Champions stun the Super Giants in a knockout game at Chepauk.  lost both their openers within the powerplay but Cam Green and SKY threw a counter punch amassing 66 before falling to Naveen Ul Haq in the same over. The momentum shifted towards the Super Giants from the 11th over where Naveen Ul Haq sent back both the set batters with his wily variations. A cameo of 23 from 12 from the impact player Nehal Wadera helped MI get to a competitive total of 182. In reply, did not get off to the best of starts and kept losing wickets at regular intervals. Marcus Stoinis was going well from one end but lacked support from the other batters. Over No.10 bowled by Akash Madhwal accounted for two wickets which included one big wicket of Nicholas Pooran who has been in superb hitting form throughout the season. A few terrible mix-ups in the middle did not help LSG's cause either. Madhwal registered the best figures for the season with 5 for 5 and single-handedly went past the LSG batting unit. LSG fell short by 81 runs in the end. MI once again make it to the playoffs and will now be competing against GT at the Narendra Modi Stadium on the 26th of May!

 

Krunal Pandya,Skipper: " We were in a good position at one stage of the match, but everything started going wrong the moment when I played that shot, we should have played better cricket. The shot which I played was not on. The ball was coming nicely onto the bat but we just needed to have batted better. We didn't play good cricket after the strategic timeout. Quinton de Kock is a quality batter, but Kyle Mayers has a better record here, so we went ahead with him. MI batters batted really well against the fast bowlers, so I thought of starting with spinners against them."

 


Rohit Sharma, Skipper: "This is what we have done over the years. People don't expect us to do what we have done, but we managed to. Akash Madhwal was part of the team last year as a support bowler, and once Jofra Archer was gone and I knew he had the skills and the character to do the job for us. Over the years we have seen many guys coming in from Mumbai Indians and playing for the national team. It is important to make the youngsters feel special and make them feel part of the team, my job is to just make them comfortable in the middle. They are very clear in their roles about what they need to do for the team and that's what you want. As a team, we enjoy fielding. Good to see everyone contributing on the field. Coming to Chennai, we knew the whole team needs to come to the party. At Wankhede, you need one or two brilliant performances, but here it is a different ball game."

 

 

Akash Madhwal is the Player of the Match

Akash Madhwal: "I have put in a lot of hard work and waiting for my chance. I have done engineering but cricket has always been my passion. I have been waiting for this opportunity since 2018. When we practice the management gives us a target which we try to execute our best. I am happy with the role that the team has given me and glad that it is coming off well. I want to do well in the next matches too to take the team all the way. Out of all the wickets, Pooran's was my favorite. Would love to keep playing in a similar fashion for my team."

Matchsummary.MatchName: Gujarat Titans vs Chennai Super Kings
Matchsummary.Commentss: Chennai Super Kings Won by 15   Runs (Qualified)
Matchsummary.TossDetails: Gujarat Titans Won The Toss And Elected To Field
Matchsummary.TossText: Won The Toss And Elected To Field
Matchsummary.Comments: Chennai Super Kings Won by 15   Runs (Qualified)
Matchsummary.PreMatchCommentary:
Good Evening Ladies and Gentlemen. After 70 enthralling League Matches, it is time for the playoffs where the Defending champions will take on the four times champions at the MA Chidambaram Stadium. The Titans are heading into this game after a close finish against the Royal Challengers whereas the Super Kings are coming into this game on the back of a win against the Capitals. The table toppers Titans have won  10 out of 14 matches while CSK finished second on the points table having won eight out of their 14. Gujarat has an upper hand in terms of the head-to-head record having clinched all three encounters against the Yellow Army. The fact that Hardik Pandya and Co. have not competed at Chepauk makes this an interesting contest. The Winners of this match directly qualify to the finals whereas the losers get another opportunity to compete in the qualifier 2. Two top sides take center stage in an all-important battle at the Chidambaram Stadium.

 

                                                                                                                 

 

 

Ground Dimensions :

 

 

                                                                          

 

Matthew Hayden: "The Square boundary dimensions are 68 meters on one side and 63 meters on the other.  Downtown it is 78 meters. I believe Spinners would be licking their lips in the dressing room. The pitch is quite dry and will definitely offer a turn. There are some patches that will offer plenty of quality spinners on both sides. The surface is on the drier side and is expected to slow down as the match progresses. 170 can prove to be a winning total. If I were the Captain I would Bat first and get some runs on the board which matters in high-intensity encounters."

 

                                                                                                                        

 

 

KEY BATTLES TO WATCH OUT:

MOHAMMAD SHAMI VS DEVON CONWAY
DEEPAK CHAHAR VS SHUBMAN GILL
 

TOSS:
WINS THE TOSS AND ELECTS TO FIRST

 

 

                                                                                                                          

 

Hardik Pandya, Skipper: "  We will bowl. We believe dew will come in later, so we want to know what exactly is the target. We were told to take it easy after getting into the top-2, but we refused to. We want to stay focused and play competitive cricket. We are a smart team, we don't play one-dimensional, we make sure to get the best out of the wicket and have adapted accordingly. The Change is that Darshan Nalkande comes in place of Yash Dayal."


 
MS Dhoni, Skipper: " We would have loved to bowl first, the reason being Gujarat are an excellent chasing side. We have exploited the conditions slightly better, in a tournament like this, the boys have adapted really well. It's important to back your strengths, the confidence level should be high. They've been able to do that and that's why we have done well. There was a lot of dew in the last game, but with the breeze around, we can't say about it tonight, but it does look dry. We're playing the same team"
Matchsummary.PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-6 Overs) :-

CSK- 49/0 (8.1 rpo, 6x4, 1x6)   || GT- 41/2 (6.9 rpo, 5x4, 1x6)

Middle Overs (7-15 Overs) :- 

CSK- 76/3 (8.4 rpo, 6x4, 1x6)  || GT- 61/4 (6.7 rpo, 3x4, 1x6)

Death Overs (16-20 Overs) :- 

CSK- 47/4 (9.4 rpo, 2x4, 3x6)  ||  GT- 55/4 (11.0 rpo, 5x4, 3x6)

 

becomes the first team in the history of IPL to qualify in the finals for the 10th time. While batting first it was once again the opening pair of CSK that did the maximum damage. A partnership of 87 set the tone for the middle order on a tricky track which assisted the slow bowlers. As the game progressed the pitch slowed down and it proved to be tough for Gujarat batters. A target of 173 seemed even bigger with CSK spinners maintaining tight lines. Ravindra Jadeja was the pick of the lot with figures of 2/18 at an economy of 4.5 runs per over. Shubham Gill showed a lot of grit with the score of 42 of 38 balls but with the rising scoreboard pressure succumbed to Deepak Chahar at a crucial time.  Chennai today raised their fielding standards in crunch moments. Finally, the Super Kings have a win over the Titans and what better time than in a qualifier contest? CSK will play the finals on 28th May at The Narendra Modi Stadium in Ahmedabad.

 

Hardik Pandya, Skipper: "   I think the bowlers were quite spot-on, but we made some basic mistakes that cost us the game. With the kind of bowlers we had, I felt we conceded 10-15 extra runs. A lot of things we did right. We bowled a couple of softballs in between. We were good at executing our plans and then in between we gave some extra runs. I don't think we need to look much into it. We have to play two days later, we have to play one more game to make sure we reach the final."


 
MS Dhoni, Skipper: " IPL is too big to say it's just another final. Used to be 8 top teams, now it's 10 teams. I won't say it's just another final. It's hard work of 2 months. Everybody has contributed. Yes, middle-order has not got ample opportunity. Gujarat Titans are a fantastic team and they've chased very well, so the thought was to get them in. But it was a good toss to lose. If Jadeja gets conditions that help him. he's very difficult to hit. His bowling changed the game. Not to forget his partnership with Moeen. We try to create an environment and work out what is the strength of a fast bowler. We try to give them confidence and tell them 'Please try to explore your bowling'. We try to motivate them as much as possible. The support staff is there, and Bravo and Eric are there. You see the wicket and according to that, you keep adjusting the field. I can be a very annoying captain, I keep shifting fielders 2-3 feet. The only request I ask from the fielders is, to keep an eye on me. If there's a dropped catch there will be no reaction, just keep an eye on me. I don't know. I have 8-9 months to decide. Why take that headache now? I will always be there for CSK, where it's playing or something outside."

 

 

Ruturaj Gaikwad is Player of the Match

Ruturaj Gaikwad: "  Last three-four games in Chennai have been different. First few games wicket was better. But we have had to adapt to the conditions. Keep rotating strike, capitalize on loose balls. I have been lucky to have partners like Faf and Conway. both are great players. Faf was someone who was aggressive from the very go whereas Conway has great batsmanship. I would say the knock of 60 runs was more satisfying than the catch I took."

Matchsummary.MatchName: Royal Challengers Bengaluru vs Gujarat Titans
Matchsummary.TossDetails: Gujarat Titans Won The Toss And Elected To Field
Matchsummary.TossText: Won The Toss And Elected To Field
Matchsummary.PreMatchCommentary:
Match 70 of IPL 2023 will take place at the M.Chinnaswamy Stadium in Bengaluru between and . The Defending champions have already sealed a spot in the top 2 while the hosts need to win the match to make it to the top four. having won their last encounter against SRH will be watching this game closely as their dream of making it to the playoffs depends on GT doing well against RCB in the match at hand. RCB has to win to qualify while GT will compete to keep up the winning momentum before their all-important qualifier clash against in two day's time.

 

 

                                                                                                                          

 

 

DELAYED TOSS DUE TO RAIN AT BENGALURU 

 

 

                                                                                                                     

 

GOOD NEWS, COVERS HAVE COME OFF AND THE TOSS IS TO TAKE PLACE AT 7:45 P.M!

 

TOSS:
WINS THE TOSS AND ELECTS TO FIRST

 

 

                                                                                                                        

 

Hardik Pandya, Skipper: " We are gonna field with the weather around. It is better to know how much is the target. It is important for us to win games and continue the winning momentum, I believe in good habits and would want to continue that. Just want to go out there and play some positive cricket. For us, this is as important game as the next game is an all-important qualifier. We are going in with the same team."

 

Faf Du Plessis, Skipper: "  You always want to chase because of the conditions, but the team batting first too has done well here. It is a new one and the guys are motivated for this one. Just one change. Karn Sharma misses out and Himanshu Sharma replaces him."
 

SLIGHT DELAY DUE TO  DRIZZLE, MATCH TO BEGIN AT 8:25 PM!
Matchsummary.PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-6 Overs) :-

RCB- 62/0 (10.3 rpo, 11x4, 0x6)  || GT- 51/1 (8.5 rpo, 7x4, 1x6)

Middle Overs (7-15 Overs) :- 

RCB- 74/4 (8.2 rpo, 8x4, 1x6)  || GT- 97/1 (10.7 rpo, 7x4, 5x6)

Death Overs (16-20 Overs) :- 

RCB- 61/0 (12.2 rpo, 6x4, 2x6)  ||  GT- 50/2 (12.1 rpo, 1x4, 4x6)

 

A Match worthy of being the last league stage game of the season! RCB got off to a good start courtesy of Kohli and FaF but none of the other middle-order batters got going while Kohli was going well at one end. The master carried his bat through the innings finishing unbeaten on 101 from 61 deliveries. Rashid Khan was the pick of the bowlers conceding at just 6 r.p.o and also accounting for a big wicket of Glenn Maxwell. A target of 198 was never going to be easy but Gill and Saha came out with a positive intent. Vijay Shankar who came in at number three compiled a 123-run stand from just 71 deliveries putting in the driver's seat. Shubman Gill smashing 8 maximums and 5 fours got to his second Century of the season and stunned everyone once again with his exemplary shot-making. The total was chased down with 5 balls to spare. crashes out and MI qualifies for the playoffs.

 

Faf Du Plessis, Skipper: "  Very disappointed not finishing on a good note. We played a strong team tonight and an amazing century from Shubman. It was really wet in the second innings. It was wet in the first innings as well, but there wasn't a lot of grip in the second innings and also we had to change the ball quite a few times during the second innings. Virat Kohli played an unbelievable knock to give us a chance and thought that was a good score, but Shubman Gill played incredibly well to take the game away from us. From Our batting perspective, the top 4 contributed really well but we missed a few runs from the middle order consistently throughout the season, especially in the back end of the innings. Our bowlers in the middle overs perhaps didn't get as many wickets as we would have liked."

 

Hardik Pandya, Skipper: " The calmness the boys had was phenomenal. The way boys played ticked all the boxes. Shubman knows when he plays that kind of shot he gives no chance to the bowlers. He picked his spot and made it look easy. We would have taken 197 at the start, but we didn't bowl that well. Special innings from Virat Kohli. I can't ask anything better from the boys. Last year, everything went well for us. We were expecting people to challenge us. The boys showed tremendous character."

 

Shubman Gill is the Player of the Match

Shubman Gill: "  I am in good form, it's about getting a start and converting it into a big score. I am happy that It is all working out for me at the business end of the tournament. You need to keep playing shots in T20 cricket. The new ball was holding a bit, it got easier to bat on. It was difficult for their spinners to bowl. Vijay Shankar was going too hard, I told him to hold his shape. Once he found the momentum, he can hit long as well. It's going to be an exciting qualifier contest playing against Chennai in Chennai. We have a great bowling attack and hopefully, we'll make it to the final for the second time in a row."

Matchsummary.MatchName: Mumbai Indians vs Sunrisers Hyderabad
Matchsummary.TossDetails: Mumbai Indians Won The Toss And Elected To Field
Matchsummary.TossText: Won The Toss And Elected To Field
Matchsummary.PreMatchCommentary:
The Penultimate league stage encounter in IPL 2023 will be held at the Wankhede Stadium in Mumbai between and . Rohit Sharma and Co. would be looking to put their best foot forward to take their points tally to 16 which will give them a chance to make it to the playoffs. Although they will have to wait on the second game of the Super Sunday doubleheader between RCB and GT. A win for MI and a defeat for will ensure a spot in the playoffs for the home team. SRH on the other side have had a season to forget and have nothing to play for but pride. The Orange army could try a few youngsters waiting on the sidelines in a Match where they have nothing to lose. 

 

                                                                                                              

 

 

KEY BATTLES TO WATCH OUT:

HEINRICH KLAASEN VS PIYUSH CHAWLA

ROHIT SHARMA VS BHUVNESHWAR KUMAR

 

Ground Dimensions :

 

 

                                                                                                                           

 

 

PITCH REPORT: 
Simon Doull and Kevin Pietersen: "The Dimensions are 63 metres and 67 metres square of the wicket and 72 metres straight. I see the red soil sticking out. From history, this is a very very good wicket to bat on. The wicket is knit together quite nicely which means it's a good cricket wicket. Yorkers and good length have worked for the bowlers, everything else has been absolutely dismissed. It's a great surface, heavy length, top of off-stump is absolutely vital because of how good the wicket is."

 

 

                                                                                                               

 

 

TOSS:
WINS THE TOSS AND ELECTS TO FIRST

 

 

 

                                                                                                             

 


Rohit Sharma, Skipper: "  We are gonna field first. Just the feature of the wicket and what we prefer doing. It is quite dry as well. Whatever it has to happen will happen in the first innings. Hrithik Shokeen misses out. Kumar Kartikeya comes in. The NRR situation is a tricky one. We just want to win the match and not think about how to do it. Winning gives us a chance. Not looking too far ahead. We have discussed in the team meeting what to do and what not. We have played an afternoon game before. We are aware of the pitch and the conditions here. You just need to play well to win."


 
Aiden Markram, Skipper: " We would want to finish strong. Another chance for the squad and a few of the players who have been on the bench. We have a couple of changes. It is a good batting surface and a high-scoring venue. It should be a great time for the batters as we have nothing to lose."
Matchsummary.PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-6 Overs) :-

SRH- 53/0 (8.8 rpo, 9x4, 0x6)  || MI- 60/1 (10.0 rpo, 7x4, 3x6)

Middle Overs (7-15 Overs) :- 

SRH- 104/1 (11.5 rpo, 9x4, 5x6)  || MI- 100/1 (11.1 rpo, 8x4, 6x6)

Death Overs (16-20 Overs) :- 

SRH- 43/4 (8.6 rpo, 2x4, 2x6)  ||  MI- 41/0 (13.6 rpo, 6x4, 1x6)

 

 

Once again chasing down a 200+ target with ease. started well with Agarwal and Vivrant Sharma smashing at almost at 9 r.p.o in the powerplay. Agarwal managed to up the ante in the middle overs taking the attack to the MI spinners. The right-handed opening batter smashed 83 runs at a strike rate of 180 while his opening partner Vivrant Sharma scored a fifty on his debut innings in IPL. MI pulled things back in the death overs courtesy of Akash Madhwal who picked 4 and is becoming reliable to deliver under pressure. In response, MI lost Ishan Kishan early but Skipper Rohit Sharma and Cam Green compiled 128 runs between them from just 65 balls giving no chance to the SRH bowlers to stage a comeback. Sharma playing second fiddle scored 56 from 37 while Cam Green finished unbeaten on 100 from 47 balls. A fine cameo from SKy towards the end ensured that MI chase down the total with 2 overs to spare. MI will now have to depend on the result of the next game between GT and RCB for their fortune to make it to the playoffs. 

 

 

 
Aiden Markram, Skipper: " It was a good effort with the bat today. You need a lot more than 200 against MI playing at Wankhede. The boys played well, unfortunately, ended up on the wrong side. It has been a great challenge this year while leading the team. We have a great group of guys who are quite young too. We have learned a lot as a team."

 

Rohit Sharma, Skipper: " We came with that positive mindset, we wanted to win and not worry about what is not in our control. We've got only ourselves to blame if we don't qualify for the playoffs. Last year, we did a big favor for RCB, I hope we get the desired result tonight. We did a lot of things right today. We didn't start well in the tournament and then won three on the trot. The crucial moments in the game that we lost, there were a lot of moments. In the game against Punjab, we could have played well. And in the last game against LSG, we had the game in our hands. We can't look too much into it. Sometimes it just doesn't come along."

 

Cameron Green is the Player of the Match

Cameron Green: "   It was a great stand with Rohit Sharma. Having his leadership at the other end helped a lot. The whole MI setup has been amazing. The intent at the top, it helps when you have guys like Rohit Sharma, Ishan Kishan, and Suryakumar Yadav. When we had 2 runs to get, I said SKY to finish it. Then we had a couple of runs, we just trickled over the line and just glad to score my maiden Century in IPL."

Matchsummary.MatchName: Kolkata Knight Riders vs Lucknow Super Giants

Matchsummary.TossText: Won The Toss And Elected To Field
Matchsummary.Comments: Lucknow Super Giants Won by 1  Run
Matchsummary.PreMatchCommentary:
Match 68 of the Indian Premier League will take place between and at the iconic Eden Gardens Stadium in Kolkata. The home team is not out of the race to the playoffs but needs a lot of permutations and combinations to go their way to make it to the top four. Whereas LSG on the other side have an excellent chance to qualify as a win here would take their tally to 17 and would certainly guarantee a spot in the top 4 if not in the Top 2. 

 

TOSS:
WINS THE TOSS AND ELECTS TO FIRST

 

                                                                                                     

 

 

Nitish Rana, Skipper: "  We will field first. Need to win by a big margin to make it to the top four, want to play positive Cricket. Rinku Singh has been one of the big positives of the season for us. The entire team Has done well in patches in other areas as well. Jason Roy has been able to provide some good starts. Also, there is Suyash Sharma who has done well. We are going in with the Same team."


 
Krunal Pandya, Skipper: "   We would have fielded too. At the end of the day, you have to come out and play good cricket. We know where we stand on the table. Our destiny is in our hands. The focus is on playing good competitive cricket. We defended well in the previous match. Eventually what matters is how we do tonight.
Matchsummary.PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-6 Overs) :-

LSG- 54/1 (9.0 rpo, 5x4, 2x6)  || KKR- 61/1 (10.16 rpo, 9x4, 2x6)

Middle Overs (7-15 Overs) :- 

LSG- 65/4 (7.2 rpo, 4x4, 4x6)  || KKR- 53/3 (5.9 rpo, 4x4, 0x6)

Death Overs (16-20 Overs) :- 

LSG- 57/3 (11.4 rpo, 3x4, 4x6)  ||  KKR- 61/3 (12.2 rpo, 4x4, 7x6)

 

A seesaw of a contest between KKR and LSG at the Eden Gardens going the Vistor's way. LSG did not have the best of starts and lost half the side with just 73 runs on the board. But a partnership of 74 (47) between Badoni and Pooran brought LSG back into the game. Pooran was the aggressor amongst the two smashing 58 runs from 30 balls which included 5 maximums and 4 fours. Sunil Narine picking 2 for 28 was the pick of the bowlers for KKR. In response to a target of 177, Jason Roy and Venky Iyer took KKR off to a flying start compiling 61 in the powerplay. LSG bowlers fought their way back in the middle overs courtesy of their spinners K Gowtham and Ravi Bishnoi. LSG picked 3 KKR wickets in the middle overs conceding at only 5.9 r.p.o. It was anyone's game when 63 runs were required from the last five overs. LSG looked on top after picking up Andre Rusell in the 16th over but it was not over as Rinku Singh was still batting. The batter smashed 20 runs from the 19th over and 20 again from the last over falling short by just one run in the end. Rinku Singh remained unbeaten on 67 from just 33 balls. LSG win the match and qualify for the playoffs of IPL 2023. 

 


Nitish Rana, Skipper: "  The end result did not go our way, but many positives to take from this season and lots to improve upon as well. We Will definitely come back stronger next year. You need to do well in all the 3 departments to compete and finish in the top 4 in the world's best league. I feel bad because as a unit we had the ability to qualify but failed to do so. Feels like in all 14 games, I have spoken only about Rinku Singh. I am personally very happy for him as we are good friends and I don't really have words to describe him because everyone has seen what he can do on a cricket field."

 

Krunal Pandya, LSG Skipper: "   Totally Satisfied. We never gave up, we were put under a lot of pressure but credit to our boys. At one stage, they were 61/1 but I've seen it before that at this level 2-3 tight overs and we can be right back in the game. And there was some grip for the spinners as well. Rinku Singh has been very special this year, every game when he is there you can't take it easy. Today he did it again. I told my bowlers to stick to the plans and take one ball at a time. Happy that it worked.
 

 

Nicholas Pooran is Player of the Match

Nicholas Pooran: "   I always knew I had to take the game as deep as possible. When the spinners were operating, I knew they'll give me bad deliveries which I could capitalize upon and this was a small ground too. I've been batting well throughout the tournament, and I pride myself to play in such circumstances. A lot of time has been invested in me and these are the ways that I can repay them ."

Matchsummary.MatchName: Delhi Capitals vs Chennai Super Kings
Matchsummary.Commentss: Chennai Super Kings Won by 77  Runs
Matchsummary.TossDetails: Chennai Super Kings Won The Toss And Elected To Bat
Matchsummary.TossText: Won The Toss And Elected To Bat
Matchsummary.Comments: Chennai Super Kings Won by 77  Runs
Matchsummary.PreMatchCommentary:
The all important 67th Game of IPL 2023 will be held at the Arun Jaitley Stadium in Delhi between the and . The home team is coming into this game on the back of a narrow win against the Punjab Kings where Rilee Rossouw was the top scorer and Prithvi Shaw displayed signs of good form. Warner and Co have already exited the playoff race and will be looking to end their campaign on a positive note. CSK on the other side is coming into the match on the back of a loss against the KKR. MSD and Co. have been consistent and shown balance in all their departments. But a win here is a necessity if the Yellow Army wants to make it to the playoffs. A win will take their tally to 17 and then they will not have to depend on other teams for their place in the top four. A crucial day game awaits between two sides full of talent where DC will play for pride whereas CSK will compete to cement their place in the top 4 of this year's edition. 

 

                                                                                                       

 

KEY BATTLES TO WATCH OUT:

RUTURAJ GAIKWAD VS ANRICH NORTJE

DAVID WARNER VS THEEKSHANA

 

 

Ground Dimensions :

 

 

                                                                                                                 

 

 

PITCH REPORT: 
Kevin Pietersen and Aaron Finch: "62m square boundaries and 74m hit downtown. This pitch was watered a few hours ago, some grass cutting was put and was nicely rolled, the ground staff were worried about this pitch becoming very dry. It is still ver dry and the conditions are extremely hot at 41 degrees celsius. You will want to bat first here, there are some flaky cracks which could open up as the game progresses which will make the wicket slower and lower, and offer more turn. Batting will get difficult as the game goes on."

 

TOSS:
WINS THE TOSS AND ELECTS TO FIRST

 

                                                                                                   

 

 

MSD, Skipper: "  We will bat first. We've been trying to win games right from the first game that is why you play right. We're going in with the same eleven, it's a balanced eleven and we don't need to make many changes. It is a day game so the pitch will also slow down as the match progresses, that's the reason we want to put runs on the board. In a tournament like this, we'll have good and bad games, need to take the learnings from every game and that's what I want the youngsters in the team to learn."


 
David Warner, Skipper: "   It's all about being consistent, we haven't settled in home conditions, but today is another chance to do well in front of the home crowd. Lalit Yadav comes in, so does Chetan Sakariya. Ishant Sharma misses out. We will have to start afresh here after that win in Dharamsala."
Matchsummary.PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-6 Overs) :-

CSK- 52/0 (8.7 rpo, 6x4, 2x6)  || DC- 34/3 (5.6 rpo, 3x4, 2x6)

Middle Overs (7-15 Overs) :- 

CSK- 96/1 (10.7 rpo, 5x4, 7x6)  || DC- 82/2 (9.1 rpo, 5x4, 4x6)

Death Overs (16-20 Overs) :- 

CSK- 75/2 (15.0 rpo, 6x4, 5x6)  ||  DC- 30/4 (6.0 rpo, 3x4, 0x6)

 

A clinical performance from the Chennai Super Kings to make it to the playoffs of IPL 2023. Gaikwad and Conway once again got off to a solid start. A partnership of 141 demoralized bowlers and left very little scope for the bowlers to stage a comeback. Conway smashed his 6th half-century of the season and finished on 87 while Gaikwad scored 79 from 50 deliveries striking 7 maximums & 3 fours. A cameo of 20 from 7 by Jadeja helped CSK post a mammoth score of 23 on the board. In response, DC failed to capitalize on the powerplay losing three wickets to CSK seamers. DC and Deshpande dented DC's scoring in the powerplay and thereafter the spinners took over to contain the home team. Only Warner looked good compiling 86 while no other batter even crossed the 15-run mark. All CSK bowlers were amongst wickets but Deepak Chahar picking 3 for 22 did maximum damage.  CSK qualifies for the 12th time out of 14 IPL appearances which is the most by any team in the league. 

 

David Warner, Skipper: Credit to CSK, the way they played today outbattled us in all three departments. We were a good pitch to bat on, boundaries in the powerplay would have put more pressure on their bowlers. There were some positives, we didn't bowl badly with the ball, we'll have to look at the positives and come back strongly next season. You have to back your game plan,  try to score boundaries, and use your feet against spin. You can't get struggle against bowlers, partnerships would have been handy.

 

MSD, Skipper: " There is no recipe for success, you try and pick the best players and give them the best slot to perform. And groom them in the areas where they are weak, somebody has to sacrifice their slot for the side. Credit to the Team management as well, they always back us. But, the players are most important, without the players, we can't do anything. I think death bowling, and confidence are very important. Tushar Deshpande has developed because he is able to execute under pressure, he has the confidence now. And when you keep playing the same players, it helps. I think the bowlers have also taken responsibility, Pathirana is quite a natural to bowling at the death but Deshpande has really developed there. I think we need to figure out and pick players who are team first - not bothered about individual performance and perform the best at knockout stages.

 

 

Ruturaj Gaikwad is the Player of the Match

Ruturaj Gaikwad: "For us, it was a must-win game, and my 50th game for this franchise. Feels amazing to make a contribution in a crucial match. I think the wicket was slow and holding up, was difficult to hit fast bowlers but with spinners we thought we had an opportunity with short straight boundaries. We set the platform for the middle order and thought we could attack later on. Glad that happened.

Matchsummary.MatchName: Punjab Kings vs Rajasthan Royals
Matchsummary.TossDetails: Rajasthan Royals Won The Toss And Elected To Field
Matchsummary.TossText: Won The Toss And Elected To Field
Matchsummary.PreMatchCommentary:
Match 66 of the Indian Premier League will take place between and at Himachal Pradesh Cricket Association Stadium in Dharamsala. Both sides have a bleak chance of making it to the playoffs. A win for either of them will take their points tally to 14 which will not guarantee them a spot in the top four. For these teams to qualify they will have to depend on the results of other matches taking place on the Weekend. But what is in their hands is to play in high spirits and put up a valiant show in their last match of the season.

 

 

                                                                                                                            

 

 

KEY BATTLES TO WATCH OUT:

RAVICHANDRAN ASHWIN VS SHIKHAR DHAWAN

JOS BUTLER VS ARSHDEEP SINGH

 

 

Ground Dimensions :

 

 

                                                                           

 

 

 

 

PITCH REPORT: 


Murali Kartik and Matthew Hayden: "It's the same wicket that was used against the Capitals. Talking about the ground dimensions, it's equally far from either side. Down the ground is 76 meters. Tonight it's a similar surface, although there isn't much of green on the surface which would not give that much movement to the seamers. Not much assistance for the Spinners too. Seems like a good batting track  If I win the toss I would bat first as dew is not going to be a big factor tonight."

 

 

                                                                            

 

 

TOSS:
WINS THE TOSS AND ELECTS TO FIRST

 

                                                                                                                  

 

 

 

Sanju Samson, Captain: "We want to bowl first. Looking at the ground dimensions and looking at what we require in the tournament, Bowling is a better option. We need to win this game and then see how the rest of the matches go. If you want to play a competitive game of T20 cricket, you need to forget the past. We have had four to five days of rest. We have made a couple of changes. These are last-minute changes. Ravichandran Ashwin misses out on today's match because of a back spasm".

 

Shikhar Dhawan, Captain: "Last game, there wasn't much of dew. Batting first or Second doesn't matter we want to enjoy the game. We Will try to give our best shot. We ideally want need to take more wickets in the powerplay so that we can cash in more. We are playing the same team."

 

 

 

KEY BATTLES TO WATCH OUT:

RAVICHANDRAN ASHWIN VS SHIKHAR DHAWAN

JOS BUTLER VS ARSHDEEP SINGH
Matchsummary.PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-6 Overs) :-

PBKS- 48/3 (8.0 rpo, 6x4, 2x6)  || RR- 57/1 (9.5 rpo, 8x4, 2x6)

Middle Overs (7-15 Overs) :- 

PBKS- 69/2 (7.6 rpo, 4x4, 3x6)  || RR- 84/3 (9.3 rpo, 6x4, 4x6)

Death Overs (16-20 Overs) :- 

PBKS- 70/0 (14.0 rpo, 7x4, 4x6)  ||  RR- 48/2 (9.6 rpo, 4x4, 3x6)

 

A nail biter at Dharamsala going the visitor's way. did not have the best of starts losing 4 wickets for just 50 runs within 7 overs but the middle order packed a punch to take RR by surprise. Sam Curran and Jitesh Sharma formed a solid partnership of 64 from 44 to keep PBKS in the game. The onslaught began with Shahrukh Khan who took the attack to the opposition smashing 41 at a strike rate of 178 taking PBKS to a challenging total of 187. Adam Zampa's spell conceded at only 6.50 r.p.o restricting PBKS scoring to some extent. In response, RR once again lost Buttler Eaerly who registered his fifth duck of the season but the two Indian Southpaws Jaiswal and Padikkal kept going at a brisk rate. Hetmyer coming in at number 5 smacked 3 maximums and 4 fours which helped RR catch up to the asking rate. Cameos from Parag and Jurel helped seal the game in the last over with 2 balls to spare. is still alive in the league and will have to depend on a few other results in order to make it to the playoffs.

 

Shikhar Dhawan, Captain: "We quite a few wickets in the first six and that put us on the back foot in the first innings but Sam Curran, Jitesh Sharma, and Shahrukh Khan's knocks got us back in the match. Our bowling was good in patches but the fielding was not that good. The dropped chances cost us the match. I feel 200 would have been a good total on this wicket. Speaking about the season, We could have done better in all departments. Sometimes the batters were clicking and sometimes the bowling unit was doing well.  We failed to put up those performances together. But it's a young side, so we have learned a lot of things this season."

 

Sanju Samson, Captain: "We thought with the way Shimron Hetmyer was going we will win it by 18.5. We have a quality team and it is dissapointing to see where we are on the points table. I have been talking about Yashasvi Jaiswal almost every game now. He has shown immense levels of maturity. It feels as if he has played 100 T20 Internationals. Every match we feel Trent will pick a wicket for us in the first over. We were under pressure in the last few games".

 

 

Devdutt Padikkal is the Player of the Match

Devdutt Padikkal: "Coming into the season I was feeling confident. But it didn't pan out the way I thought. Every game as a cricketer you want to win it for your team. To be honest, it has been a strange season. I have been batting everywhere in the batting order. I need to learn and adapt to batting at every position. At the start of the season, I thought I might not make it. But really happy to receive this award tonight"

Matchsummary.MatchName: Sunrisers Hyderabad vs Royal Challengers Bengaluru
Matchsummary.Commentss: Royal Challengers Bengaluru Won by 8  Wickets
Matchsummary.TossDetails: Royal Challengers Bengaluru Won The Toss And Elected To Field
Matchsummary.TossText: Won The Toss And Elected To Field
Matchsummary.Comments: Royal Challengers Bengaluru Won by 8  Wickets
Matchsummary.PreMatchCommentary:
Match 65 of the Indian Premier League will take place between  and at  the Rajiv Gandhi International Stadium in Hyderabad. The hosts are out of playoff contention whereas their counterparts still have a chance to make it to the top four. A win today will take the Visitor's tally to 14 and put them in an advantageous position before their last encounter against GT which also happens to be the last league game of the tournament. Other teams that would be interested in this game are CSK and LSG who will make it to the playoffs if RCB suffers a defeat at the hands of SRH. Faf and Co. have had a few concerns with their middle-order batting but their Top Order has done remarkably well to make it up for that. The bowling side came good in the previous encounter against RR and would be expected to repeat the feat against SRH whose batting lineup has struggled through the tournament. While SRH plays for pride, RCB will play to keep their hopes alive for the playoff qualifications. 

 

                                                                                                              

 

 

KEY BATTLES TO WATCH OUT:

VIRAT KOHLI VS BHUVNESHWAR KUMAR

RAHUL TRIPATHI VS MOHAMMAD SIRAJ

 

 

                                                                                          

 

 

 

Ground Dimensions :

 

 

 

                                                                                                        

 

 

PITCH REPORT: 
Aaron Finch and Deep Dasgupta: " This is the center pitch. The Square boundaries are around 60 meters. The wicket is an absolute beauty as it is pretty even with not even a blade of grass out of place. Seems to be on the drier side though. It has been watered but with the weather being so hot, it's just a bit dry. There are a few cracks but I wouldn't be worried about that. Once players get their spikes chewing the wicket up a little bit, you'll start to get the ball slowing down and spin playing a major part later on. Batting first seems to be ideal here. The Curator reckons that there hasn't been much dew. This pitch could turn a little. Might not be a high-scoring match."

 

TOSS:
WINS THE TOSS AND ELECTS TO   FIRST

 

 

                                                                                                          

 

 

Faf du Plessis, Skipper: "We will bowl first. The last two nights We've had dew here. Looks like a Good Wicket but slightly on the slower side. We are going on with the same team as last game. Wanindu Hasaranga has a niggle. Adding Bracewell strengthens our batting and adds depth. Every day is a new day and we need to start fresh. You have to have the humility of looking at a fresh game."

 

 

Aiden Markram, Skipper: " We would have batted anyway. So Not very disappointed with the toss result. we have a couple of changes to our side. Harry Brook comes back. Kartik Tyagi comes in as well. Umran Malik is an X-factor player. We have a lot of pride to play for. We haven't lived up to the ability we possess. But we would try to display that at the world stage in the last two matches."
Matchsummary.PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-6 Overs) :-

SRH- 49/2 (8.1 rpo, 8x4, 1x6)  || RCB- 64/0 (10.6 rpo, 10x4, 1x6)

Middle Overs (7-15 Overs) :- 

SRH - 84/1 (9.3 rpo, 4x4, 4x6)  || RCB- 86/0 (9.5 rpo, 8x4, 3x6)

Death Overs (16-20 Overs) :- 

SRH- 53/2 (10.6 rpo, 3x4, 3x6)  || RCB- 37/2 (8.8 rpo, 2x4, 2x6)

 

A challenging total chased with ease by the Royal Challengers!   started well by picking 2 early wickets in the powerplay after asking SRH to bat first. But a partnership between Klaasen and Markram brought SRH back into the match. An outstanding Knock from Heinrich Klaasen helped SRH post a mammoth total of 186 on the board. The South African batter went on to hit his maiden IPL Ton off just 51 balls. Mohammad Siraj was the most economical bowler while Bracwell was amongst the wickets for RCB. In response, the Opening pair of Faf and Virat came out all guns blazing and took the attack to the opposition from the very first delivery of the innings. A partnership of 172 between the two gave no chance to the bowlers to get into the game. Kohli the aggressor amongst the two went on to make his 6th Century of the league while Faf compiled 71 getting to his 8th Half Century of the season. In the end, RCB made a mockery of the target and completed the chase with 4 balls to spare. 

 

Aiden Markram, Skipper: " We batted quite well. We could have added a few more in the powerplay. Great contribution from Klaasen. But I still feel it was a good score. Good to see great support not just for us but also for RCB as well. We weren't able to give them a win. We all hate losing. However, we always look to win. Hopefully, have smiles at the end of the campaign. It was an excellent knock from Faf and Virat. We will look at some of these guys moving forward. We were probably one bowler short in the powerplay. Kartik was put under tremendous pressure. The plans were all in place but we failed to execute it. Mayank was very impressive. It was a special knock from Klaasen. I feel Super happy for the guy. I don't think he would have dreamed of getting an IPL hundred. Unfortunately, it ended up in a losing cause."

 


Faf du Plessis, Skipper: It was an amazing chase isn't it? That was my first reaction. I did feel after the first innings that 200 was a par score in that pitch.  Spinners didn't get a turn from this pitch. The batters have done well for us and in the previous match, we were also clinical with the ball. I and Kohli we complement each other well. We play in very different areas so it's difficult for the bowlers. We are good friends on and off the field. The next match is at Chinnaswamy which will be an amazing game in front of the home crowd. And a must-win game might bring out the best in us."

 

 

Virat Kohli is the Player of the Match

Virat Kohli: "Quite special considering the magnitude of the game. Thought SRH got a very good score. Ball was gripping as well. Faf has been on a different level. I've had a quiet couple of matches. The way I was striking in the nets wasn't transitioning into the middle. I personally have never looked at my past records and did not think much about their record against us. I put myself under so much stress already that I forget that I have scored 6 centuries in IPL. I don't care what anyone says on the outside. I've never been a guy who plays so many fancy shots. It's Test cricket coming up after the IPL so have to stay true to my technique and be positive."

Matchsummary.MatchName: Punjab Kings vs Delhi Capitals
Matchsummary.TossDetails: Punjab Kings Won The Toss And Elected To Field
Matchsummary.TossText: Won The Toss And Elected To Field
Matchsummary.PreMatchCommentary:
Dharamsala is all set to host a game of IPL after a wait of 10 long years. The home team which is still in contention for the playoffs will be looking to continue on the winning momentum gained in the last game by going past the same opponent by a margin of 31 runs. Prabhsimran Singh scoring a century was the highlight of the match. PBKS has won 6 out of their 12 fixtures and stands at number 8 on the points table. on the other side are having a season to forget as they are already out of the playoff race. Warner and Co have nothing to play for but pride while PBKS considering their NRR would want to win big in this game to strengthen their chance to make it to the top four. 

 

HEAD TO HEAD:-

 

PITCH REPORT: 
Simon Doull and Matthew Hayden: "We are 1457 metres above sea level, that makes a difference when it comes to dimensions and boundary hitting. The boundary dimensions are 65 metres square on each side while the straight hit is 76 metres. The pitch seems to be an absolute beauty and it hasn't had a lot of wear and tear. When you look at the wicket, it is really hard, not a lot of movement in these cracks whatsoever. A good covering of grass means the Pacers are gonna be in play throughout the game. One can expect this to play out as a good wicket to bat on. 180 seems like a par score. The outfield looks absolutely magnificent it's been relaid, looks pristine and we're set for a cracking night here in Dharamshala."

 

GROUND DIMENSIONS:-

 

KEY BATTLES TO WATCH OUT:

PRABHSIMRAN SINGH VS ISHANT SHARMA

DAVID WARNER VS ARSHDEEP SINGH

 

TOSS:
PBKS WINS THE TOSS AND ELECTS TO FIRST

 

Shikhar Dhawan, Skipper: "   We will field. It is a fresh track. We will see how it progresses. Destiny is in our hands. Just gonna come and play positively this evening. The focus is to just stay calm and follow our process. We have made two changes to the side. Atharva Taide comes in for Rishi Dhawan and Kagiso Rabada comes in for Sikandar Raza.
 


David Warner, Skipper: "   We would have loved to bowl first too. There seems to be some dew, that can be a factor here.  We have nothing to lose just that we need to put up a show for this wonderful crowd and the ones sitting back home. A lovely venue. Mitch Marsh misses out and Anrich Nortje comes in while Prithvi Shaw replaces Pravin Dubey."
Matchsummary.PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-6 Overs) :-

DC- 61/0 (10.1 rpo, 7x4, 3x6)  || PBKS- 47/1 (10.8 rpo, 6x4, 2x6)

Middle Overs (7-15 Overs) :- 

DC- 87/2 (9.6 rpo, 8x4, 4x6)  || PBKS- 70/2 (7.7 rpo, 6x4, 3x6)

Death Overs (16-20 Overs) :- 

DC- 65/0 (13.0 rpo, 5x4, 4x6)  ||  PBKS- 81/5 (16.2 rpo, 3x4, 8x6)

 

A high-scoring thriller clinched by the Capitals in the end! Warner and Co came out all guns blazing after being asked to bat first. A 94-run stand between Shaw and Warner set the platform for the middle order to follow. Rossouw who came at number three was game from ball one, the swashbuckling batter smashed 82 runs from just 37 balls at a staggering strike rate of 222. A mammoth target of 214 was never going to be easy to chase down especially after playing a maiden to Khaleel and losing the Skipper Shikhar Dhawan for a duck. Atharva Taide did manage to score a half-century but was unable to strike according to the asking rate which was always creeping. It was Livingstone who unleashed himself when 79 were required from the last four. It came down to 38 from the last 2 when Nortje bowled a match-winning over which gave away only 5 runs. Liam Livingstone the lone warrior did strike a few in the final over too but failed to get over the line. clinched the game by a margin of 15 runs eventually. 

 

Shikhar Dhawan, Captain: "It is frustrating. We didn't bowl really well in the powerplay. We should have taken some wickets while it was swinging. It's quite a close game, but can't help it. Livingstone played a great knock, unfortunately, we couldn't end up on the winning side. I feel my decision to bowl spin-off the last over backfired. In this sort of a wicket, whether we take wickets or not, we should bowl at the right areas which we are not doing for quite a long time. For every powerplay, we have been giving 50-60 runs, we should be taking wickets as well. I got out and the 1st over was also a maiden."

 

David Warner, Skipper: "   Very bad fielding performance to be honest. Playing on a nice batting wicket helped. Was pretty challenging at home. It was nice to see Prithvi bat the way he did. Rilee Rossouw played an amazing knock as well. We needed some consistency at our home venue but unfortunately did not happen. We haven't been able to work out a total at home. Great to get the points tonight."

 

 

Rilee Rossouw is Player of the Match

Rilee Rossouw: "  Thanks to the support staff. Happy that I could perform for the team. As David Warner mentioned was a good wicket to bat on. Davey and Shaw put up a good partnership at the top. I enjoyed some momentum when I came into the bat. Just shows that this game is not over till the last ball is bowled. Exceptional innings from Liam Livingstone in the second innings."

Matchsummary.MatchName: Lucknow Super Giants vs Mumbai Indians
Matchsummary.GroundName: Bharat Ratna Shri Atal Bihari Vajpayee Ekana Cricket Stadium
Matchsummary.Commentss: Lucknow Super Giants Won by 5  Runs

Matchsummary.TossText: Won The Toss And Elected To Field
Matchsummary.Comments: Lucknow Super Giants Won by 5  Runs
Matchsummary.PreMatchCommentary:
is all set to host the in Match No.63 of the Indian Premier League at the Ekana Stadium in Lucknow.  The hosts have won 6 out of their 12 fixtures and are placed at the 4th spot on the points table with 13 points. A win here will boost LSG's chances to make it to the playoffs. They will be confident going into the game as they are riding on the winning momentum gained in the previous encounter against SRH. Prerak Mankad scored his maiden fifty while Pooran and Stoinis displayed their power-hitting prowess. Pacers Yudhvir Singh and Yash Thakur were economical while Skipper Krunal Pandya was amongst the wickets. The bowlers will have their task cut out against an MI unit whose batting has fired all cylinders in their last few encounters. The main threat being Suryakumar Yadav who scored his maiden century and looked unstoppable against GT. It will be interesting to see how Rohit Sharma and Co bat against the LSG spinners on a slow track at Ekana. Piyush Chawla who has been the MI's top wicket taker with 19 scalps will be key at this venue. A rampant MI having won 4 out of their 5 games will be looking to end the losing streak against LSG. Also, a win here will Make them favorites to finish in the top 2. The two teams are in contention for a place in the playoffs, and the encounter proves to be a crucial one not just for them but for a few other teams who are in contention.

 

                                                                                                                                        

 

Ground Dimensions :

 

 

                                                                                                  

 

 

PITCH REPORT: 
Kevin Pietersen and Deep Dasgupta:  "  It is 75 metres on one side and 61 metres on the other side. Downtown is 78 metres. The longest boundary from the pavilion end is the long-off boundary which is 81 metres. It is the red soil pitch which means more pace and bounce. There is a little bit of grass, but not much. It is gonna be low and slow. The dew factor is unpredictable here. 

 

KEY BATTLES TO WATCH OUT:

SURYAKUMAR YADAV VS RAVI BISHNOI & KRUNAL PANDYA

MARCUS STOINIS VS PIYUSH CHAWLA

 

VENUE STATS:
MATCHES IN 2023 AT LUCKNOW: 
WON FIRST : 3
WON SECOND: 2
AVG 1ST INN TOTAL: 147

 

TOSS:
WINS THE TOSS AND ELECTS TO FIRST

 

                                                                                                          

 

 

 

Rohit Sharma, Skipper: "  We are gonna field. We know what to expect from the pitch, looks like a good track but not sure how it is gonna play, so better to have a score in front of us. We have seen that the seamers here have been quite effective here, so we got four seamers and two spinners only. Every game is important and anyone can beat anyone on a given day. We have made one change. We have an off spinner coming in for the left-arm orthodox."


 
Krunal Pandya, Skipper: "  Honestly, It is a good toss to lose. We would have batted first anyway. Every game in the league is important and there are quite a few changes to our side. Naveen Ul- Haq and Deepak Hooda come in while Kyle Mayers and Avesh Khan miss out. We are all set and Everyone is fit and raring to go."
Matchsummary.PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-6 Overs) :-

LSG- 35/2 (5.8 rpo, 1x4, 2x6)  || MI- 58/0 (9.6 rpo, 3x4, 4x6)

Middle Overs (7-15 Overs) :- 

LSG- 73/1 (8.1 rpo, 1x4, 3x6)   || MI- 67/3 (7.4 rpo, 9x4, 0x6)

Death Overs (16-20 Overs) :- 

LSG- 69/0 (13.8 rpo, 4x4, 6x6)  ||  MI- 47/2 (9.4 rpo, 0x4, 3x6)

 

A nail-biter at the Ekana Stadium going LSG's way. were 3 down with just 36 runs on the board but a partnership of 82 (59) between Skipper Krunal Pandya and Marcus Stoinis brought LSG back in the game. Stoinis seemed to be batting on a different track altogether. The 18th over of the first innings bowled by Jordan conceded 24 turned out to be the game-changing over of the match. Stoinis finished unbeaten on 89 from 47 balls. While chasing 178 got off to a flying start courtesy of Rohit Sharma and Ishan who compiled 90 runs from 58 deliveries. Ishan Kishan smashed 59 at a strike rate of 151. Ravi Bishnoi getting both the openers kept LSG in the match. The MI middle order failing to fire put additional pressure on Tim David who was required to go at 12 r.p.o on a slowish track. David Smashed 3 maximums and one four but failed to get MI over the line. Mohsin Khan delivering the last over held his nerves to defend 11 off the last over. MI fell short by 5 runs in the end. 

 

Rohit Sharma,Skipper: "   We didn't play good cricket. There were little moments in the game that we failed to capitalize upon. We assessed the pitch quite nicely and it seemed like a good pitch to bat on. The target was definitely changeable and we lost our way in the second half of the innings. We also gave away too many runs at the death. But the way we started with the batin the powerplay put us in a good position, but as I said we lost our way in the second half. Marcus Stoinis played well and kept hitting straight which is what you need to do on a pitch like this and a ground like this. It was an amazing knock from him. So credit to him.

 

Krunal Pandya, Skipper: "   I was having cramps, as I pulled a muscle. For me, it's always about being a team player so I am really happy with the result. Mohsin has a big heart and bowls like that. It has not been easy for us, really happy to end on a good note here. Good to give the home crowd a win in this last game at this venue."

 

Marcus Stoinis is the Player of the Match

Marcus Stoinis: "  Indeed a great moment.  Mohsin has not been playing for a while,  and especially bowling the final over after being injured is a big thing.  A couple of good overs from the spinners and Mohsin sealed it for us. We have shown that we are a tough team, there are no real superstars, and there are different people stepping up and performing for us. We are missing KL, but we have KP leading us, and Andy Flower as a coach has a really good brain."

Matchsummary.MatchName: Gujarat Titans vs Sunrisers Hyderabad
Matchsummary.TossDetails: Sunrisers Hyderabad Won The Toss And Elected To Field
Matchsummary.TossText: Won The Toss And Elected To Field
Matchsummary.PreMatchCommentary:
The action moves to the Narendra Modi Stadium in Ahmedabad where the will play host to the Sunrisers from Hyderabad. The defending Champions have been consistent throughout the season having lost only 4 out of their 12 games and thus find themselves at the top of the table. Skipper Hardik Pandya will be in a secure head space as all their departments are firing and there seems to be no real weakness in the side. Shubman Gill has been the top run-getter while Rashid Khan who holds the purple cap with 23 Wickets is doing damage with the ball. Likes of Vijay Shankar, Saha, and Skipper Pandya himself have had some decent outings and would be looking to replicate the same at the business end of the tournament. The bowling side of things also looks solid with Shami leading the pace attack and Mohit Sharma being his aid. The visitors on the other side have a formidable side on paper but have failed to translate that into their on-field performances. The Orange army has won just 4 out of their 11 fixtures which finds them in the second last position on the points table. Although the team has an outside chance to make it to the playoff that will depend on a lot of permutations after win all their remaining fixtures. GT on the other side will look to get past an underconfident SRH and secure a place in the top two which will give them an extra cushion in the playoffs. 

 

KEY BATTLES:

SHUBMAN GILL VS BHUVNESHWAR KUMAR

RASHID KHAN VS HEINRICH KLAASEN

 

 

                                                                                                                                  

 

 

 

Ground Dimensions :  

 

 

                                                                                                   

 

 

PITCH REPORT: 
Samuel Badree and Rohan Gavaskar:  "  It is quite hot at the moment. We are playing on pitch number 8. The ground Dimensions are 74 metres and 58 metres square while straight hit is 70 metres. It's a fresh wicket, which has not been used so far. There's a bit of moisture, but it's a hot day, so this moisture is expected to dry out in a couple of hours. There are certain spots which are a little darker than the usual pitch. Once the moisture dries out, it seems like a good pitch to bat on. It will be a contest between the batters at the Narendra Modi stadium."

 

 

                                                                                           

 

 

TOSS:
WINS THE TOSS AND ELECTS TO  FIRST

 

                                                                                               

 

 

Aiden Markram, Skipper: " We are gonna bowl, looks like there is little moisture on this wicket, something for the pacers to utilize early on.  We have been playing really good cricket but not getting over the line. Would like to pack a punch tonight. Marco Jansen comes in for Glenn Phillips."

 

Hardik Pandya, Skipper: "  Yeah, it is a special initiative to support cancer patients. We have been playing really good cricket. The players have put up their hands in tough situations and come good. It is an unused wicket, we would have liked to field as well. We have a couple of forced changes to the side. Vijay Shankar got hit by a ball in the net yesterday, Sai comes in. Shanaka makes his debut and also Yash Dayal is back."
Matchsummary.PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-6 Overs) :-

GT- 65/1 (10.8 rpo, 10x4, 0x6)  || SRH- 45/4 (7.5 rpo, 4x4, 2x6)

Middle Overs (7-15 Overs) :- 

GT- 89/1 (9.9 rpo, 9x4, 2x6)    || SRH- 66/3 (7.3 rpo, 5x4, 2x6)

Death Overs (16-20 Overs) :- 

GT- 34/7 (6.8 rpo, 3x4, 0x6)  ||  SRH- 43/2 (8.6 rpo, 4x4, 1x6)
