not only becomes the first team to secure a birth in the playoffs but will also finish in the top irrespective of the result in their final league stage fixture. SRH struck early picking up Saha in the first over but Shubman Gill and Sai Sudarshan applied themselves well playing proper cricketing shots all around the park. A 147-run stand between the two put GT in the driver's seat. Gill scored his maiden IPL ton while Sai Sudarshan compiled 47 from 36 deliveries. Bhuvneshwar Kumar was the pick of the bowlers picking up a fifer for just 30 runs from his four. Chasing 189 was never going to be easy especially after not being able to make the most of the powerplay. Mohammad Shami once again stepped up in the powerplay picking 3 wickets in the powerplay leaving very little scope for SRH to stage a comeback. Mohit Sharma with his bag of tricks scalped 4 in the middle overs and completed a clean sweep for the Titans. Klaasen making his second fifty of the season was the lone warrior who lacked support from the other batters. fell short by 34 runs and now is the second team to get eliminated from the race of the playoffs.  

 

Aiden Markram, Skipper: " We were in the match at the halfway mark but when you lose 4 wickets in the powerplay, it becomes tough. We were slightly off with our bowling, to be honest. We've got high-class bowlers who can swing the ball both ways. Shubman Gill's innings were amazing and so did their number three Sai Sudarshan. Klaasen is a great player and I'm very pleased for him, the world can see the class and power that he possesses. The rest of us haven't complimented him. We have to play for pride now. We'll try to give some opportunities to youngsters.  It'll be nice to finish off the season in good spirits but unfortunately, we haven't been good enough in the tournament this year."

 

Hardik Pandya, Skipper: "  Very proud of the boys, two in two in making it to the playoffs. The boys put their hands up and in challenging situations and we rightly deserve the playoff spot.  We ticked a lot of good boxes as all our departments have fired, we made a lot of errors but we were always there in the game and tried to stay consistent. Bowlers are very close to my heart. Sometimes batters take a lot of credit, for me, I will always be a bowler's captain and ensure they get due credit they very much deserve."

 

 

Shubman Gill is Player of the Match

Shubman Gill: "  I made my IPL debut against SRH and got my first hundred against them, so life has come a full circle. Hopefully many more to come and that too this year. It's all about the bowlers and situation and I don't dwell much on my last innings. It is important to focus on the situation at hand. The six off Abhishek Sharma was the most pleasing thing for me. I told him that if you bowl to me I'm gonna hit you for a six So it came off and very happy with that."

Matchsummary.MatchName: Chennai Super Kings vs Kolkata Knight Riders
Matchsummary.Commentss: Kolkata Knight Riders Won by 6  Wickets
Matchsummary.TossDetails: Chennai Super Kings Won The Toss And Elected To Bat
Matchsummary.TossText: Won The Toss And Elected To Bat
Matchsummary.Comments: Kolkata Knight Riders Won by 6  Wickets
Matchsummary.PreMatchCommentary:
Match 61 of IPL 2023 will see the play host to the Knight Riders from Kolkata. This game provides an opportunity to CSK to be the first team to qualify for the playoffs. While KKR will fight to live another day. CSK have been ticking all the boxes and all their departments have fired. The Men in Yellow have lost only 4 out of their 12 games while KKR have been able to win only 5 out of their 12 matches so far. The current form makes CSK the clear favorites and the fact that has not been able to win a game since 2013 at Chepauk does not help KKR's cause either. 

 

 

                                                                                                            

 

 

Ground Dimensions :

 

                                                                         

 

 

PITCH REPORT: 
Sanjay Manjrekar and Matthew Hayden:  "  61 meters & 70 meters are the square boundaries while it is 77 meters down the ground.  A dry wicket. There is hardly any grass. The ball is going to hold up on this pitch.  There will be a lot of spin. Got to bat first, if you win the toss.  160-165 seems like a Par score.

 

TOSS:
WINS THE TOSS AND ELECTS TO FIRST

 

                                                                                        

 

 

MSD,  Skipper: "  We'll bat. We are slightly unsure about the pitch, and as the tournament has progressed the pitch gets slow. Throughout the years, we have told openers to assess the pitch quickly and find what's a good target. After the ball loses its shine we can revisit the score and the target we need to post on the board. I think we have done really well, but fielding is one department where we need to step up. Can improve 5-10%. Same eleven for this match."

 


 
Nitish Rana, Skipper: " Would have batted first. The wicket seems sticky, so would have wanted to bat first and get our spinners who have done a remarkable job in play in the second innings.  IPL is a high-pressure contest and such is the nature of this format and league, we can't take it lightly at all. If any department fails, then the result goes against you most times. So we need to be clinical in all departments. We have one change, Anukul Roy misses out and Vaibhav Arora comes in."
Matchsummary.PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-6 Overs) :-

CSK- 52/1 (8.7 rpo, 6x4, 1x6)  || KKR- 46/3 (7.7 rpo, 4x4, 2x6)

Middle Overs (7-15 Overs) :- 

CSK- 40/4 (4.4 rpo, 0x4, 1x6)  || KKR- 71/0 (7.9 rpo, 7x4, 2x6)

Death Overs (16-20 Overs) :- 

CSK- 52/1 (10.4 rpo, 1x4, 3x6)  ||  KKR- 30/1 (9.1 rpo, 2x4, 0x6)

 

break the Chepauk jynx by registering a win after 11 years! started well after electing to bat first scoring 52 runs in the powerplay but lost their way in the middle overs. Spinners Sunil Narine and Varun Chakravarthy were successful in picking wickets as well as keeping the scoring in check. CSK managed only 40 runs in the middle overs losing 4 wickets. Narine gave only 15 runs from his four accounting for two crucial wickets. Shivam Dube's unbeaten 48(34) helped CSK post 144 on the board. In response, KKR did not get the best of starts losing 3 wickets in the powerplay to Deepak Chahar. But a match-winning partnership of 99 from 77 between Skipper Nitish Rana and Rinku Singh for the 4 th wicket took the game away from the hosts. Rana remained unbeaten on 57(44) while Rinku scored 54(43) which consisted of 3 maximums and 4 fours. KKR beat CSK by 6 wickets with 9 balls to spare. 

 

MSD, Skipper: "  The moment we delivered the 1st ball in the second innings, we realized that we needed 180 on the board. But there was no way we could have got 180 on that wicket. The dew made a big difference in the 2nd innings. We can't really blame any of our bowlers. Just the conditions had a big impact on the game. Very happy with what Shivam Dube has done, but important that he is not satisfied and wants to keep improving. Deepak Chahar has the ability to swing the ball, he knows what fields to take, and he bowls accordingly."

 

Nitish Rana, Skipper: " Said at the toss that if all 3 departments fire, our chances are good. Have to give credit to Chandrakant Pandit Sir for this - I wasn't in favor of taking a heavy roller but he insisted to go for it. I feared the pitch might break up. But that didn't happen and the ball didn't turn much."

 

 

Rinku Singh is Player of the Match

Rinku Singh: " We Lost some early wickets and when I went in  Nitish Rana said it's a difficult pitch to bat on. Will take singles and capitalize on bad balls. I bat in the same position in domestic cricket, and play the same way. I have always believed in the power that I possess. I have worked hard on my game."

Matchsummary.MatchName: Rajasthan Royals vs Royal Challengers Bengaluru
Matchsummary.Commentss: Royal Challengers Bengaluru Won by 112  Runs
Matchsummary.TossDetails: Royal Challengers Bengaluru Won The Toss And Elected To Bat
Matchsummary.TossText: Won The Toss And Elected To Bat
Matchsummary.Comments: Royal Challengers Bengaluru Won by 112  Runs
Matchsummary.PreMatchCommentary:
will be hosting the Royal Challengers from Bangalore in Match 60 of IPL 2023. It is a Royal Rumble where both teams would be fighting to stay in the race of the playoffs. The hosts have 12 points to their credit from their 12 games while RCB has 10 points from their 11 encounters so far. The visitors will have to do well in terms of their Net run rate which does not look so good at the moment. The onus will be on the Top three of Faf, Kohli, and Maxwell who have been doing all the scoring for RCB while the middle order has struggled to get going. Skipper Faf Du Plessis holds the orange cup with 576 runs in the league. Bowlers Hasaranga and Vyshak Vijaykumar have picked wickets but have been on the expensive side while Hazlewood has not had any major impact in the three games so far. on the other side are riding on the momentum gained in their previous encounter against KKR. Jaiswal setting a record for the fastest fifty off 13 balls is the primary reason. Buttler and Samson have been in good form too. The Spin attack is led by Yuzi Chahal who is now the highest wicket of the Cash rich league. Ashwin has complimented him well from the other end. Boult will lead the pace attack in the company of Sandeep Sharma. A mouth Watering contest awaits between Two top sides that will compete to stay in the race of the playoffs. 

 

                                                                                                                                                  

 

 

Ground Dimensions :

 

                                                                                                

                                                                                                

 

 

PITCH REPORT: 
WV Raman and Simon Katich. :  "  We are playing on pitch5 at the SMS Stadium, this is the center pitch. In terms of dimensions, the square boundaries are 66m while the straight boundaries are longer at 78m. There was some cloud cover in the morning which has now disappeared. Second time this pitch is being used after the RRvCSK game, There were runs in that and it will be high scoring again. The pitch looks tough, with some cracks and grass cover in the middle. Because it's a day game, the ball might slow up a bit due to the heat.

 

TOSS:
RCB WINS THE TOSS AND ELECTS TO FIRST

 

                                                                                                 

 

 

Faf Du Plessis, Skipper: "  We will bat. It seems that the conditions might favor batting first, looks like a dry wicket. We just need to execute better. 3-4 guys are putting their hand up every match, we need a bit more probably to cash in on some good positions. Wins are important and net run rate is not something we can think about now. We have two changes Wayne Parnell comes in for Josh Hazlewood and Bracewell comes in for Wanindu Hasaranga."


 
Sanju Samson, Skipper: " Would have batted too. There is pressure and we will treat this as a semi-final. To be honest, we have had just one flat game against Gujarat, the rest of the games we have played competitive cricket. There are a few niggles that players carry through the tournament, but the support staff has done a good job managing that. We have one change Adam Zampa comes in for Trent Boult."
Matchsummary.PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-6 Overs) :-

RCB- 42/0 (7.0 rpo, 3x4, 1x6)  || RR- 28/5 (4.7 rpo, 3x4, 1x6)

Middle Overs (7-15 Overs) :- 

RCB- 78/2 (8.6 rpo, 5x4, 3x6)  || RR- 31/5 (7.2 rpo, 1x4, 3x6)

Death Overs (16-20 Overs) :- 

RCB- 51/3 (10.2 rpo, 4x4, 3x6)

 

A complete demolition at the Sawai Mansingh Stadium in Jaipur. got off to a solid start of 42 in the powerplay after electing to bat first. Maxwell coming in at 3 took the attack to the opposition in the middle overs while Faf played second fiddle from the other end. Maxwell and Faf scored 54(33) and 55(44) respectively and a cameo of 29(11) from Rawat at the backend saw RCB post a target of 171. RCB started in a spectacular fashion with the ball getting the top three within 2 overs. Parnell picking three wickets in the powerplay doing maximum damage left very little scope for to stage a comeback. RR was reduced to 28 for 5 in the powerplay and then it was the spinners that ran through the lower order in no time. RR batting was summed up for just 59 which is the third-lowest score in the history of IPL! Cricket is a great leveler indeed! 

 

                                                                                         

 

Sanju Samson, Skipper: " I think our top three were scoring a lot of runs, we go hard in the powerplay but it didn’t come out today. Credit to the RCB bowlers for their energy and intensity. I think it was a target within reach and the game could have gone to the wire, I expected a tight match if we had a decent first six. But that is the way, Jaiswal, and Buttler have been playing throughout the tournament.  I don't think I have an answer to the collapse yet. We all know the nature of the league, anything can happen at any time. We have to be strong, take a day off, and think about the upcoming match in Dharamshala. We have to take responsibility on the whole as a team for this performance."

 

Faf Du Plessis, Skipper: "  Good for our Netrunrate. Tough pitch to bat on. We batted first and assessed the conditions well.  In the powerplay, we realized that 160 will be a good total. We also managed to capitalize on the momentum shift at the end. Michael Bracewell would want to bowl like this every day of the week, especially on a track like this. Wrist spin could have been an attacking option. Hopefully, we can set it up for the last game at the Chinnaswamy. They needed this confidence to go into the last two games."

 

 

Wayne Parnell is Player of the Match

Wayne Parnell: " Credit to our batters to get a target like that on such a track. The last overplayed by Rawat gave us momentum. The message was clear, it was to take pace off the ball. Maintain stump line. We were able to execute everything well today. The surface was low, slow, and skiddy. I Was just trying to make them play across the line. My preparations while I was not playing were the same.  It is a long tournament and you need to be switched on every game."

Matchsummary.MatchName: Delhi Capitals vs Punjab Kings
Matchsummary.TossDetails: Delhi Capitals Won The Toss And Elected To Field
Matchsummary.TossText: Won The Toss And Elected To Field
Matchsummary.PreMatchCommentary:
Hello and Welcome to the Live Commentary of the Northern Derby where the Delhi Capitals host the Punjab Kings. Both the teams are at the bottom half of the table playing 11 games with PBKS winning 5 and DC winning 4. Both the teams have faced each other 30 times and the results are equally balanced with 15 and 15. This match will be very crucial with the teams going neck to neck in the business end on the points table. Who will raise up on the table after tonight's game? Red & Blue or Red & Gold? 

 

                                                                                                                                      

 

VENUE STATS:-

In 5 matches played at the Arun Jaitely Stadium, Delhi this year, 4 has been won by the teams chasing the target and only once the team batting first has won! The average first innings score is recorded to be 168 and 182 is the highest successful chase here. This is one of the few stadiums where we have not witnessed a 200+ score yet in this IPL! Can we get one today?

 

Ground Dimensions :

 

 

                                                                                                     

 

 

 

TOSS:-

David Warner calls right and will bowl first!!

 

David Warner, DC Captain: "We will bowl first. It is going to be a slow, low surface, it is not going to change much. There might be some dew later on the field. The last game was not a good one but winning 4 out of 5 was quite good. The boys have come out with a clear mind. The crowd has come out and supported us."

 

Shikhar Dhawan, PBKS Captain: "We would have liked to bowl as well, so looking forward to it. I guess, we're adapting to the conditions well. We have been playing some good cricket but we have not finished well. It is good that they are putting up good performances. They are young and maturing and those are great signs. We have made a change as Raza comes back in place of Rajapaksa."
Matchsummary.PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-6 Overs) :-

PBKS- 46/3 (7.7 rpo, 5x4, 2x6) || DC- 65/0 (10.8 rpo, 11x4, 1x6)

Middle Overs (7-15 Overs) :- 

PBKS- 71/1 (7.8 rpo, 3x4, 4x6) || DC- 50/6 (7.7 rpo, 6x4, 1x6)

Death Overs (16-20 Overs) :- 

PBKS- 50/3 (10.0 rpo, 5x4, 2x6) || DC- 19/2 (3.8 rpo, 0x4, 0x6)


Punjab Kings gets a must needed triumph here against Delhi Capitals and move ahead on the Table with 12 points! After winning the toss and electing to bowl first, Ishant Sharma (On his 100th game) took two wickets in two overs within the powerplay after which Axar stroked early and limited PBKS to 46/3 in the powerplay! But it was one man - Prabhsimran who looked like playing on a different pitch while the others were struggling to meet the ball! Prabhsimran registered his maiden century and scored 61% of the runs of his team! His contribution took the team to a total of 167 runs.

In the second innings when DC batted, it was their game to win as they went very strong in the powerplay with 65 runs for no loss! The trouble all began when Harpreet Brar accounted for his first wicket in the 7th over after which the Spinners took 4 wickets in the three overs! The momentum shifted rightly on their side and they capitalized to restrict the opposition to 134 runs. Harpreet Brar was the man with the ball as he scalped 4 wickets!!


David Warner, DC captain: "It was about trying to restrict them to a decent total. They got more than we thought. Prabhsimran batted really well. Catch drops cost us. After the powerplay when you lose six wickets for 30 runs, we are not going to win. We will play with freedom on our remaining games for pride. Another disappointing effort with the bat after the good start we had. We found the right combination but we keep losing quick wickets and you can't afford that at this level."


Shikhar Dhawan, PBKS Captain: "It was amazing how the way the bowlers brought us back in the game. All credit to our spinners and also our fast bowlers as well. It was turning early and playing that kind of knock is just incredible and amazing from Prabhsimran. That helped us reach that decent total. I told Harpreet to keep it slow and target the wickets and the way he stood up and took those wickets was really fantastic. Very happy with the way youngsters are growing and maturing. This win has brought a lot of confidence for us."

 

Prabhsimran Singh is the Player of the Match

Prabhsimran Singh: "We lost a few wickets so the plan was to take the game deeper. I have been with the team for a long time and when you get opportunities you have to grab it completely. The wicket was slightly tough at the start and the plan was to build some partnership by targetting a few bowlers. Really thankful to the management for the opportunities."

Matchsummary.MatchName: Sunrisers Hyderabad vs Lucknow Super Giants
Matchsummary.Commentss: Lucknow Super Giants Won by 7  Wickets
Matchsummary.TossDetails: Sunrisers Hyderabad Won The Toss And Elected To Bat
Matchsummary.TossText: Won The Toss And Elected To Bat
Matchsummary.Comments: Lucknow Super Giants Won by 7  Wickets
Matchsummary.PreMatchCommentary:
Match 58 of the Indian Premier League between and will take place at the Rajiv Gandhi International Stadium in Hyderabad. The hosts have been inconsistent this season and thus find themselves at the second-last spot on the points table with just 4 wins out of their 10 games. SRH will need to win all their games to stay in the playoff contention. The positive for the home camp is that they have managed to get over the line in 2 out of their last 3 fixtures. Abhishek Sharma has shown good form after being promoted in the batting order while Rahul Tripathi has been their top run-getter. Glenn Phillips and Klaasen have fared well in the recent encounters but the concern is the form of their Skipper Aiden Markram who has struggled so far. The pace unit has many big names but has not been able to replicate the same in their performances. Markande with 11 wickets is their top wicket-taker. LSG on the other side started well but have lost their momentum thereafter, the team has just won 2 out of their last 7 fixtures. Mayers has been striking well at the top and QDK played a solid knock in the previous game but the concern remains in the middle order where the Likes of Hooda, Krunal Pandya, and Marcus Stoinis have failed to get going. The spin attack consisting of Ravi Bishnoi, Amit Mishra, and Skipper Krunal Pandya has done a good job but the pacers have leaked runs. LSG would look to find form and bounce back to winning ways while SRH will fight to live another day in the tournament! 

 

HEAD TO HEAD:

 

PITCH REPORT: 
 Matthew Hayden:  "  The square boundaries are 63 metres and 64 metres respectively, while the straighter hit is 73 metres. The wicket looks quite dry, it's flat and hard and there won't be much movement. 170-180 runs seem likely."

 

GROUND DIMENSIONS:

 

VENUE STATS:
MATCHES IN 2023 AT HYDERABAD: 
WON BAT FIRST: 4
WON BAT SECOND: 1
AVG 1ST INN TOTAL: 171
AVG 1ST INN WIN SCORE: 178

 


TOSS:
WINS THE TOSS AND ELECTS TO FIRST

 

Aiden Markram, Skipper: "  We are going to bat, looks like a good pitch. It will be on the dry side. Hopefully, we get a big score and put that scoreboard pressure on LSG. You have to balance the conditions and what's working for the team. In day games the pitch won't change too much. We are in an exciting position, hope it brings out the best in us and we make it. We have a batting all-rounder Sanvir Singh who comes in."

 


 
Krunal Pandya, Skipper: "    We would have batted first too, but we don't mind bowling either. It has been a season full of ups & downs. You have to play good cricket, that's what matters. The wicket looks good and it will play the same. We have two changes. Prerak Mankad and Yudhvir Singh are in for Deepak Hooda and Mohsin Khan".
Matchsummary.PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-6 Overs) :-

SRH- 56/2 (9.3 rpo, 10x4, 0x6)  || LSG- 30/1 (5.0 rpo, 4x4, 0x6)

Middle Overs (7-15 Overs) :- 

SRH- 74/3 (8.28 rpo, 5x4, 3x6)  || LSG- 84/1 (9.3 rpo, 7x4, 3x6)

Death Overs (16-20 Overs) :- 

SRH- 52/1 (10.4 rpo, 3x4, 5x6)  ||  LSG- 71/1 (7.9 rpo, 4x4, 7x6)

 

SRH managed to score 182 after winning the toss and electing to bat first. Powerplay yielded 56 runs but LSG came back well in restricting the scoring in the middle over slab. Krunal Pandya picking two big wickets of Markram and Phillps was the pick of the bowlers for LSG while Klaasen scored 47 at a strike rate of 162 top scored for the Super Giants. In response, LSG started slow but a well-composed partnership of 73 between Prerak Mankad who came in at number 3 and Marcus Stoinis kept LSG in the hunt. SRH was in control for most part of the innings but an onslaught from Nicholas Pooran made it look easy to chase down the total. The Southpaw from West Indies smashed 44 runs from 13 balls to take LSG home with 4 balls to spare. LSG once again make their way back in the top 4 moving another step closer to the spot in the playoffs. 

 

Aiden Markram: "It was a good score, I thought 180 was par. We batted nicely, but probably lacked one partnership that could have got us to the 200-run mark. The wicket got slower throughout the day, we would have taken this total at the start, to be honest. Pressure is an interesting thing, and the guys tried their best. When you are put under the pump by high-quality players like Marcus Stoinis and Nicholas Pooran, you will be tested. Now It's about the guys using the next three games as opportunities, they must make it count."

 

Krunal Pandya: "With the way they were going I thought 200 was likely, but we pulled it back at the end, especially by Yash Thakur and Avesh Khan. At this level anything is possible, we had the belief and with players like Marcus Stoinis and Nicholas Pooran. We knew we had to go and there was nothing special luckily it paid off for us and Abhishek over-changed the momentum. Prerak Mankad coming in for his first season and to come out and bat like that shows a lot about his character, really happy for him to come out here and score those runs."

 

Prerak Mankad: "Most important game for us, my score does not matter to me, whichever team I play I want to contribute. I was trying to hit the spinners and couldn't connect, I knew Mayank would try to get me out and I have played against him in domestic cricket, so took my chance. Thanks to the management for giving me this opportunity. "

Matchsummary.MatchName: Mumbai Indians vs Gujarat Titans
Matchsummary.TossDetails: Gujarat Titans Won The Toss And Elected To Field
Matchsummary.TossText: Won The Toss And Elected To Field
Matchsummary.PreMatchCommentary:
will play host to the in Match No. 57 of the Indian Premier League. The hosts have done well lately winning 3 out of their last 4 fixtures. What stands out is MI's performance while chasing, the team has been able to chase down 200+ targets with ease. Ishan Kishan is providing flying starts while Suryakumar Yadav back in his elements is the major reason behind MI's recent success in run chases. Nehal Wadera and Tilak Varma in the middle order have displayed that they have the temperament to do well at this level. The likes of Cam Green and Tim David make the batting look formidable, to say the least. The bowling side of things is in the hands of Piyush Chawla who has picked 17 wickets so far. The pace attack will be managed by Behrendorff and Chris Jordan who has been inducted as a replacement of Jofra Archer. The defending Champions on the other side have been the most consistent team losing only 3 out of their 11 games. All their departments have  fired and there is no real weakness within the camp. Shubman Gill is the top scorer while Saha has been given complete freedom to attack from ball one. Hardik Pandya has a few fifties to his name while Vijay Shankar too has displayed signs of good form. Likes of Miller, Abhinav Manohar and Rahul Tewatia provide that extra cushion for the middle order to play freely. Mohammad Shami and Rashid Khan with 19 wickets apiece have done exceedingly well while Mohit Sharma and Noor Ahmed who joined the team rather late have fit into their roles perfectly. It is a mouth-watering contest between GT's bowling and MI's batting. Considering the pitch, recent record and the quality the two possess in their batting, it would not be wrong to say that a score over 200 is definitely on the cards!

 

                                                                                                

 

 

FUN FACT:   HAS NEVER LOST A GAME ON THE 12TH OF MAY!  CAN CREATE AN UPSET FOR THE HOME TEAM FANS AT THE WANKHEDE? 

 

KEY BATTLES TO WATCH OUT:

MOHAMMAD SHAMI VS ROHIT SHARMA

PIYUSH CHAWLA VS HARDIK PANDYA

 

Ground Dimensions :

 

 

                                                                       

 

 

PITCH REPORT: 
Sanjay Manjrekar and Aaron Finch:  " 'It is a red soil wicket today. 61m and 67m are the square boundaries while the straight fence is at 72m. The pitch looks similar to that of the other night against RCB. There is a bit of moisture on top of the surface which means there could be a bit of swing too, especially in the first 3-4 overs, and a hint of turn if the captain is brave enough to go for a spin in the powerplay. But this is a beautiful wicket to bat on, winning the toss and chasing down the target later on is the ideal thing to do. No score is safe at Wankhede.

 

                                                                                      

 

 

TOSS:
WINS THE TOSS AND ELECTS TO FIRST

 

                                                                                        

 

Hardik Pandya, Skipper: "  We will bowl. Looks like a nice wicket, Dew could have an effect later on, so batting second would be ideal. We realize the importance of every game, just need to stick to our plans and play a good brand of cricket. It's important to learn from your losses, rectify and not repeat the same.  God has been kind that we don't have injuries. we are going in with Same 11 tonight ."


 
Rohit Sharma, Skipper: "    We would have done the same, we need to bat and bowl really well. Things are coming along nicely in the last few games. We understand where we stand at the moment and need to just focus on the game at hand. One match at a time. It's not been ideal in terms of injury management, but we'll have to deal with it and that's what the guys have done. We've spoken about not letting external factors affect us. We're playing with the same eleven as the last game".
Matchsummary.PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-6 Overs) :-

MI- 61/0 (10.1 rpo, 7x4, 3x6)  || GT- 48/3 (8.0 rpo, 8x4, 0x6)

Middle Overs (7-15 Overs) :- 

MI- 90/3 (10.0 rpo, 8x4, 5x6)  || GT- 82/5 (9.1 rpo, 5x4, 5x6)

Death Overs (16-20 Overs) :- 

MI- 67/2 (13.4 rpo, 7x4, 4x6)  || GT- 61/0 (12.2 rpo, 3x4, 7x6)

 

 

coming to the party at the back end of the league having won 4 out of their last 5 games. MI got off to a flying start after being asked to bat first by Hardik Pandya. 61 runs without losing a wicket set a great platform for the middle order to come and express themselves. Ishan Kishan was instrumental in the first six while Skipper Rohit Sharma managed to get some runs under his belt. But the onslaught began while Suryakumar Yadav unleashed the beast within. SKY single-handedly took the attack to the opposition despite losing partners at the other end. Playing some breathtaking shots to all corners of the park led him to his maiden IPL 100. Rashid Khan picking four wickets was the only bowler who caused problems for the MI batters. Chasing 219 was never going to be easy, especially after losing 3 wickets within the powerplay. MI spinners kept chipping in with wickets and the middle order could not cope with the ever-increasing asking rate. Mumbai were well on course for a big-margin victory but Rashid Khan had different plans. The Afghani All-rounder out of nowhere led the counterattack of his own. Khan smashed 10 maximums and 3 fours remaining unbeaten on 79 from just 32 balls. Akash Madhwal picking up 3 wickets for just 31 runs was the pick of the bowlers for MI. GT fell short by 27 runs in the end. 

 


Hardik Pandya, Skipper: "  It was like from our team only Rashid Khan turned up tonight. The way he bowled, the way he batted, it was tremendous overall. Don't have to try much after this result, have to keep it simple. As a group, we weren't there tonight. In bowling also we were very flat. Did not have clear plans or didn't execute them either. Wicket was very flat but I felt we gave 25 runs extra. Suryakumar Yadav is one of the best batters in T20 cricket. You saw what he can do if you don't execute your plans ."


 
Rohit Sharma, Skipper: "    It was indeed an interesting game especially from our point of view, happy to get the two points. It's pleasing to bat first and then come out and defend the total. We kept picking wickets and in this format, you have to do that, great bowling effort from our bowlers. SKY has got confidence in his abilities. We wanted to keep the right-left combination but SKY came in and said no, he wanted to go in. That is the kind of confidence he has and which rubs off on others.".

 

 

Suryakumar Yadav is the Player of the Match

Suryakumar Yadav: " Yes you can say that this was one of my best T20 innings. Whenever I score runs the team should win. Most importantly we batted first today and said that we would keep the same tempo when you are chasing 200-220. There was a lot of dew on the ground, it was there from the 7-8th over and I knew what shots to play on the wicket, I was not thinking about hitting straight, I had two shots in mind , one over the third man and one over fine leg. I practice them before the game, so when I come into the game I am very clear and just go express myself."

Matchsummary.MatchName: Kolkata Knight Riders vs Rajasthan Royals
Matchsummary.TossDetails: Rajasthan Royals Won The Toss And Elected To Field
Matchsummary.TossText: Won The Toss And Elected To Field
Matchsummary.PreMatchCommentary:
Match 56 of Indian Premier League 2023 will see the taking on the Royals from Rajasthan at the iconic Eden Gardens in Kolkata. Both teams have secured 10 points winning 5 out of their respective 11 matches. The only thing that separates them is the NRR which finds on the 5th position on the points table one ahead of their opposition. The Visitors started the tournament on a high note and also occupied the top place on the points table for a brief period but lost their way thereafter. RR has lost 5 out of their last 6 encounters and have underperformed despite all their players being in decent form. The openers Jaiswal and Buttler have been successful in getting the team off to a good start while Samson has done a fair job at number three. Padikkal and Jurel have looked promising while the team will require their finisher Hetmyer to step up and get going as we come close to the business end of the tournament. Yuzi Chahal has been the top wicket-taker with 17 against his name while Ashwin has complimented him well from the other end. Boult and Sandeep Sharma will lead the pace attack. KKR on the other side have come back into the tournament in some fashion. The team has won 3 out of their last 4 games and has the winning momentum on their side. Skipper Nitish Rana has been the top run-getter for KKR while Roy who has 2 fifties in 5 games has been able to get KKR off to a flying start. Rinku Singh has taken up the responsibility of finishing the innings while Andre Russell getting some runs in the previous games makes the batting lineup look destructive. Varun Chakravarthy is the spearhead and has been able to provide breakthroughs at crucial moments. Other spinners Narine and Suyash Sharma have done a good job playing second fiddle. The two teams have all the ingredients to make this an exciting contest at Eden Gardens!

 

                                                                                                             

 

 

Ground Dimensions : 

 

 

                                                                                                  

 

 

 

PITCH REPORT: 
Rohan Gavaskar:  " The square boundaries are between 55 and 73 meters around the ground. The same pitch was used in the last game, where the degree of turn was 2.3, up from 1.5 in previous games. The spinners need to hit a good length to allow the pitch to play its course. There will be runs and the spinners from both teams will be in business."

 

VENUE STATS:
MATCHES IN 2023 AT KOLKATA: 
WON FIRST : 3
WON SECOND: 1
AVG 1ST INN TOTAL: 212

 

 

KEY BATTLES TO WATCH OUT FOR:

VARUN CHAKRAVARTHY VS SANJU SAMSON

R.ASHWIN VS NITISH RANA

 

TOSS:
WON THE TOSS AND HAVE ELECTED TO FIRST

 

                                                                                       

 

Sanju Samson,  Skipper: " We will field first. We need to adapt according to our strengths and weaknesses. We have a couple of changes Trent Boult replaces Kuldip Yadav, and KM Asif replaces Murugan Ashwin. Joe Root will bat at number 4. We have had some difficult games for the bowlers, but we need to move on and the morale of the team is high ."


 
Nitish Rana, Skipper: "    I think we're getting the type of pitches that suit us, looks on the drier side. But We still have to play good cricket, take one game at a time and earn 2 points. We have one change, Anukul Roy comes in for Vaibhav Arora. It was overcast last night but does not seem to be that wet according to me, so we are playing that extra spinner and adding some depth to the batting as well".
Matchsummary.PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-6 Overs) :-

KKR- 37/2 (6.1 rpo, 3x4, 2x6)  || RR- 78/1 (13.0 rpo, 10x4, 4x6)

Middle Overs (7-15 Overs) :- 

KKR- 79/2 (8.8 rpo, 4x4, 4x6)  || RR- 73/0 (10.2 rpo, 5x4, 6x6)

Death Overs (16-20 Overs) :- 

KKR- 33/3 (6.6 rpo, 1x4, 2x6)

 

A night to remember, two records broken, and history created. First, it was Yuzi Chahal who became the highest Wicket taker of the league, and then Yashasvi Jaiswal who smashed a half-century in just 13 balls. were spot on to bowl first after winning the toss and restricted KKR to just 37 runs in 6 overs. The middle over slab was dominated by RR spinners, especially Yuzi Chahal who picked four wickets and gave nothing away to the opposition. were reduced to just 149. In response, Jaiswal smashed 26 runs from the first over from Nitish Rana and thereafter there was no shift in the momentum. A clean sweep for the Royals where Jaiswal finished unbeaten on 98 (47) and Samson playing second fiddle scoring 48 from 29. A win like this will boost RR's NRR which will definitely help them go further in the tournament. 

 

Sanju Samson, Skipper: "  I didn't need to do anything tonight. Just put the bat on the ball and watch him play. He enjoys batting in the powerplay we have seen that. I think it is time to give Yuzi the tag of legend. We are grateful to have him on the team. He knows what to do and what not when the ball is given to him. He bowls at the death as well, very pleasing for me as a captain ."

 


 
Nitish Rana, Skipper: "    You have to praise Jaiswal, the way he played.  It was a 180 pitch as I mentioned at the toss, our batting wasn't good and that's the result of us dropping 2 points tonight. He was batting well right through the tournament, so I thought a part-time spinner could perhaps make him complacent, that was the plan, but he played superbly and those things do happen".

 

 

Yashasvi Jaiswal is Player of the Match

Yashasvi Jaiswal: " This is always on my mind, to go out and do well. It is not like everything I wanted happens, I prepare well and I trust in myself. I know the results will come. The winning shot was a great feeling, I wanted to finish the game, and winning the game has been my aim. I'm blessed and grateful, I'm trying my best. I think the net run rate was the only thing on our minds, I and Sanju Samson were only talking about finishing the game quickly. I think it happens in the game, it gives me responsibility to do even better."

Matchsummary.MatchName: Chennai Super Kings vs Delhi Capitals
Matchsummary.Commentss: Chennai Super Kings Won by 27  Runs
Matchsummary.TossDetails: Chennai Super Kings Won The Toss And Elected To Bat
Matchsummary.TossText: Won The Toss And Elected To Bat
Matchsummary.Comments: Chennai Super Kings Won by 27  Runs
Matchsummary.PreMatchCommentary:
The showdown between and will take place at the MA Chidambaram Stadium in Chennai. The hosts are sitting nicely on the second position with 6 wins out of their 11 matches. MSD and Co have been consistent and all their departments are firing. Devon Conway has scored 458 runs so far and is in the race for the orange cap while his partner Ruturaj Gaikwad has complimented him well from the other end. The middle order looks formidable in the presence of Shivam Dube and Ajinkya Rahane while Ravindra Jadeja and Moeen Ali add depth to both bowling and batting. CSK would be happy with the way Tushar Deshpande has been performing, the pacer has scalped 19 wickets and is right on top of the highest wicket-takers list. Pathirana is another bowler that has impressed everyone with the way he has gone about his business at the death. A confident looking CSK would be looking to get one step closer to securing a berth in the playoffs against a team that is at the last spot on the points table. The points table fails to tell the complete story as DC after straight losses have come back winning 4 out of their last 5 games. DC went past RCB chasing down a target of 182 runs in just 16.4 overs. Phil Salt's 87 runs off 45 deliveries was the highlight of the match. DC's Top Four of Skipper David Warner, Phil Salt. Mitchell Marsh and Rilee Roussouw look in good form. Spinners Kuldeep Yadav and Axar Patel would be expected to come good at Chepauk where the surface has assistance for spin. Will DC win and live another day or will CSK once again come good at their fortress? 

 

 

                                                                                                                                          

  

Ground Dimensions :

 

 

                                                                                                     

 

 

PITCH REPORT: 
Matthew Hayden and Simon Doull::  " "Gorgeous evening in Chennai. The square boundaries are 61 meters and 68 meters and it is 75 meters straight down the ground. As usual here in Chennai, the pitch is nice and dry, it's very hard but a little hollow and it just begs the question of why there are so many runs that we are actually seeing here at Chepauk this year. will it turn? I think it will.

 

Venue Stats :

 

                                                                                                 

 

TOSS:
WINS THE TOSS AND ELECTS TO  FIRST

 

                                                                                                 

 

MSD, Skipper: " We will bat. We have played a few matches on this pitch. There are chances that this wicket will slow down. We try to keep it simple and want to keep reiterating the same thing.  Try to execute your plans."


 
David Warner, Skipper: "   Looks a bit dry. The boys have come out with the right attitude. We had to work on our powerplay batting and would look to do that today as well. Try and execute on this wicket as much as you can".
Matchsummary.PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-6 Overs) :-

CSK- 49/1 (8.1 rpo, 7x4, 0x6)  || DC- 47/3 (7.8 rpo, 4x4, 3x6)

Middle Overs (7-15 Overs) :- 

CSK- 68/4 (7.5 rpo, 1x4, 4x6)  || DC- 44/3 (4.8 rpo, 1x4, 2x6)

Death Overs (16-20 Overs) :- 

CSK- 50/3 (10.0 rpo, 2x4, 3x6) ||  DC- 49/2 (9.8 rpo, 5x4, 1x6)

 

Another win for at their fortress. spinners kept things tight and kept chipping with wickets until the 13th over when the run rate was just 6.79 r.p.o. Dube and Rayudu smashed 23 runs in the 14th over from Lalit Yadav which tilted the momentum in CSK's favour. A fine cameo of 20 from 9 balls from the World's best Finisher MSD made sure CSK get to a fighting total of 167 on a slow track at Chepauk. In response, DC had a dismal start losing 3 wickets in the powerplay even before spinners came to operate. Manish Pandey and Rilee Roussouw gathered 59 runs from 59 balls but the asking rate just kept increasing as CSK spinners gave nothing away. DC was able to compile only 44 in the middle overs and there was very little scope left to stage a comeback. In the end, it was a very comfortable victory for CSK by 27 runs. 

 

David Warner, Skipper: "   Losing three wickets in the powerplay is not acceptable. We lost a wicket in the 1st over which has been happening frequently. We understand that our opening combination is crucial but has failed to fire. We lost a wicket to a run-out which did not help the cause either. We threw wickets away not that the bowlers bowled too well. Put too much pressure on ourselves in chasing down a  gettable total. To sum it up, we needed a better powerplay. We couldn't rotate the strike in the middle". 

 

MSD, Skipper: " It turned more in the second half.  Our spinners use a lot more seam than some of the other bowlers. We did not know what's a par score. That's why I wanted the bowlers to bowl their best deliveries but not look for wickets every delivery. That's when you start not bowling well. I felt 166-170 was a good score. But as a batting unit, we could have done better. The good thing is Moeen Ali and Ravindra Jadeja got a chance to spend time in the middle. As we get closer to the last phase of the tournament, it's important that everybody has a few deliveries under their belt. We need to be happy with our batting."

 

 

Ravindra Jadeja is Player of the Match

Ravindra Jadeja : " : Its a beautiful sight for a Spinner when the ball is gripping, turning and holding in the wicket. We practice here, we know the ideal length and pace to bowl at. The visiting team needs time to adapt to the conditions. I am just happy that the team is doing well."

Matchsummary.MatchName: Mumbai Indians vs Royal Challengers Bengaluru
Matchsummary.TossDetails: Mumbai Indians Won The Toss And Elected To Field
Matchsummary.TossText: Won The Toss And Elected To Field
Matchsummary.PreMatchCommentary:
The action moves to Wankhede where the will lock horns with the in Match 54 of the Indian Premier League 2023. Both teams have had a similar run so far having won 5 out of their 10 matches. The hosts will look to bounce back after their loss against CSK at Chepauk and gain winning momentum as we enter the business end of the tournament. MI's concern has been their top order which has been inconsistent especially the form of their Skipper Rohit Sharma. The middle order comprising of Tilak Varma, Nehal Wadera, and Tim David is doing well while Suryakumar Yadav regaining his form is the biggest positive for MI. The pace bowling department has never looked settled and Jofra Archer being ruled out does not help the cause either. Piyush Chawla is the only silver lining in that bowling set up with 17 wickets this season. On the other side, RCB bats top-heavy with Virat Kohli, Faf Du Plessis, and Glenn Maxwell all in good striking form. Kohli has already scored 6 half centuries while Faf has compiled 5 this season. They will fancy their chances against MI bowling which has leaked runs this tournament. RCB's major concern is its middle order which has failed to fire and have any major impact so far. Although, Mahipal Lomror did show signs of good form in their previous encounter against DC in a losing cause. Mohammad Siraj has been doing well and Harshal Patel does complement him well enough. With Josh Hazlewood in the mix, RCB's Pace bowling looks much better. Both teams have similar issues and would want to address them at the earliest. A batter-friendly pitch and small boundaries mean that we are in for a high-scoring thriller in this epic rivalry between MI & RCB!

 

                                                                                                           

 

KEY BATTLES TO WATCH OUT FOR:

VIRAT KOHLI VS PIYUSH CHAWLA

ROHIT SHARMA VS MOHAMMAD SIRAJ

 

Ground Dimensions : 

 

 

                                                                                                                              

 


PITCH REPORT: 
Aaron Finch:  "I think this pitch will be an absolute beauty to bat on. There is nice grass cover right through, on a red soil surface. that keeps enough pace in it so it assists the spinners much. I think it'll spin in the first half, there's just a touch of moisture on top. So it'll get better as the game progresses."

 

TOSS:
WON THE TOSS AND HAVE ELECTED TO  FIRST

 

                                                                                                                       

 

 


Rohit Sharma, Skipper: " We will bowl first. We prefer that as we have chased down targets here, it's a good pitch to bat later on. Looks like a typical grass covering. Not sure how it's going to play, but we are hoping for the best. We understand how important this game is, what's in our control we will look to execute. Rest will take care of itself. Jofra Archer is pulled back, we got Chris Jordan, who will make his debut today."

 


 
Faf Du Plessis, Skipper: "  Generally you chase here because of the nature of this ground. The big score always creates scoreboard pressure. Hopefully, we get wickets early in their innings. There are a lot of teams fighting for that third and fourth spot, we need to play a good brand of Cricket. We have One change  Vyshak comes in for Karn Sharma".
Matchsummary.PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-6 Overs) :-

RCB- 56/2 (9.3 rpo, 10x4, 1x6)  || MI- 62/2 (10.3 rpo, 5x4, 5x6)

Middle Overs (7-15 Overs) :- 

RCB- 96/3 (10.7 rpo, 5x4, 6x6)  || MI- 112/0 (12.4 rpo, 10x4, 5x6)

Death Overs (16-20 Overs) :- 

RCB- 47/1 (9.4 rpo, 6x4, 1x6)  ||  MI- 26/2 (20.0 rpo, 1x4, 3x6)

 

A run-fest at Wankhede where we got to watch 37 fours and 21 Sixes combined! did not get the best of starts losing Kohli and Anuj Rawat before the end of 3rd over. But Faf and Maxwell brought RCB back into the game by taking the attack to the opposition. Faf scored 65 from 41 balls while Maxwell smashed 68 at a staggering strike rate of 206. MI bowled a few economic overs at the backend and managed to restrict RCB under 200. got off to a flying start courtesy of Ishan Kishan who compiled 42 from just 21 balls. But the real onslaught began when Suryakumar Yadav unleashed his beast mode and displayed once again what he is made of. The batter showed his complete array of shots and smashed RCB bowlers to all corners of the park. Nehal Wadera going at a strike rate of 150  looked like playing second fiddle to Surya who was going over 200. SKY scored 83 from 35 while Nehal Wadera remained unbeaten on 54. chased down the target with 3.3 overs to spare. With this win, MI climbs up to the 3rd spot while RCB slips to the 7th place in the points table. 

 

Rohit Sharma, Skipper: " It is a good batting pitch. If you apply yourself, you can get runs on the board. Akash Madhwal was with us last year as well and we are aware of the skillset he has. We wanted to give him a role this time. He is a confident player. He leads his Uttarakhand team too. He is a  thinking Cricketer. We restricted them to less than 200 which was a great effort. Nothing is safe at this venue. In the last four games we have seen an excess of 200 have been scored. Most of the teams are taking risks and it is coming off."

 


 
Faf Du Plessis, Skipper: "   Honestly, I think we were at least 20 runs short, in the context of the pitch. They bat deep and chase well. We could not capitalize in the last five overs, and thus we could not post a bigger total. The bowlers needed to make sure you take the pace off. They capitalized on the first 6 overs with the pace on. Suryakumar Yadav is one of the best, when he gets going, it's difficult to shut him down". 

 

Suryakumar Yadav is Player of the Match

Suryakumar Yadav: Much needed from the team's point of view. I am very happy to win a home game like this. I mean they come up with a plan. They tried to make me hit the bigger part. Take the pace off and bowl slowly. I said Nehal let's hit it hard and hit it into the gaps and run hard. Your practice has to be the same as what you intend to do in matches. I know where my runs are. We have open net sessions. I know my game. I don't do anything different.

Matchsummary.MatchName: Kolkata Knight Riders vs Punjab Kings
Matchsummary.Commentss: Kolkata Knight Riders Won by 5  Wickets
Matchsummary.TossDetails: Punjab Kings Won The Toss And Elected To Bat
Matchsummary.TossText: Won The Toss And Elected To Bat
Matchsummary.Comments: Kolkata Knight Riders Won by 5  Wickets
Matchsummary.PreMatchCommentary:
will take on the Punjab Kings in Match 53 of the Indian Premier League at the Iconic Eden Gardens Stadium in Kolkata. The hosts find themselves at the 8th spot on the points table having won only 4 out of the 10 games this season. They will now have to win all their matches to make it to the playoffs. KKR is coming into this fixture on the back of a win against SRH and would look to use the momentum to get past PBKS which is not doing that great either. are one spot above KKR with 5 wins from their 10 clashes this season. Shikhar Dhawan and Co. lost their previous encounter against MI but will be confident coming into this clash as they have already won against KKR in the first leg clash this year. Skipper Nitish Rana and Rinku Singh are in good batting form while Varun Chakravarthy has been their top wicket-getter so far. Looking at the PBKS side, Liam Livingstone holds the key to their success. Jitesh Sharma striking at 165 is another X factor that PBKS possesses and would be a player to watch out for in this all-important encounter. Looking at how the pitch has played at this venue, one can expect a high-scoring encounter between two sides that are looking for some change in their fortune. 

 

                                                                                                                               

 

KEY BATTLES TO WATCH OUT FOR:

SHIKHAR DHAWAN VS VARUN CHAKRAVARTHY

DRE RUSS VS RAHUL CHAHAR

 

Ground Dimensions :

 

 

                                                                                                                                        

 

PITCH REPORT: 
Mark Howard and Pommie Mbangwa. : "The off-side is short just 58 meters but over to the leg-side it is quite big,71 meters. The average first innings score is 222 this season. When you look at the wicket, it's got a mosaic effect and looks quite firm. It looks a little drier than last time. It might spin a little more. The bowlers need to make them hit to the longer square side, be it pace or spin. Change of Pace is vital or you will go for runs up on a good surface.

 

VENUE STATS:
NIGHT MATCHES IN 2023 AT KOLKATA: 
WON BAT FIRST : 3
WON BAT SECOND : 0
AVG 1ST INN TOTAL: 222

 


TOSS:
WON THE TOSS AND HAVE ELECTED TO FIRST

 

                                                                                                                        

 

 

Shikhar Dhawan, Skipper: "  We will bat first. The wicket looks a bit dry, we would like to put a good total on the board and defend it. It is a good thing that we are able to score 200 every game. We have one change, Bhanuka Rajapaksa comes in place of Mat Short ."

 


 
Nitish Rana,  Skipper: " The wicket does look to be on the drier side. We are going with the same team. We wanted to bat first so that spin can come more into play later in the game. The boundary is short for both RHB and LHB, it does not matter much. "
Matchsummary.PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-6 Overs) :-

PBKS- 58/3 (9.6 rpo, 11x4, 0x6)  || KKR- 52/1 (8.6 rpo, 8x4, 1x6)

Middle Overs (7-15 Overs) :- 

PBKS- 66/2 (7.3 rpo, 5x4, 3x6)  ||  KKR- 58/2 (7.8 rpo, 8x4, 1x6)

Death Overs (16-20 Overs) :- 

PBKS- 55/2 (11.0 rpo, 5x4, 3x6)  ||  KKR- 72/2 (14.4 rpo, 4x4, 4x6)

 

Another thriller in this Incredible Premier League! did well to restrict to 179 at a venue where 200 is always on the cards. Credit to Varun Chakravarthy who scalped three wickets for just 26 runs. KKR used 13 overs of Spin and conceded just 6.7 r.p.o and accounted for 5 wickets. Shikhar Dhawan top scored with 57(47) runs for PBKS. KKR got off to a decent start courtesy of Jason Roy who smashed 8 boundaries taking the attack on the opposition. Nitish Rana once again led by example and compiled 51 from 38 balls. But Economical spells from Rahul Chahar and Nathan Ellis kept PBKS in the game. It was anyone's game after the dismissal of Nitish Rana in the 16th over. It was Dre Russ and Rinku Singh in the middle when KKR needed 51 from the last 4 overs. The big man took the responsibility and showed his power-hitting prowess smashing 3 fours and 3 big sixes under pressure. Arshdeep bowling the ultimate over did well to take the game to the last ball when just 6 were needed from one one-over. Rinku Singh hitting a four when two were needed from the last ball showed his temperament under pressure once again! KKR move up to the 5th spot on the points table and now have won three out of their last four encounters! 

 

 


Nitish Rana, Skipper:  We were just in search of that one big over where we could get more than 10 and then get the momentum. 10 matches have gone by, we were all waiting for Russell's comeback innings. We knew that he was one inning away. Our bowlers did not do well at the death, I was furious that we conceded that many because it seemed like a 160-165 run wicket. When Rinku Singh was batting, the whole crowd was chanting 'Rinku, Rinku'. That is what he has earned this year. I've been at this franchise for many years now, I'm used to the Eden crowd screaming 'Russell, Russell' but to hear them shout 'Rinku, Rinku' makes me feel very proud. Respect to him!

 

Shikhar Dhawan, Skipper: "It's not a great feeling, we ended on the losing side. Was not an easy track to bat, felt that we had a decent total. In the end, they did well to go over the line. Another great effort from Arshdeep Singh, the way he has bounced back from the last game. I feel we lack a good off-spinner, that is where we are conceding when left-handers come in. 

 

Andre Russell is Player of the Match

" The ball was gripping so we just wanted to stick it out and take it deep. They miss their mark and we could swing it around then. Needing 36 off the final two, it was very much gettable. I flicked one into the stands without really swinging at it. And that six-over point put the icing on the cake. I wanted to finish the game off, but we have a finisher this year in Rinku. Rinku Singh told me what if the ball beats you, should we go for the run? I said for sure, I have faith in him to finish it last ball. I get goosebumps seeing him doing what he's been doing. I have company at the back end, he soaks the pressure off and he's been here for years now, a really hard-working guy. It is a good feeling to get back in form, really is"

Matchsummary.MatchName: Rajasthan Royals vs Sunrisers Hyderabad
Matchsummary.TossDetails: Rajasthan Royals Won The Toss And Elected To Bat
Matchsummary.TossText: Won The Toss And Elected To Bat
Matchsummary.PreMatchCommentary:
will play host to in Match 52 of IPL 2023. The hosts were able to start the season on a high note but have lost track thereafter losing 4 out of their last 5 games. The major reason behind that is the form of Jos Buttler and Sanju Samson. Even Shimron Hetmyer has not been able to fire as the left-handed West-Indian batter has 5 single-digit scores in the last five games. This puts more responsibility on the shoulders of Jasiwal, Padikkal, and Jurel who have been scoring runs for RR. Yashasvi Jaiswal is number 4 on the list of run-getters this season and already has scored a century in this year's edition. The spin attack is well-rounded in the presence of Ashwin and Chahal while the Pace attack is in the safe hands of Boult and Sandeep Sharma. RR will look to bounce back against SRH which has been out of sorts this season. One of the best-looking sides on paper has failed to deliver so far and finds themselves in a situation where they have to win all games to stand a chance to make it to the playoffs. Aiden Markram, Mayank Agarwal, Harry Brook, and Abhishek Sharma have been inconsistent while Klaasen has been good in patches. The fast bowling unit comprising T Natarajan, Bhuvaneshwar Kumar, Umran Malik, and Marco Jansen has not had any major impact. The only positive is the performance of the leg spinner Mayank Markande who is SRH's top wicket-taker with 11 scalps to his credit. SRH will have to think out of the box if they want to get past the Royals at Sawai Mansingh Stadium. 

 

Head to Head:-

 

PITCH REPORT: 
Samuel Badree and Nick Knight: "68 and 63 are the square boundaries, and 78 meters straight down the ground.  This is the same pitch that was used in the last game. There was nothing wrong with the pitch, it was a good pitch. But if you see now,  the color of the grass has changed a little bit, and it's a little bit drier and the cracks are a little bit wider.  A score around 180 or a little less is likely here."

 


TOSS:-
wins the toss and elects to  first!

 

Sanju Samson, Skipper: "  We will bat first. Conditions favor the same. We believe that the climate has been different. There won't be much dew in the later half. And sometimes it suits us also. We've had hard and honest chats n the camp about how to go about and what's not working out. Would like to come back stronger. Due to a few injury issues in the team. Joe Root makes his debut."

 


 
Aiden Markram, Skipper: " Would have also batted first as well. It's a used wicket. Some games have gone down to the wire. Most of the time we've played decent cricket but not been able to get a win. We have a couple of changes,  Glenn Phillips comes in for Harry Brook and Vivrant Sharma makes his debut tonight."
Matchsummary.PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-6 Overs) :-

RR- 61/1 (10.1 rpo, 8x4, 2x6)  || SRH- 52/1 (8.7 rpo, 7x4, 1x6)

Middle Overs (7-15 Overs) :- 

RR- 93/0 (9.3 rpo, 6x4, 6x6)  ||  SRH- 94/1 (10.4 rpo, 4x4, 5x6)

Death Overs (16-20 Overs) :- 

RR- 60/1 (12.0 rpo, 5x4, 3x6)  ||  SRH- 71/4 (14.2 rpo, 4x4, 7x6)

 

 

Another tight match, another last-ball finish in this incredible league.The best league in World Cricket for the very same reason. SRH showed us today that it is not over until the last ball is bowled or we can say the last legal ball is bowled. once again got off to a flying start courtesy of Yashasvi Jaswal and Jos Buttler who put together 54 in the first five overs. Samson coming in at number three seemed in a similar mood. Samson and Buttler put together 138 and took the team to a mammoth total of 214. Buttler top scored with 95 (59) while Skipper Samson remained unbeaten on 66  from 38. In response, with a different opening pair came out all guns blazing and took the attack on the opposition from ball one. All top 4 got starts and kept up with the tempo of the run chase. Abhishek Sharma was the top scorer with 55 from 34. RR came back into the match when Yuzi Chahal was brought back into the attack in the 16th over when he dismissed Klaasen and then went on to pick Tripathi and Markram in the 18th over of the game. It looked very difficult for SRH to score 41 from 12 balls, especially with two new batters at the crease. But Glenn Phillips smashing 3 sixes and a four against Kuldip Yadav changed the entire scenario. SRH had momentum on their side until a spectacular catch from Shimron Hetmyer helped dismiss the dangerous Phillips. It was up to Samad to make 17 runs from the last over from Sandeep Sharma. Sharma was delivering well under pressure and even got the wicket of Samad but did not realize that he had overstepped. Abdul Samad striking a six off the last ball to take the team home was the most dramatic finish we have seen this year. The table is once again opened up and it is still anyone's game!

 

Sanju Samson, Captain: "To be honest, we can never feel that the game is won. But that no ball made us realize that. We played really well with the bat, but the credit has to go to them. I think if it's a no-ball you have to bowl it again. We were happy with the target that we posted. I don't know if we could have scored more. Each and every stage of the tournament we have to play our best cricket and that's what we aim to do."

 

Aiden Markram,   Captian: "Emotions turned quite quickly, nice for us to get over the line. Chasing 215 isn't easy, and the guys contributed well to chase a big target. We knew in a quick outfield like this we'll score more than expected, but we had to be aggressive. Abhishek started up off, and then Tripathi gave him company. Those cameos from Phillips and Klaasen were crucial. I think you got to train it and put yourself under pressure."

 

Glenn Phillips is the Player of the Match

Glenn Phillips: "It was a situation where it was going to go one of two ways. Happy to get out on top of this one. We are all here to do our job, this is what the team needed today. Fantastic for it to pay off, and I had so much fun today out there. I was disappointed the actual slot ball didn't go over the fence. I felt I left a lot out there with 17 needed off the final over, but then Samad did what he did and obviously we got that little bit of luck with the no ball."

Matchsummary.MatchName: Gujarat Titans vs Lucknow Super Giants
Matchsummary.TossDetails: Lucknow Super Giants Won The Toss And Elected To Field
Matchsummary.TossText: Won The Toss And Elected To Field
Matchsummary.PreMatchCommentary:
Match 51 of the Indian Premier League will take place at the Narendra Modi Stadium between and the Super Giants from Lucknow. The Defending Champions have been the most consistent team this year and thus find themselves at the top of the points table with 7 wins from their 10 matches so far. The top order consisting of Shubman Gill, Wriddhiman Saha, and Hardik Pandya has been firing while the likes of David Miller, Abhinav Manohar, and Rahul Tewatia add that much-needed depth to the batting lineup. Mohammad Shami and Rashid Khan have looked after the bowling department and are second and third on the list of highest wicket-takers respectively with 18 scalps apiece. Noor Ahmed has been impressive while Mohit Sharma has looked good at the death for the Titans. GT will fancy their chances against a team that has been rather inconsistent in their recent encounters. LSG has lost 3 out of their last 5 matches. will miss the services of their Skipper KL Rahul who has been ruled out of the league due to an injury and Krunal Pandya will take charge in his absence. Kyle Mayers holds the key when it comes to the batting side of things. Marcus Stoinis and Nicholas Pooran will need to shoulder the responsibility in KL Rahul's absence. Spinners Amit Mishra and Ravi Bishnoi have been doing a good job of picking wickets at the same time in restricting the scoring of the opposition. The concern is the fast bowling department where only Naveen Ul Haq has been impressive and the rest have failed to have a major impact so far. Looking at the current form of LSG it will be a daunting task to end the losing streak against the table toppers at their home. 

 

PITCH REPORT: 
Daren Ganga : "This pitch has a name embellished on it, quite synonymous with India and there's a lot of grandeur inspiration out here in the middle. Straight is 74 meters, and 63 and 68 are the square boundaries. We are playing on pitch number 7 and no extremities here, just the heat. Very little grass cover and it looks a little dark brown because of the heat this surface is expected to dry out and it could turn out to be good for batting. Both spinners and pacers can be in business wickets in this venue."

 

Head to Head:-

 

TOSS:-
wins the toss and elects  first!

 

Krunal Pandya, Skipper: "  We will bowl. It's a dream come true for us brothers, leading our respective sides. Overall the wicket is expected to play the same. We have a solid batting unit and we fancy our chance to chase down the target. We have played good cricket and have a good chance to make it to the top 4. Quinton De Kock comes in, Naveen Ul Haq is not playing the game. 


 
Hardik Pandya, Skipper: " We wanted to bat. So, Happy with the toss result. It's an emotional day, our father would have been proud. This is something happening for the first time, a proud moment for our family. One Pandya will definitely win today. It's about expressing ourselves and not worrying about the result. We need to play good cricket. One forced to change, Josh Little is on National Duties for Ireland, Alzarri Joseph comes in his place."
Matchsummary.PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-6 Overs) :-

GT- 78/0 (13.0 rpo, 6x4, 6x6)  || LSG- 72/0 (12.0 rpo, 12x4, 2x6)

Middle Overs (7-15 Overs) :- 

GT- 98/1 (10.9 rpo, 5x4, 6x6)  ||  LSG- 58/3 (6.4 rpo, 2x4, 2x6

Death Overs (16-20 Overs) :- 

GT- 51/1 (10.2 rpo, 4x4, 3x6)  ||  LSG- 41/4 (8.2 rpo, 2x4, 3x6)

 

A victory by a huge margin of 56 runs for the Titans at their home. came out all guns blazing after being asked to bat first by Krunal Pandya. Wriddhiman Saha took charge in the powerplay and Shubman Gill replicated the same later on in the innings. The duo put together a match-winning partnership of 142 runs putting GT in the driver's seat. Saha smashed 81 at a strike rate of 188 while Gill remained unbeaten on 94 from 51. Cameos from Skipper Hardik Pandya and David Miller ensured that GT post a huge total of 227 on the board. were on their mark in the powerplay but courtesy Kyle Mayers and QDK. Mayers scored 48 from 32 while QDK smashed 70 from 41 in his first appearance this season. The team lost track in the middle overs where Noor Ahmed and Rashid Khan applied breaks on LSG's scoring rate. LSG scored Only 58 runs in the middle over and lost 3 wickets. Thereafter there was very little scope for LSG to stage a comeback as the required rate went above 15 r.p.o. Mohit Sharma using his slower variations accounted for four wickets for just 29 runs. Hardik wins the battle between the Pandya Brothers and gets one step closer in sealing a place in the playoffs. 

 

 

Krunal Pandya, Skipper: We gave too many 1st innings. When it is 227, you have to go from ball one. The surface played quite well as the batters said it was a good wicket to bat on. they were 10-14 above par. God has been kind to us, our family is proud, and Mom is happy to see both of us doing well. She said at the end of the day, two points will come home only. There is so much of love between me and Hardik, there's hardly any banter. 

 

 

Hardik Pandya, Skipper: " I can't ask anything more from the team. I feel Rashid Khan's catch was a game-changer, until then it was even Stevens. We were both driving at 100kph as a team but that catch caused a bump in their chase. (When asked about Krunal Pandya) My love towards him is very strong,  It would have been nice if it was a little tighter and we had won, he could have also had some bragging rights."

 

 

 

Shubman Gill is Player of the Match

Shubman Gill: ": They were going quite well in the powerplay but our bowlers came back really well especially Mohit bhai. It's an honor to be able to share his Saha experience, I stand next to him at first slip, it is phenomenal with the way he keeps going, he's been playing since the first edition. I didn't get much of a strike in the first few overs but it is important to not get carried away with what your partner is doing. I had not hit sixes in the last two matches and today I struck a few, I always keep working on my skills."

Matchsummary.MatchName: Delhi Capitals vs Royal Challengers Bengaluru
Matchsummary.TossDetails: Royal Challengers Bengaluru Won The Toss And Elected To Bat
Matchsummary.TossText: Won The Toss And Elected To Bat
Matchsummary.PreMatchCommentary:
Hello and welcome to the live commentary of the raging contest between the Delhi Capitals and Royal Challengers from Bangalore. Delhi Capitals are currently at the bottom of the table with 3 wins in 9 matches but have momentum on their side as they won 3 out of their last four games. RCB is one of the teams with 5 triumphs in 9 games and when RCB hosted DC in the reverse fixture, RCB defended the target and owned two points. Will it be  #ROARMACHA or #PLAYBOLD tonight??

 

Head to Head:-
In 29 faceoffs, RCB are way ahead in the tally with 18 wins and DC has claimed 10 games. Will the Red and Black maintain their streak or will the Red and Blue capitalize on their winning momentum?

 

                                                                      

 

Venue Stats:-
81 matches have been played at Arun Jaitely Stadium in which 35 have been won by teams batting first and 45 by the teams chasing the target. The average score at this venue is 162.

Ground Dimensions :

 

                                                                        

 

Pitch Report:-
Danny Morisson & WV Raman: "The pitches are normally dry at this venue and we don't see too many high scores here. The average score at this venue this year is 165. This pitch is dry and has got a few cracks in it and the bowlers will fancy their chances as well. The fast bowlers have taken 29 wickets here, while the spinners have picked 22 wickets. The spinners have to bowl fuller lengths on this sluggish surface."

 

Toss:-

Faf du Plessis has called it right at the toss and  will  first!

 

                                                                         

 

 

Faf du Plessis, Royal Challengers Bangalore Captain: "We are going bat first. Looks like a dry surface and hopefully there won't be dew tonight. We got to assess the conditions and post a good score. With this new impact player rule, you can be flexible. We have batted well in the top four, and we have done the bulk of the scoring. Kedar Jadhav comes into the team."

 

David Warner, Delhi Capitals Captain: "We would have batted first as well. We are coming out here with a lot of energy, passion, and belief. We can get only better from where we are. Looking forward to doing well in all facets of the game. Mukesh Kumar comes in for Anrich Nortje who has gone home and Mitch Marsh will be the other overseas player."
Matchsummary.PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-6 Overs) :-
RCB - 51/0 (8.5 rpo, 7x4, 1x6) || DC - 70/1 (11.7 rpo, 7x4, 5x6)

Middle Overs (7-15 Overs) :-
RCB - 75/2 (8.3 rpo, 4x4, 3x6) || DC - 96/1 (10.7 rpo, 7x4, 5x6)

Death Overs (16-20 Overs) :-
RCB - 55/2 (11.0 rpo, 5x4, 2x6) || DC - 21/1 (10.7 rpo, 1x4, 2x6)

 

get their 4th win in the last 5 matches  after a 7-wicket victory against the Royal Challengers Bangalore. After having opted to bat first, RCB made a strong start in the Powerplay - scoring 51 runs without losing any wicket, propelled by a half-century from Virat Kohli, who in the process also became the 1st batter to reach the landmark of 7000 runs in the IPL , after which an attacking half-century from Mahipal Lomror in the middle ensured that RCB rode the momentum, but a great final two overs from Delhi where they conceded just 15 runs ensured that Bangalore ends their innings on 181.

In the chase, Delhi's famed top order came into action with Warner and Salt making the most of the Powerplay to score 70 runs in it, the most for the team this IPL, after which Salt continued his assault supported by cameos from Marsh and Rossouw to ensure that Delhi chases down the target with 20 balls to spare to boost their NRR and continue their winning momentum!

 

Faf du Plessis, Skipper: "I thought 185 was a pretty good score. The dew took the spinners out of the game, but credit to the Delhi batters as well. We felt like 185 was a par score and we needed one big over that could take us to 200, that would have made a difference. I was really pleased to see Lomror at 5 and he played really well. That's the nature of the slow pitch, you always try to come in the first six overs and try to get on top of the game."

 

David Warner, Delhi Capitals Skipper: "I thought it was a par score, the ball was skidding. But the way we came out led by Phil Salt paved the way. Our intention was to take on Siraj, he's been bowling well and taking wickets early, his wickets have been bowled or LBW so we wanted to drag his length back. Credit to the way the bowlers bowled, Anrich is not there but Ishant is leading the pack with Khaleel, and Kuldeep and Axar as well have been brilliant. It is all about momentum, we are finding the right balance at the right time. Now we go to Chennai and try to get a performance there."

 

Phil Salt is the Player of the Match

Phil Salt: "We spoke before the game about being positive. We knew the wicket was slow and low, and we spoke about playing off the back foot. I thought 180 was par, I felt we would have to bat really well to get there. Loving the support, especially here in Delhi."

Matchsummary.MatchName: Chennai Super Kings vs Mumbai Indians
Matchsummary.Commentss: Chennai Super Kings Won by 6  Wickets
Matchsummary.TossDetails: Chennai Super Kings Won The Toss And Elected To Field
Matchsummary.TossText: Won The Toss And Elected To Field
Matchsummary.Comments: Chennai Super Kings Won by 6  Wickets
Matchsummary.PreMatchCommentary:
Hello and welcome to the live coverage of the El Classico of the Indian Premier League where the  are hosting their rivals . All eyes are on today's game for the excitement it brings and also considering the points table. The winner of today's match will comfortably climb to number two. Mumbai have played nine and has won five matches out of them while CSK has also won five but are one ahead in the number of matches and in the points (One point for the rain-affected game). When the last time these two giants met, the Chennai boys claimed victory quite comfortably chasing the target. But here at Chepauk, the records favor Mumbai Indians against the home team. The whistles will blow loud undoubtedly but can the PALTANS continue their supremacy here?

 

Head to Head:-
The rivalry has taken place on 35 occasions and the are leading the tally with 20 victories and  have 15 wins. At Chepauk both teams have clashed 7 times and CSK only won their first two matches in 2008 and 2010 after which MI have their domination.

 

                                                                       

 

Venue Stats:-
In 69 games played at M.A Chidambaram Stadium, Chennai the teams batting first have won 43 times. The average first innings score here is 163.

In this IPL the average 1st Innings score is 182 and in the four matches played here, both the teams batting 1st and chasing have won 2 each. Last Sunday in the day game played here against Punjab, the men in Red chased down 200 successfully. Will we see another last-ball thriller today?

 

Ground Dimensions :

 

                                                                   

 

Pitch Report:-
Aaron Finch & Pommie Mbangwa: "It's a pretty big ground, but there is a short boundary on one side (61m), the other square boundary is at 70m and the straight boundary is 73m. The pitch is hard as a rock, it has been a high-scoring ground this year with a lot of 200+ scores. It's a good batting pitch, but it'll be a touch slow and a touch low, against the new ball. It's sweaty and overcast, so teams would want to bat second"

 

Toss:-

MS Dhoni has called it right at the toss and will field first!

 

                                                                

 

MS Dhoni, Chennai Super Kings Skipper: "We will bowl first. A bit of rain is expected, that's one reason and also looks like a good wicket and we want them to set a target for us. Every individual has worked well and we have improved every game, there have been some slip-ups but we need to finish well. We're playing with the same squad."

 

Rohit Sharma, Mumbai Indians Skipper: "We had a couple of good games and it's just about continuing the momentum. It's been challenging to find the right players and the right combinations. We know our strengths and the players who can fit in. We have two changes, Kumar Kartikeya is out, and a debut for Raghav Goyal. Tilak Varma is slightly injured and he is replaced by Tristan Stubbs"
Matchsummary.PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-6 Overs) :-
MI - 34/3 (5.7 rpo, 4x4, 0x6) || CSK - 55/1 (9.2 rpo, 7x4, 2x6)

Middle Overs (7-15 Overs) :-
MI - 59/1 (6.6 rpo, 6x4, 0x6) || CSK - 68/2 (7.6 rpo, 2x4, 4x6)

Death Overs (16-20 Overs) :-
MI - 46/4 (9.2 rpo, 5x4, 1x6) || CSK - 17/1 (6.4 rpo, 0x4, 1x6)

 

get back to winning ways and notch up their first victory in 4777 days against arch-rivals  in Chepauk to move to the 2nd position in the table!
