After opting to field first, MSD and CSK got off to the perfect start in the Powerplay, getting the early momentum by picking up 3 wickets inside the Powerplay, courtesy of a double-wicket over from Deepak Chahar . Nehal Wadhera led the charge with the bat for Mumbai notching up a half-century  but an excellent spell  from Pathirana in the end made sure that MI were restricted to 139/8 at the halfway mark.

 

In the chase, CSK once again dominated the Powerplay and got the initial momentum, scoring 46 runs in the first 4 overs and bringing the required run rate under 6, after which contributions from the middle order and a quickfire knock from Shivam Dube in the end, ensured that Chennai crossed the finish line with 14 balls to spare.

 

Rohit Sharma, Captain: "We didn't bat well enough, didn't put enough runs for the bowlers to defend. We had an off-day as a batting unit. We needed an Indian batter to bat in the middle overs against spin after unfortunately losing Tilak Varma, but we lost three wickets for just 16 runs. Piyush Chawla is bowling really well and the other bowlers need to rally around him, everyone has to come forward and chip in contributions.

 

MS Dhoni, Captain: "It was a very crucial game. Last few games the results have not gone in our favour and so it is good to be back on the winning side. I was doubtful about the decision at the toss. I wanted to bat first but the think tank thought about the rain, and I was slightly outnumbered, so we went with the majority. If there is some kind of confusion then we sit and talk about it. Bowlers who don't have a very clean action are difficult to pick, it is not the pace or variations, but the consistency. I would prefer Pathirana not to play red-ball cricket and play all the ICC tournaments, he would be a great asset for Sri Lanka."

 

Matheesha Pathirana is the Player of the Match

Matheesha Pathirana: "My journey with CSK started last year. I came in as a replacement and played only two games last season, but this season I am playing more and I am happy. Team management gives me a lot of confidence. This is my best bowling figure in T20 cricket and I am happy with the performance."

Matchsummary.MatchName: Rajasthan Royals vs Gujarat Titans
Matchsummary.TossDetails: Rajasthan Royals Won The Toss And Elected To Bat
Matchsummary.TossText: Won The Toss And Elected To Bat
Matchsummary.PreMatchCommentary:
Two teams that have carried on their form from the previous season and have not disappointed their fans are and . The two teams are placed in the top 4 on the points table because of their consistent performance so far. GT who are the table toppers have won 6 out of their 9 matches while RR has clinched 5 out of their 9 games this year. Although the Royals have lost 3 out of their last 4 encounters, they will still fancy their chances against a team that has already been defeated by them once this year. Yashasvi Jaiswal has been the key player when it comes to RR's batting and also occupies the second spot in the race for the orange cap with 428 runs at an average of nearly 48. Skipper Sanju Samson and Jos Buttler's form has dipped in the last few games but it is a matter of one shot that these talented batters find their rhythm again. Sandeep Sharma and Trent Boult in charge of the pace attack have done well while the spin attack is world-class, to say the least. It will be an interesting battle between RR spinners and GT middle order that has the likes of Vijay Shankar and Hardik Pandya who are good players of spin. Shubman Gill at the top is GT's top scorer while the likes of Abhinav Manohar and Rahul Tewatia have been able to strike lusty blows whenever opportunity arises. A good game of Cricket awaits at the Sawai Mansingh Stadium between two top sides who are most likely to make it to the playoffs this season. 

 

                                                                      

 

 

KEY BATTLES TO WATCH OUT FOR:

JOS BUTTLER VS MOHAMMAD SHAMI  &  SANJU SAMSON VS RASHID KHAN

 

Ground Dimensions :

 

                                                                        

 

PITCH REPORT: 
Deep Dasgupta and  Nick Knight: "The square boundaries are 63m and 68m while it is 78m straight down the ground. I don't think this is the easiest pitch to sum up. It has bare patches but there are also spots where there is a good grass cover. May not be two-paced, but could play low. A total of 170-180 is on the cards."

 

TOSS:-
wins the toss and elects first!

 

                                                                        

 

Sanju Samson, Skipper: "  We will bat first. It's a bit tough to read how the pitch will play. we will bat a few overs and figure out how it is playing. The brand of cricket we are playing is really good. We were expecting something like this from Jaiswal who has spent a lot of time with the team Management and the support staff. We have one change, Adam Zampa comes in place of Jason Holder." 


 
Hardik Pandya, Skipper: " We were going to do the same, bat first. Not that we prefer only chasing, just the team has been out in such situations and has performed under pressure while chasing. If the home captain does not know to what to do first, It's good to bowl first and see what happens. We have to be at our best against a top side in RR"
Matchsummary.PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-6 Overs) :-

RR- 50/2 (8.3 rpo, 5x4, 2x6)  || GT- 49/1 (8.1 rpo, 9x4, 0x6)

Middle Overs (7-15 Overs) :- 

RR- 50/6 (5.5 rpo, 4x4, 0x6)  ||  GT- 70/3 (9.3 rpo, 5x4, 3x6)

Death Overs (16-20 Overs) :- 

RR- 18/2 (7.2.8 rpo, 0x4, 1x6)

 

settles scores with Rajasthan Royals with a huge win in their backyard. did not get the best of starts losing Buttler early once again and Jaiswal getting run out in the 6th over. Samson was looking good but could manage only 30 before losing his wicket to Josh Little. RR kept losing wickets at regular intervals and there was no other batter to cross even the 15-run mark. Credit should be given to the Afghan Spin duo of Rashid Khan & Noor Ahmed that managed to pick 5 wickets for just 39 runs in 7 overs between them. While chasing a meager total of 118 Shubman Gill and Wriddhiman Saha got GT off to a solid start going at 8.1 r.p.o in the powerplay. A 71-run stand put GT in the driver's seat and left very little scope for RR to stage a comeback. Hardik Pandya coming in at number 3 meant business from ball one and looked in some hurry to get done with the game. The GT Skipper smashed 39 from just 15 balls and took GT home with 6.1 over to spare. 

 

Sanju Samson, Skipper: "  We had a tough night. We did not have a good powerplay to start with and struggled against the GT spinners. They bowled in good areas and kept on taking some crucial wickets at regular intervals. We need to see if the unit is playing good cricket. We need to pull our socks up for the crucial games coming up in the coming week.


 
Hardik Pandya, Skipper: " Rashid and Noor are very confident about what they want to do, we only have conversations when things aren't going right. I feel Wriddhiman Saha is one of the best Keepers in the World, not easy to pick Rashid Khan and Noor Ahmed with the speeds at which they operate. I made some judgment errors in the last game, but today my job was half done by the time Shubman Gill got out. I don't shy away from accepting mistakes, accepting is key to success for me."

 

Rashid Khan: ": I am doing nothing different, just making sure I don't let the batters pick me. I'm trying to reduce the difference between leg-spin and googly, keeping the grip way. I keep working on it in the nets, want to make it perfect. Sometimes I lose my line & length, but I know that the batters will face problems once I get my line and length straight. I bowled a few bad balls and was penalized. So I just look back and talk to the video analysts who help me with my  pitch maps"

Matchsummary.MatchName: Sunrisers Hyderabad vs Kolkata Knight Riders
Matchsummary.Commentss: Kolkata Knight Riders Won by 5  Runs
Matchsummary.TossDetails: Kolkata Knight Riders Won The Toss And Elected To Bat
Matchsummary.TossText: Won The Toss And Elected To Bat
Matchsummary.Comments: Kolkata Knight Riders Won by 5  Runs
Matchsummary.PreMatchCommentary:
will lock horns with the Knight Riders from Kolkata in Match No.47 of IPL 2023. Both the teams have had a similar run so far winning just 3 matches this season. The Home Team Sunrisers are coming into the game on the back of a win against the Delhi Capitals in their previous encounter. The Orange Army is a competent Unit on paper but has not replicated the same in their performances. Mayank Markande has been impressive so far, the leggie has scalped 10 in 6 games. Aiden Markram and Co. have been struggling to find the right combination and the same can be seen from the number of changes they have made to their batting order and side. on the other side have not done well either but will be looking to bounce back to winning ways on a track where there is assistance for Spinners. KKR's Spin trio can be expected to play a vital role today. Nitish Rana-led KKR have some tremendous talent in the side but have been patchy is their performances. The side has failed to click as a unit and would look to avenge the loss suffered against SRH in the first leg Clash in the league. Although both sides are lying at the bottom of the points table, it is not all over for any side and a win here can very well spark a change in their fortunes. 

 

                                                                        

 

Ground Dimensions :

 

                                                                   

 

PITCH REPORT: 
Daren Ganga: "'We are playing on pitch number 2 today and the dimensions are quite different. The side boundaries are 62m and 65m respectively while the straight hit is 74m. A typical Hyderabad pitch, bereft of grass, and it's very hard. Because of some rain in the past 2 days, it might be a bit slow initially. Spin could be vital tonight with the pitch expected to turn."

 

TOSS:-
wins the toss and elects first!

 

                                                                        

 

Nitish Rana, Skipper: "  We will bat first. Looks like a good wicket to bat on, hopefully we'll post a decent score and then defend it. We're not thinking ahead of the game, just have to take one match at a time.  The Impact rule allows us to play an extra batter who can get us some extra runs. We have Two changes - Jason Roy is back in place of David Wiese and Vaibhav Arora replaces N.Jagadeeshan." 


 
Aiden Markram, Skipper: " We would have batted too, we do well with a score on the board. We need to start being consistent and tonight is an opportunity to go out and change things, looking forward to a positive outcome this game. Our Batting needs to improve, bowling has been superb, but we've underperformed with the bat. We have a few changes in our sixteen with Kartik Tyagi back in the group"
Matchsummary.PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-6 Overs) :-

KKR- 49/3 (8.1 rpo, 7x4, 0x6)   || SRH- 53/3 (8.8 rpo, 6x4, 2x6)

Middle Overs (7-15 Overs) :- 

KKR- 80/2 (8.9 rpo, 6x4, 5x6)  ||  SRH- 81/2 (9.0 rpo, 6x4, 3x6)

Death Overs (16-20 Overs) :- 

KKR- 42/4 (8.4 rpo, 3x4, 1x6)   ||  SRH- 32/3 (6.4 rpo, 3x4, 0x6)

 

A tough pill to swallow for SRH. They were cruising along in the run chase but somehow managed the game to slip out from their hands. managed to put up a fighting total of 171 runs on the board after electing to bat first. Skipper Nitish Rana and Rinku Singh top scored with 42 & 46 respectively. T Natarajan was the pick of the bowlers for SRH picking two wickets for 30. lost three wickets in the powerplay but ensured that runs kept coming at a brisk rate. Aiden Markram and Klaasen compiled a 70-run partnership from just 47 balls and put SRH in the driver's seat. Shardul Thakur picking up Klaasen and a poor shot from Markram brought KKR back in the game. KKR was still not on top as only 38 runs were needed off 30 balls with Samad and Jansen at the crease. But the 16th bowled by Varun Chakravarthy conceded only 4 runs tilting the momentum in KKR's favour. The mystery spinner gave only 8 runs from the 3 overs bowled at the death and won the game for KKR. SRH fell short by 5 runs while needing 9 of the final over!

 

Nitish Rana, Skipper: "  In the middle, we bowled a few loose overs and took a gamble with Shardul Thakur and Vaibhav Arora. They managed to get both set batters out and that's how we made a comeback in the match. We had to get them out because if they bat till the end, then surely the game would have gone out of our reach. I had a doubt if I had to go with spinner or pacer but backed my spinner to do the job." 

 


 
Aiden Markram, Skipper: " Difficult pill to swallow. Had to play good cricket at the death but did not get it right.  Klaasen batted wonderfully, I struggled in the beginning and that was part of the reason we ended up short by 5 runs. The bowlers were good throughout, we were throwing ourselves on the field as well. Tough one to take, we learn from this. If we can’t execute, we need to go back in the nets and plan better for the next encounters. Hopefully, a do or die situation brings out the best in us"

 

 

Varun Chakaravarthy is the Player of the Match

Varun Chakaravarthy: " My heartbeat was touching 200 in the last over, but I wanted them to hit to the longer part of the ground. The ball was slipping a lot and my best bet was the longer side and that was my only hope. I conceded 12 runs in my first, Markram hit me for 2 fours and thereafter I came back well in the second spell,  that's how the game goes. Last year I was bowling around 85kmph, I was trying out many things and I realized that I needed to work on my revolutions I did work on it and it is paying off"

Matchsummary.MatchName: Punjab Kings vs Mumbai Indians
Matchsummary.GroundName: Punjab Cricket Association IS Bindra Stadium
Matchsummary.TossDetails: Mumbai Indians Won The Toss And Elected To Field
Matchsummary.TossText: Won The Toss And Elected To Field
Matchsummary.PreMatchCommentary:
The second of the Weekday double-header game will take place at the IS Bindra Stadium in Mohali between and . The hosts have been displaying positive intent this season and have won 5 out of their 9 clashes. They are coming off an impressive win against CSK in a last-ball thriller at Chepauk. The Openers Shikhar Dhawan and Prabhsimran have been able to provide starts while the middle order consisting of Atahrva Taide, Liam Livingstone and Jitesh Sharma have looked promising in the last few games. Raza and Sam Curran provide balance in both the departments which gives that extra cushion to the Skipper to play with. Arshdeep has been on top of his game but the spinners are yet to come to the party. The Pacers will fancy their chances against a MI top order which has been inconsistent so far. Both Rohit Sharma and Ishan Kishan have not been in the best of forms. will be relieved with their star batter Suryakumar Yadav coming back to form. Cam Green and Tilak Varma have been making vital contributions while Tim David was able to showcase his power-hitting prowess in the previous encounter against RR where the big man smashed 45 runs in just 14 balls. MI's spin department is in the safe hands of Piyush Chawla but the pace bowling remains a concern as none of the pacers has had any impact so far in the tournament. The last encounter was won by the Punjab Kings and it will interesting to see MI's approach going into this away fixture.

 

                                                                                                                                                                  

 

Ground Dimensions :

 

                                                               

 

PITCH REPORT: 
Simon Katich: "It is pitch 4, this is one of the highest-scoring venues in the country. It's the same surface that was used in match 27 for PBKS vs RCB. There is some good cover of grass on the pitch, but there are some bad patches too, so it might be two-paced. The team winning the toss is expected to bowl first here."

 

TOSS:-
wins the toss and elects to  first!

 

                                                                   

 

Rohit Sharma, Skipper: " We will bowl first. It looks like a good pitch, we have chased down targets pretty well and so we will stick to our strength which is chasing. You always want to have a target in front of you on such wickets. It's important to be composed, we have played enough IPL games and understand that things can change any time. You can see how the points table is at the moment. We have one change, Riley Meredith is injured so he misses out. Akash Madwal comes in." 
 


Shikhar Dhawan, Skipper: " We would have bowled first too.  The pitch looks good, it's not dry, won't change much in the course. It's good to bat first and post a big total, looking forward to it. Mentally you need to be relaxed and calm, as a leader I need to make sure that the team environment is calm and energy is positive. Matthew Short and Nathan Ellis come in. Atharva Taide and Rabada miss out."
Matchsummary.PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-6 Overs) :-

PBKS- 50/1 (8.3 rpo, 7x4, 1x6)  || MI- 54/2 (9.0 rpo, 6x4, 2x6)

Middle Overs (7-15 Overs) :- 

PBKS- 95/2 (10.5 rpo, 9x4, 2x6) || MI- 116/0 (12.9 rpo, 13x4, 4x6)

Death Overs (16-20 Overs) :- 

PBKS- 69/0 (13.8 rpo, 4x4, 4x6)  ||  MI- 46/2 (13.1 rpo, 4x4, 3x6)

 

are good at chasing and they proved that once again, getting past 215 with absolute ease! PBKS hoisted a big total on the board courtesy of some brilliant batting from Liam Livingstone and Jitesh Sharma. The duo put together 119 runs from just 52 balls with the Englishman scoring an unbeaten 82(42). Only Piyush Chawla delivered with the ball for MI picking 2 wickets for just 29 runs. Chasing 215 under lights was never going to be easy, especially after losing Rohit Sharma in the first innings of the run chase. But Ishan Kishan and Suryakumar Yadav had different plans in mind. The duo started the counter-attack and PBKS bowlers had no answers to their onslaught. Ishan Kishan's 75 from 41 and Suryakumar Yadav's 66 at a strike rate of 212 put in the driver's seat and gave very little scope to to stage a comeback. PBKS did manage to get the duo out but Tilak Varma and Tim David were equally potent to strike some lusty blows in the end. MI in the end made it look easy chasing down 215 with 1.1 overs to spare. 

 

Shikhar Dhawan, Skipper: " We started off nicely and thought it was a good total, but unfortunately were not able to defend it. Rishi Dhawan bowled really well at the start, but from the other end, we bowled a little too much outside off. Even to Suryakumar Yadav, we couldn't get our line & length. It was a good wicket and using cutters could have worked more I think Nathan Ellis bowled really well and other bowlers could not step up today."

 

Rohit Sharma, Skipper: " One extra batter makes a big difference. The average score is around 180 this IPL. Just shows where the game has reached. Ishan Kishan and SKY batted brilliantly in the middle overs. Before the start of the tournament, we had a chat as to how we wanted to play our cricket. Not to think of the results. We want to go out there and just express ourselves. You will win one and lose one. Ishan Kishan has been working really hard for the last couple of weeks. He does pack a punch.  I wouldn't say conceding 200+ is a worrying factor but three to four games we have conceded more than 200." 

 

 

Ishan Kishan is the Player of the Match

Ishan Kishan: " The wicket was good for batting, I kept for 20 overs and knew how it was playing. If it is in my hitting arc, I will go after it.  I thought of stepping out and hitting as the Keeper wasn't standing up. The message was to watch the ball and hit. I think it doesn't matter much when you are chasing 215. Last game we did well and finished in the last over. I try to finish it as soon as possible. Happy with my performance. Thank You"

Matchsummary.MatchName: Lucknow Super Giants vs Chennai Super Kings
Matchsummary.GroundName: Bharat Ratna Shri Atal Bihari Vajpayee Ekana Cricket Stadium
Matchsummary.TossDetails: Chennai Super Kings Won The Toss And Elected To Field
Matchsummary.TossText: Won The Toss And Elected To Field
Matchsummary.PreMatchCommentary:
The next clash in the Indian Premier League will see the play host to the four-time Champions . Both the teams are placed in the top half of the points table having done reasonably well. But the recent outings for both sides have been unsuccessful ones. The hosts will look to exploit the home conditions better as the earlier home games haven't been so fruitful. Kyle Mayers is the key in the batting order especially in the absence of KL Rahul who is ruled out of this match due to an injury sustained in the previous game. Nicholas Pooran and Marcus Stoinis have been consistent and would be expected to come good against a tough opponent in CSK. Spinners Ravi Bishnoi and Amit Mishra will be crucial at Ekana where the track is relatively slow & low. Their task will be cut out against a top CSK batting unit that is in good form. Devon Conway is the top run-getter with 5 half-centuries already. Ruturaj Gaikwad has complimented him well from the other end. The middle order of Shivam Dube and Ravindra Jadeja has done a good job too in keeping up the tempo set by the openers. MSD, Moeen Ali, and Ravindra Jadeja add a lot of depth making the batting order look formidable. CSK have a lot of spin options that are good enough to take advantage of the conditions that might just suit them. 

 

                                                                       

 

 

Ground Dimensions :

 

                                                                         

 

PITCH REPORT: 
Danny Morrison & Aarn Finch: "Only 61 meters on one side & the other side is 75 meters. Straight is 78 meters. The pitch is very patchy, with quite a lot of green grass on it compared to what we've seen in the past. But seems very dry beneath. Some plate cracking there as well. Won't be a lot of bounce. Will favour the spinners."

 

VENUE STATS:
4 IPL MATCHES IN 2023 AT LUCKNOW: 
WON FIRST: 2
WON SECOND: 2
AVG 1ST INN TOTAL: 135
LOWEST SCORE DEFENDED:  126

 

TOSS UPDATE: TOSS DELAYED DUE TO RAIN

 

TOSS UPDATE: TOSS IS TO TAKE PLACE AT 3:30 PM, MATCH IS TO START AT 3:45 PM

 

TOSS:-
wins the toss and elects to first!

 

                                                                 

 

MSD, Skipper: " We'll bowl first. The wicket was under covers and it looks a bit tacky, so we'll bowl first. You have to see all conditions and the venue. For us, Deepak Chahar is fit, so he comes in for Akash Singh. On being asked whether this might be the last time here at this venue , You've decided it is my last IPL, not me" 

 

                                                                   

 

Krunal Pandya, Skipper: " We wanted to bat, so no worries. The batters can go out and express themselves. KL not playing this game is a big loss, he's a quality player but it creates an opportunity for the talent we have in the side. We are confident and are looking to play some positive cricket. Manan Vohra comes in and Karan Sharma comes in"
Matchsummary.PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-6 Overs) :-

CSK- 31/3 (5.1 rpo, 4x4, 0x6)

Middle Overs (7-15 Overs) :- 

CSK- 42/2 (4.7 rpo, 0x4, 1x6)

Death Overs (16-20 Overs) :- 

CSK- 52/2 (12.3 rpo, 2x4, 3x6) 

 

Rain plays spoilsport in Match 45 of IPL 2023 between LSG and CSk at the Ekana Stadium in Lucknow. LSG was in a spot of bother after being asked to bat first as the home team lost half the side in 10 overs with just 44 on board. Nicholas Pooran and Ayush Badoni compiled a 50-run stand for the sixth wicket and kept LSG's hope alive. Badoni seemed to be batting on a different track as the youngster smashed 59 runs in 33 balls. It would have been interesting to see how Chennai would bat on this slow and low track but Rain Gods had different plans. Both teams get one point apiece!

Matchsummary.MatchName: Gujarat Titans vs Delhi Capitals
Matchsummary.TossDetails: Delhi Capitals Won The Toss And Elected To Bat
Matchsummary.TossText: Won The Toss And Elected To Bat
Matchsummary.PreMatchCommentary:
In Match 44 of IPL 2023, the Defending Champions will lock horns with the at the Narendra Modi Stadium in Ahmedabad. The hosts have carried on with their last year's form winning 6 out of their 8 games. All the departments have fired and every player is contributing to the team's Success. Shubman Gill at the top is the highest run-getter for GT while Rashid Khan and Mohammad Shami are in the top five wicket-takers list so far. The middle order consisting of Vijay Shankar, Abhinav Manohar, David Miller and Rahul Tewatia has been delivering whenever opportunity arises. The home team are the clear favorites against their opponent DC which is last on the points table. The visitors have won just 2 games out of their 8 and have been struggling to find the right balance. David Warner is scoring runs but the likes of Shaw and Manish Pandey have not had any major impact this year. Mitchell Marsh and Phil Salt need to get runs if DC wants to post a big score on the board. DC spinners Axar Patel and Kuldeep Yadav have done a fair job but the pacers have been leaking runs. Anrich Nortje and Mukesh Kumar's bowling will be tested by a GT batting unit that has been batting with attacking intent from top to bottom. It will be a daunting task for the visitors to defeat the table toppers in their own backyard. 

 

                                                                      

 

PITCH REPORT: 
Nick Knight.: "It might rain a little but at this moment it is dry and fine. The third time the same pitch is being used and most likely the final will be played on this strip as well. There is a nice covering of grass but it’s chopped down a little bit. As per the Groundsman, it's a little bit drier this time around partly because we are expecting a bit of rain and when they put the covers on, they don’t want this to be too moist. There will be a bit of cracks in patches. If you are getting a total of 180-190, you have a good chance to win."

 

VENUE STATS:
4 IPL MATCHES IN 2023 AT AHMEDABAD: 
WON FIRST: 1
WON SECOND : 3
AVG 1ST INN TOTAL: 192

 

 

TOSS:-
wins the toss and elects to first!

 

                                                                        

 

 

David Warner, Skipper: " We will bat. Looks like a nice and dry wicket. Want to put runs on the board and defend then. We have to be positive, we got some youngsters, hopefully, they all will get to showcase their talent tonight. Unfortunately, Mitch Marsh is unwell, so Rilee Rossouw comes in for him. Khaleel Ahmed is back as well. 

 

Hardik Pandya, Skipper: " We were planning to bowl, thought chasing would be a good option. we are clear about the kind of intent and want to stay calm and humble. We are playing the same team."
Matchsummary.PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-6 Overs) :-

DC- 28/5 (4.6 rpo, 3x4, 0x6)  || GT- 31/3 (5.1 rpo, 6x4, 0x6)

Middle Overs (7-15 Overs) :- 

DC- 50/1 (5.5 rpo, 2x4, 2x6)  ||  GT- 48/1 (5.3 rpo, 2x4, 1x6)

Death Overs (16-20 Overs) :- 

DC- 52/2 (10.4 rpo, 4x4, 3x6)  || GT- 46/2 (9.2 rpo, 1x4, 3x6)

 

successfully defend 130 against the best Team in the tournament. DC were off to a horrible start after losing half the side inside the powerplay. Mohammad Shami made the ball talk and the DC top order had no answers to it. The fast bowler picked 4 wickets conceding just 11 runs. A counter-attack from DC began when Batter No. 6,7 & 8 were at the crease. Aman Khan top scored for DC scoring his maiden fifty in IPL. did not start well either, 4 of the top 5 in the batting order managed only single-digit scores. Skipper Hardik Pandya did hold one end up but could not score at a brisk rate. Rahul Tewatia coming in at number 7 did bring GT back in the game after smashing 3 sixes against Anrich Nortje but Ishant Sharma managed to hold on to his nerves in the last over defending 12 runs. GT fell short by 5 runs in the end!

 

Hardik Pandya, Skipper: " We would have taken 129 on any given day, to be honest. We were slow to get off the blocks, but Rahul Tewatia got us back in the game like he always does. I tried my best in the end but it was not to be. I and Abhinav Manohar were hoping to get a couple of big overs in the middle but we couldn’t get going. It was not easy for Abhinav as well and it boils down to how I could not finish the game. Full marks to the bowlers and full ownership I couldn’t finish it. Shami was brilliant and made the ball talk but feel bad for him that we end up on the losing side"

 

David Warner, Skipper: " Our bowlers were simply amazing. Our batters struggled but credit goes to the way Mohd. Shami delivered. We just find ways to lose wickets in clusters, I don't know what's the issue with our batting. We tried playing positively today but failed. We wanted to come out and swing the ball, and get early wickets. Khaleel did well after coming back from injury, and Ishant is forever getting younger. Very happy with their performance 

 

 

Mohammad Shami is the Player of the Match

Mohammad Shami: " I just stick to my plans. Maintain the line and length that we discuss. This wasn't an above-par score. I felt we should have got it. The mistake was losing wickets at regular intervals and partnerships came too late.  Such things happen, We have to move on. "

Matchsummary.MatchName: Lucknow Super Giants vs Royal Challengers Bengaluru
Matchsummary.GroundName: Bharat Ratna Shri Atal Bihari Vajpayee Ekana Cricket Stadium
Matchsummary.Commentss: Royal Challengers Bengaluru Won by 18  Runs
Matchsummary.TossDetails: Royal Challengers Bengaluru Won The Toss And Elected To Bat
Matchsummary.TossText: Won The Toss And Elected To Bat
Matchsummary.Comments: Royal Challengers Bengaluru Won by 18  Runs
Matchsummary.PreMatchCommentary:
Match 43 of IPL 2023 will see two formidable teams clash against each other at the Ekana Cricket Stadium, Lucknow. having won 5 out of their 8 games sit nicely at the second spot on the points table. Kyle Mayers has been in sensational form scoring 4 fifties in 8 games while Skipper KL Rahul has been playing second fiddle pretty well. The middle order looks formidable in the presence of Nicholas Pooran, Marcus Stoinis, and Ayush Badoni who have looked destructive, to say the least. The bowling unit comprising Avesh Khan, Yash Thakur, Naveen Ul Haq, and Ravi Bishnoi has done a reasonable job for the supergiants. They will look to make early inroads in the batting line up which is top-heavy so far. Virat Kohli and Faf have scored 10 half-centuries between them while Glenn Maxwell has shown that he can take apart any bowling unit in a matter of few overs. The concern is their middle order which has failed to get going and end the innings with a flourish. Siraj is the spearhead with the ball and has done a remarkable job in keeping the opposition quiet but other bowlers have been inconsistent in their performances. RCB would want to avenge the previous loss in their own backyard against LSG and settle scores while LSG would focus on continuing the winning momentum that they gained in their previous encounter scoring the second all-time highest score.

 

VENUE STATS:
IPL 2023 AT LUCKNOW: 
WON FIRST: 2
WON SECOND: 2
AVG 1ST INN TOTAL: 152

 

                                                                         

Ground Dimensions :

 

       

 

PITCH REPORT: 
Sanjay Manjrekar and Rohan Gavaskar: "The square boundaries are 72 metres and 63 metres. Straight is 78 metres. It is a black soil pitch, so the bounce is comparatively low. Might not be high-scoring, but one can expect a score in excess of 145" 

 

TOSS:-
wins the toss and elects to first!

 

                                                                

 

Faf Du Plessis, Skipper: "  We will bat. There might be more turn in the second innings. Josh  Hazlewood comes in and Anuj Rawat comes in for Shahbaz Ahmed. 

 

 

KL Rahul, Skipper: "  It is just going to be tough work on this pitch for both teams. We have one change. Avesh Khan is replaced by K Gowtham. Having played here twice, we know that spin will be used more than pace here. Just want to hold our composure during crunch moments."
Matchsummary.PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-6 Overs) :-

RCB- 42/0 (7.0 rpo, 3x4, 1x6)  || LSG- 34/4 (5.7 rpo, 3x4, 2x6)

Middle Overs (7-15 Overs) :- 

RCB- 50/4 (5.5 rpo, 1x4, 0x6)  ||  LSG- 44/4 (4.9 rpo, 1x4, 2x6)

Death Overs (16-20 Overs) :- 

RCB- 34/5 (6.8 rpo, 2x4, 1x6)  ||  LSG- 30/2 (6.0 rpo, 4x4, 0x6)

 

pull off a great win in a low-scoring thriller at the Ekana Stadium. Kohli and Faf got RCB to a steady start after electing to bat first. The duo added 62 runs for the first wicket but none of the other batters were able to cross even the 20-run mark. used 13 overs of Spin and choked the scoring rate of RCB. The Spinners conceded only 73 runs and accounted for 5 dismissals. A target of 127 looked bigger after LSG lost too many wickets in the powerplay. The top order was back in the pavilion without taking any advantage of the powerplay. Karn Sharma was brilliant in the middle overs getting the big wickets of Pooran and Stoinis. Krishnappa Gowtham at no.7 did strike a few lusty blows but failed to take the game deep. RCB settles scores with LSG and avenges the defeat in their backyard. 

 

Krunal Pandya, Stand-in Skipper: "  We did pretty well restricting them to a total of 126. It was a great bowling effort overall. Really happy with the way bowlers have done this year. We would have taken 126 but the batting department failed to execute plans. 

 

 

Faf Du Plessis is the Player of the Match

Faf Du Plessis, Skipper: "  A contrast of what happened at the Chinnaswamy. We played really well in the first six overs and got a steady start. To have a fifty partnership in the six overs was match-changing. It was a good toss to win and batting first was important. Playing spinners here was always going to be difficult. If you can bowl the ball in a good area, it's pretty hard to score.  Before we went on the field, we said to the guys it's a match-winning score and we can do it. Felt if we early wickets in the powerplay, especially with KL not being there, it's going to be difficult. Super happy for Karn Sharma. Just one of those guys who do the hard work all the time but doesn't get the recognition."

Matchsummary.MatchName: Mumbai Indians vs Rajasthan Royals
Matchsummary.TossDetails: Rajasthan Royals Won The Toss And Elected To Bat
Matchsummary.TossText: Won The Toss And Elected To Bat
Matchsummary.PreMatchCommentary:
Wankhede is all set to host Match No.1000 of the incredible Indian Premier League.  will play host to the Royals from Rajasthan. RR has been one of the top teams this year and has shown consistency in all the departments. They are third on the points table on the back of some impressive performances from their batters. The Spin attack is second to none while the Pacers too have managed to put forward some impactful performances. MI are not at their best but the Champion side is just one win away from getting back to their own. An encounter at Wankhede provides an opportunity to come back and gain back the winning momentum. Skipper Rohit Sharma who is the birthday would love a win against a tough opponent in . 

 

HEAD TO HEAD:-

 

TOSS:-
wins the toss and elects to first!

 

 

Sanju Samson, RR Skipper: "  We would like to bat first. Wicket looks like a good one, we are trying to stick to our strengths and put up a total. We are playing a great standard of cricket and the team is in a good space. We have one change, Boult comes in."

 

 

Rohit Sharma, MI Skipper: "  We played last year as well against the same opposition on this day and the result went our way, hopefully, it does today as well. It is a good track and looks a little dry to me. We wanted to bowl first, we want a score in front of us. The season has been up and down, we have played some good cricket and also lacked consistency. We had a good break and hopefully, we can put up a good performance. We have two changes,  Jofra Archer and Arshad Khan are back, in place of Behrendorff and Arjun Tendulkar.."
Matchsummary.PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-6 Overs) :-

RR- 65/0 (10.8 rpo, 7x4, 3x6)  || MI- 58/1 (9.7 rpo, 7x4, 1x6)

Middle Overs (7-15 Overs) :- 

RR- 78/4 (8.7 rpo, 7x4, 4x6)  ||  MI- 92/2 (10.2 rpo, 10x4, 4x6)

Death Overs (16-20 Overs) :- 

RR- 69/3 (13.8 rpo, 6x4, 5x6)  ||  MI- 64/1 (12.8 rpo, 46x4, 5x6)

 

 Pull off a record chase at the Wankhede against a tough opponent in . Rajasthan got off to a flying start courtesy of Yashasvi Jaiswal who was on the charge from ball one. The score in powerplay was 65 at no loss. Jaiswal carried the onslaught till the 20th over scoring his maiden IPL Century. Piyush Chawla and Kumar Kartikeya bowled economically in the context of the game. Chasing 212 was never an easy task, especially after losing the wicket of the Skipper early in the innings. Cameron Green led the counterattack for MI alongside Ishan Kishan who played second fiddle in a 62-run stand. Just when the run rate was increasing, Suryakumar Yadav unleashed his hitting prowess and kept MI in the game. The momentum tilted to MI in the 13th Over when SKY smashed 20 runs off it. It took a stunning catch from Sandeep Sharma to dismiss an on-song Suryakumar Yadav. With 57 needed off four overs, Tim David showed the World what he is capable of and finished things in style by smashing three sixes in the last over. Tim David finished unbeaten on 45 from 14 balls (Sr. 321)

 

 

Sanju Samson, Skipper: "  In the time-out the way Suryakumar Yadav was batting, we were talking about fighting back. Tim David played a special knock. It was kind of getting wet and we were taking our time to wipe the ball. We have had the experience of bowling in such conditions. The way we have been playing either we have won or we have come close. Results do come here and there. We will keep focusing on the process."

 

Rohit Sharma, Skipper: "  Very pleasing to see how we chased the target down. The last game here also came close to the target. We have the ability to back ourselves and chase such totals down.  Tim David has so much ability and power to complete games like these. Injuries keep happening, part and parcel of the game. It is difficult as a captain, but unfortunately, you have to play the conditions and the opposition. We want to be flexible as a team and guys need to be ready for it."

 

 

Yashasvi Jaiswal is the Player of the Match

Yashasvi Jaiswal: " When I scored the century, I was unaware that the ball had gone to the boundary. I just thanked God for the opportunity, I always had this dream and wanted to work on the process and work hard. Results will follow. I keep myself mentally strong and work on my fitness and diet. Organized my life well outside of cricket. "

Matchsummary.MatchName: Chennai Super Kings vs Punjab Kings
Matchsummary.TossDetails: Chennai Super Kings Won The Toss And Elected To Bat
Matchsummary.TossText: Won The Toss And Elected To Bat
Matchsummary.PreMatchCommentary:
The action moves to MA Chidambaram Stadium in Chennai where the Super Kings will play host to the Kings from Punjab. The hosts have been consistent so far having lost only 3 games out of their 8. They are placed well in the top four in the points table and are very likely to make the playoffs. Devon Conway is a major reason behind CSK's success while he is very well supported by Ruturaj Gaikwad from the other end. The middle order of Rahane and Dube has been in sensational form while Jadeja provides that depth in both batting and bowling. The Left arm orthodox has been able to pick crucial wickets at a meager economy. The fast bowling unit which has leaked runs is the only concern for Skipper MSD. Dhawan and Co. at the other end have been very inconsistent and find themselves in the bottom half of the table. Atharva Taide and Jitesh Sharma have been impressive while the Skipper is back in the side, the batting looks formidable. Liam Livingstone is a player to watch out for and would be expected to have an impact if wants to get past at their fortress. Rahul Chahar is the bowler that can cause problems to the solid CSK batting on a track that does have assistance for spin. 

 

HEAD TO HEAD:

                                 

and have faced each other in 27 matches in IPL.  Chennai has won 15 whereas Punjab has come out victorious on 12 occasions.

 

GROUND DIMENSIONS:-

 

PITCH REPORT: 
Samuel Badree and Aaron Finch: " Sun is beaming down. There is a bit of a breeze that might provide some respite. 68 & 63 meters are the square boundaries. Straight down the ground is 78 meters. It is a dry wicket with Very little live grass. Will get slower and lower as the day goes on. CSK spinners have taken 26 wickets this season, PBKS only 10. Top-order batters need to be aware of taking the powerplay on. Have to take risks. Will get harder and harder later on. 180 will be a very good score in a day game here.".                                                                                                                                                                                                                  


TOSS:-
wins the toss and elects to first!

 

MSD, Skipper: "  We will bat first. Looks like a decent wicket to bat on. When you play a day game, the heat is a factor. The fast bowlers can get some rest. In the day game, few players are too early. It is important to be intelligent. Not to be exposed a lot under the sun. IPL is a longish tournament. There will be games that won't go your way. You have to accept the learnings. It is the same team."

 


Shikhar Dhawan, Skipper: "  We would have loved to bat first as well. It is a dry wicket and a day game. We keep on learning lessons from past games. Trying to get better is the goal. Keep the fighting spirit on.  Will go with a positive mindset in this game. Harpreet Brar coming in is the only change."
Matchsummary.PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-6 Overs) :-

CSK- 57/0 (9.6 rpo, 9x4, 1x6)   || PBKS- 62/1 (10.30 rpo, 7x4, 2x6)

Middle Overs (7-15 Overs) :- 

CSK- 89/2 (9.8 rpo, 9x4, 3x6)  ||  PBKS- 67/2 (7.4 rpo, 3x4, 2x6)

Death Overs (16-20 Overs) :- 

CSK- 54/2 (10.8 rpo, 5x4, 2x6)  || PBKS- 72/3 (14.4 rpo, 3x4, 5x6)

 

Not the result the home fans expected at Chepauk. started well with both their openers making most of the fielding restrictions. The openers put together an 86-run stand for the first wicket. Shivam Dube at No.3 managed to strike some lusty blows too. Conway's 92 at a strike rate of 177 made sure that CSK posts a huge total on the board. Chasing 201 was never going to be easy with the spinners in the CSK ranks. Prabhsimran Singh and Shikhar Dhawan came out all guns blazing for the chase. The team reached 50 in just 4.2 overs. Prabhsimran smashed 42 of just 24 balls. Liam Livingstone at no.4 did not waste any time either. Cameos from Jitesh Sharma and Sam Curran took the game deep. The 16th over which conceded 24 changed the momentum in the visitor's favour. Sikandar Raza held his nerves and took the team home by scoring three of the last delivery. Defeating CSK in their own backyard will definitely boost PBKS' confidence going ahead in the tournament.

 

 

Shikhar Dhawan, Skipper: It feels special. Beating Chennai in Chennai is a big thing. Very happy and that shows the character of our team. I was very happy with the way our bowlers went about with their business. They have been very consistent all throughout. Liam has got his touch back and would want him to bat more overs in the middle. Good signs that all are playing well and back in form. 

 


MSD, Skipper: " We need to be prepared in advance about what is to be done. In the last few overs when we were batting, we could have gotten 10-15 runs more. The slower one did grip a bit on the surface. Our batters have been putting in runs consistently. I think 200 was par but we bowled two bad overs which cost us. We know the conditions well but couldn't bowl well. 

 

 

Devon Conway is the Player of the Match

Devon Conway: " The pitch was a bit slow when you hit the wicket but to be fair it was a good wicket. We felt that 200 was a very competitive score. Disappointed that we did not end up on the winning side. It is about keeping things simple, sticking to my process, and not complicating things. "

Matchsummary.MatchName: Delhi Capitals vs Sunrisers Hyderabad
Matchsummary.TossDetails: Sunrisers Hyderabad Won The Toss And Elected To Bat
Matchsummary.TossText: Won The Toss And Elected To Bat
Matchsummary.PreMatchCommentary:
Hello and welcome to the live commentary of the second fixture of Super Saturday where the Delhi Capitals  square off against the Sunrisers Hyderabad . This is a bottom-of-the-table clash as both the teams are with 4 points fighting hard to work their plans out. These two teams need victories from here on to compete in the tournament. Delhi Capitals found their winning way after 5 games and will come back today with consecutive victories while SRH have lost their last three fixtures. Who will gain two crucial points today?

 

Head to Head:-
Delhi Capitals and Sunrisers Hyderabad have had 22 clashes in total and both have won 11 each. Who will gain the edge after today's match? 

 

                                                                  

 

Venue Stats:-
80 IPL matches have been hosted by the Arun Jaitely Stadium, Delhi and the record favours the team chasing the target as 45 of them have been won. 164 is the average first innings score here.

 

Ground Dimensions :

                                                              

 

Pitch Report:- 
Ian Bishop & Kevin Pietersen: "We had some inclement weather earlier but the pitch was covered and unaffected by it, hopefully those clouds are blown away and the rain stays away. 60m boundary on one side, 67m on the other side, and 74m hit down the ground. All three games here have been won by the chasing team, but the highest score batting first is 172. We are seeing a surface that doesn't have grass, we are seeing a surface that is low scoring with absolutely no grass cover at all. Make the best use of the surface by batting first."

 

Toss:-

Sunrisers Hyderabad  have won the toss and will bat  first

 

Aiden Markram, SRH Captain: "We are going to bat. Wicket looks on the drier side and there shouldn't be much dew tonight. Hopefully we bat well and put in a good total. All the experimentation is finished, and it's time to get results. Time for the guys to express themselves and enjoy. We lost Washi and that's a big loss for us. It's an opportunity for someone to cement a spot. We are letting ourselves down with the bat, we haven't been up to par and haven't posted good totals. Akeal Hosein makes his debut, and Samad also comes back."

 

David Warner, DC Captain: "It's about putting the best foot forward, and adapting to the conditions. We are losing wickets in a cluster. Need to put on a good batting performance and we got to bowl well in the first six overs. Home and away games are a bit challenging, but we are enjoying it. Priyam Garg makes his debut, Aman Khan is out."
Matchsummary.PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-6 Overs) :-
SRH - 62/2 (10.3 rpo, 10x4, 1x6) || DC - 57/1 (9.5 rpo, 6x4, 2x6)

Middle Overs (7-15 Overs) :-
SRH - 73/3 (8.1 rpo, 5x4, 3x6) || DC - 81/3 (9.0 rpo, 5x4, 4x6)

Death Overs (16-20 Overs) :-
SRH - 62/1 (12.4 rpo, 2x4, 5x6) || DC - 50/2 (10.0 rpo, 3x4, 2x6) 

 

Sunrisers Hyderabad  get their third win of the campaign after defending their total by 9 runs! After opting to bat Sunrisers started with the initial momentum going at more than 10 rpo in the Powerplay, courtesy of some clean hitting from Abhishek Sharma, who notched up his first half-century this season, after which some clean power hitting from Heinrich Klaasen in the end helped Sunrisers score 62 runs in the final 5 overs and notch up 197/6. The Hyderabad franchise continued their momentum in the second innings as well, with Bhuvneshwar Kumar dismissing Warner in the second ball of the innings, after which Mitchell Marsh and Phil Salt scored half-centuries and notched up a 100-run partnership, but the Sunrisers Spinners pulled the momentum back picking up 4 wickets between them to restrict Delhi to just 83 runs in the last 10 overs and snap their 3-match losing streak. 

 

David Warner, DC Captain: "We were off a bit with the ball, but I think Marsh bowled fantastic. To come up 9 runs short is disappointing. I don't think the pitch slowed down a lot, and when you lose wickets in the middle it can be extremely difficult. We have been losing too many wickets through the middle."

 

Aiden Markram, SRH Captain: "Great team effort, good to see the guys show good skill and character. I don't mind getting things wrong if the approach is right. Credit to the way the team has responded. Klassen has been in great form, and Abhishek did the hard work early on. We needed wickets to get back in the game, the two Delhi batters were doing well and it needed a special catch from Mayank Markande. Fortunately, the ball was stopping a bit and the bowlers showed great character to execute. This win will give us great confidence, and now we will travel back home and try to build on it."

 

Mitchell Marsh is the Player of the Match

Mitchell Marsh, Player of the Match: "Took me a few games to get going, but a disappointing loss. Had that nice partnership with Salt but not enough to get over the line. It was all about getting the boundaries, and applying the pressure. Certainly lots of positives from today. We have been on the wrong end of a few but we do feel there is a long way to go in this tournament. Time to start winning a few."

Matchsummary.MatchName: Kolkata Knight Riders vs Gujarat Titans
Matchsummary.TossDetails: Gujarat Titans Won The Toss And Elected To Field
Matchsummary.TossText: Won The Toss And Elected To Field
Matchsummary.PreMatchCommentary:
Hello and Welcome to the live commentary of the 39th match in the Tata IPL where the take on the . No one could ever forget what happened on their previous faceoff as the heroics from Rinku Singh still lingers in our mind. When we come back to the tournament standings, GT is currently at number three with five victories in seven games while their opponents KKR have played 8 and have managed to win just three games. KKR won their previous fixture but lost their last two games at Eden Gardens. They still have four matches remaining there. GT has not lost a game yet away from home, and will they take this record forward? Will KKR use their home advantage or will the Titans avenge their haunting loss?

 

The covers are off and the match will start at 4:15 PM, with no overs lost!

 

Head to Head:-
Now, the head-to-head stands level with 1 victory each. It was a High-Scoring, nail-biting and record-breaking thriller when the two teams met previously. Can we expect one such high-octane game tonight ?

 

                                                               

 

Venue Stats:-
In 81 IPL matches played here, 34 have been won by the teams batting first and 47 by the teams chasing the target. The all-time highest IPL total of this stadium was recorded in the previous match vs CSK. Can this be another belter? The Average 1st innings score this IPL at the venue is 222.

Ground Dimensions :

                                                                     

 

Pitch Report:-
Daren Ganga & Matthew Hayden: "We're playing on pitch number 6. Almost identical square boundaries at 63 and 64m, the straight boundary is a bit longer at 74m. The surface looks superb, there is a bit of rough and a bit of breeze blowing across, but it's a good batting surface once again"

 

Milestone Alert :

  • 100th IPL match for  skipper Nitish Rana

 

                                                              

 

  • 150th IPL match for Andre Russell

 

                                                                    

 

  • 100th IPL match for Rashid Khan

 

                                                                

 

                                                              

Toss:-

Hardik Pandya calls it right at the toss and Gujarat Titans will  first!

 

                                                                 

 

Hardik Pandya, Gujarat Titans Skipper: "We will bowl first. Just because of the weather, it was bright when we came and we thought we should bat, but it has changed now. I'm pretty happy with where we are, 7 games gone, 7 more to come, we need to play good cricket and qualify for the playoffs. We will learn from the losses as well, but we just need to play some consistent cricket. We are unchanged"

 

Nitish Rana, Kolkata Knight Riders Skipper: "We would have batted first, DLS could come into the equation, but we would still have batted first. There are always areas where we can improve. We have some forced changes, Jason Roy has a back issue, and he's been replaced by Gurbaz. Harshit Rana comes in place of Umesh Yadav"
Matchsummary.PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-6 Overs) :-

KKR - 61/2 (10.2 rpo, 6x4, 4x6) || GT- 52/1 (8.7 rpo, 9x4, 0x6)

Middle Overs (7-15 Overs) :- 
KKR- 73/2 (8.1 rpo, 4x4, 4x6) || GT- 77/2 (8.6 rpo, 5x4, 3x6)

Death Overs (16-20 Overs) :- 
KKR- 45/3 (9.0 rpo, 2x4, 4x6) || GT- 51/0 (18.0 rpo,1x4, 5x6)

 

Gujarat Titans  continue their perfect record away from home after winning at the Eden Gardens against the  Kolkata Knight Riders by 7 wickets. We were in for a delayed start due to a wet outfield after the Gujarat Titans had won the toss and chose to bowl. The Knights from Eden got off to a quick start in the Powerplay scoring at more than 10 rpo after fireworks from Rahmanullah Gurbaz - who scored his second IPL fifty in the process, after which the Gujarat Titans pulled back the momentum in the middle from some fine bowling by Joshua Little, but the birthday boy Andre Russell powered Kolkata in the death to end the innings on 179. 

In the chase, Shubman Gill gave Gujarat a good start falling just 1 run short of his half-century but the Kolkata spinners pulled things back in the middle and pushed the required run rate to more than 11 rpo, but a finishing masterclass from Vijay Shankar and David Miller ensured that the Gujarat Titans get across the finish line with 13 balls to spare and move to the top of the table 

 

                                                                    

 

Nitish Rana, KKR Captain: "I think we were 20-25 runs short. Against top teams, we can't be this sloppy with the bat. We didn't get partnerships developing and other than Gurbaz and Russell, no one else, including me, scored. If we got a good partnership in the middle overs we could have done better. In crucial games and against top opposition, you need to do all the basics well. Need to do well in the small moments, bowl according to the plan, and do the basics well."

 

                                                                   

 

Hardik Pandya, GT Captain: "Noor and Little got us back into the game and kept us in the game. I would have taken 180 on that pitch especially after someone had made a 39-ball 81. Everyone in the group knows that we would have to play good cricket to win the game, and that's the humbleness that has kept us in good stead. It's all about playing good cricket consistently, irrespective of a win or a loss. Vijay Shankar is fitter, and more confident and the amount of hard work he's done is terrific. Going forward, you'll see a lot of him.

 

                                                               

 

Joshua Little is the Player of the Match

Joshua Little, Player of the Match: "I just spoke to Hardik before play, just wanted to keep things simple, bowl the hard lengths and I'm happy I could do that. The first game of the IPL was always nerve-wracking, but I'm settled now. It was just about keeping things simple, smashing the back of the length, and letting the ball do the talking"

Matchsummary.MatchName: Punjab Kings vs Lucknow Super Giants
Matchsummary.GroundName: Punjab Cricket Association IS Bindra Stadium
Matchsummary.Commentss: Lucknow Super Giants Won by 56  Runs
Matchsummary.TossDetails: Punjab Kings Won The Toss And Elected To Field
Matchsummary.TossText: Won The Toss And Elected To Field
Matchsummary.Comments: Lucknow Super Giants Won by 56  Runs
Matchsummary.PreMatchCommentary:
It is time for Match 38 of IPL 2023 where the will play host to the Super Giants from Lucknow. The hosts will be happy with the performance against MI in their previous encounter at home and would want to continue the winning momentum at home. Shikhar's Dhawan participation still remains a concern but the other batters did step up in the last game. Harpreet Bhatia and Sam Curran looked solid in the middle order while Jitesh Sharma has taken up the responsibility of a finisher for PBKS. One can never underestimate the side in the presence of the likes of Liam Livingstone in the ranks. Arshdeep has been phenomenal especially at the death while Nathan Ellis has complimented him well from the other end. The visitors have the depth in the side in both departments but have been inconsistent in their last few outings. had a day to forget against GT where they were in control of the game but gave it away in the last four overs. Skipper KL Rahul and Kyle Mayers have been amongst the runs but the middle order has lacked luster in their performances. Avesh Khan, Krunal Pandya, and Marcus Stoinis have failed to register noteworthy performances while Naveen UL Haq has bowled well but has not had any success in terms of wickets. It will be interesting to see LSG's approach against the Punjab Kings as they have already tasted defeat against them in the first leg of IPL 2023. 

 

VENUE STATS:
IPL 2023 AT MOHALI: 
WON FIRST: 2
WON SECOND: 1
AVG 1ST INN TOTAL : 173
HIGHEST 1ST INN SCORE: 191
HIGHEST SUCCESSFUL CHASE: 154

 

                                                              

 

Ground Dimensions :

 

                                                             

 

 

PITCH REPORT: 
Samuel Badree: " We are at Pitch No. 3. There are larger sides 75m and 67m, straight hit is 73m. The surface looks like a belter of a track. Nice covering of grass too. It seems compact and hard and that suggests to me the ball will come on nicely onto the bat. The Average first innings score in Mohali is 173, but on this pitch, PBKS scored 191 vs KKR in the only game they have won at home. So the team batting first will be aiming 200 with the dew factor later on. We expect a high-octane contest.". 
 

 

TOSS:-
wins the toss and elects to first!

 

                                                               

 

 

Shikhar Dhawan, Skipper: "  Going to field first. My Shoulder is much better, recovered now. We're quite happy with the way things have gone. We have got 7 matches ahead, and looking to win most of them. We have two changes in the side,  Matthew Short is out and Sikandar Raza comes in his place. Gurnoor Brar will make his debut."

 

KL Rahul, Skipper: "  I am familiar with these conditions. Looks like a good wicket. The dew factor is a thing here, that's why teams opt to field first. We are going with the same team"
Matchsummary.PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-6 Overs) :-

LSG- 74/2 (12.3 rpo, 9x4, 5x6)   || PBKS- 55/2 (9.1 rpo, 7x4, 1x6)

Middle Overs (7-15 Overs) :- 

LSG- 110/1 (12.2 rpo, 10x4, 6x6)  ||  PBKS- 97/2 (10.7 rpo, 9x4, 4x6)

Death Overs (16-20 Overs) :- 

LSG- 73/2 (14.6 rpo, 8x4, 3x6)  || PBKS- 49/6 (9.8 rpo, 2x4, 3x6)

 

Only the second time that a score of 257 was made in an IPL Innings! started in a sensational manner with Kyle Mayers going after the bowling from ball one. Mayers smashed 54 from 24 while Badoni who was promoted up the order added 43 from 24 balls. The middle order was in a similar mood as Stoinis and Pooran wasted no time and kept the tempo high. Stoinis added 70 (40) while Pooran made 45 at a destructive strike rate of 236. Rahul Chahar was the only bowler who conceded less than 8 r.p.o. It was never going to be easy chasing almost 13 r.p.o, especially after losing openers early in the powerplay. But Atharva Taide making his maiden IPL half-century impressed everyone with his valiant effort. All the batters in the middle order played fine cameos but the asking rate proved to be just a lot at the end. Naveen ul Haq picking 3 wickets for just 30 runs in his four overs was the pick of the bowlers for LSG. A win by a margin of 56 runs will definitely boost LSG's NRR which can help them during the business end of the tournament.  

 

Shikhar Dhawan, Skipper: We gave too many runs and had to pay the price for it. I feel that the tactic to play with one extra pace bowler backfired whereas KL used an extra spinner which worked for them. I tried to change something and it didn't work but that's all right. It's good learning for me and we'll come back better and stronger. 

 


KL Rahul, Skipper: " Happy that we got the win. Every game from now on is very important. We came back fresher after a break. We were clear as to how to bat. When you see such wickets, you get excited as batters. Getting 250 speaks highly of how we batted. The think tank does most of the thinking and I try to understand what they are thinking. And if it suits us, we go through with the plan. It's worked for us till now"

 

 

Marcus Stoinis is the Player of the Match

Marcus Stoinis: "The finger seems alright. We will get scans done and see. My plan was simple,  Was just trying to build partnerships. Ayush Badoni got off to a flyer as well. I do like to take responsibility for batting in the middle order and finishing it off. I have batted everywhere in my career and I am comfortable in any role that the franchise wants me to play. I was swinging a few in the nets. So, they got excited and gave me the new ball too"

Matchsummary.MatchName: Rajasthan Royals vs Chennai Super Kings
Matchsummary.TossDetails: Rajasthan Royals Won The Toss And Elected To Bat
Matchsummary.TossText: Won The Toss And Elected To Bat
Matchsummary.PreMatchCommentary:
Two Teams placed at the top of the points table will clash in Match 37 of the Indian Premier League. The hosts will look to bounce back to winning ways after consecutive losses in their previous two encounters in the league. The team possesses all the capabilities to turn to winning ways as most of the players have looked in good knick of things. Jos Buttler and Yashasvi Jaiswal have been good at the top while Skipper Sanju Samson and Shimron Hetmyer in the middle order have made some vital contributions. RR has arguably the best bowling attack in the presence of World Class spinners like Yuzvendra Chahal and Ravi Ashwin. Trent Boult and Sandeep Sharma have been taking care of the pace attack. on the other side are coming off in the game after three wins on the trot but will be on their guard as their last loss came against the very same opponent. It will be a contest between RR's bowling and CSK's batting arsenal, likes of Ruturaj Gaikwad and Devon Conway who have been in sensational form will be tested by the swing duo of Sandeep Sharma and Trent Boult while the middle-order comprising of Ajinkya Rahane and Shivam Dube will have to tackle the RR spinners. While All-rounder Ravindra Jadeja has been in sensational form Skipper MSD has managed to marshall the troop of young pacers pretty well so far. It will be interesting to see what the yellow army does differently in order to avenge their last loss at home. 

 

HEAD TO HEAD:
Chennai and Rajasthan have encountered 27 times in IPL. has won 15 whereas  have come out victorious on 12 occasions.

 

                                                               

 

PITCH REPORT: 
Darren Ganga and Kevin Pietersen: " It is pitch number 5 and it will impact the boundary sizes as well. It is equidistant square, 66 meters, but straight is 78 meters. There wasn't as much grass in the game where Lucknow manage to defend 154. But the big change this evening is the even covering of grass. That is not to say it is going to be bouncing everywhere and seaming everywhere, it may start a little bit like that, however, I think the batters are going to turn up this evening and think this is way better for batting, 154 may not be enough this evening."

 

Ground Dimensions :

 

                                                                

 

TOSS:-
wins the toss and elects to first!

 

                                                              

 

 

Sanju Samson, Skipper: "  We will bat first. We would like to stick to our strength which is to post a total and defend. It is a special feeling to play RR's 200th game, feels great to be playing for 10 years. Would have loved to see some pink here today, but it's yellow and we know the reason."

 

 

MSD, Skipper: "  We would have bowled first here. This pitch has a decent pace but the average bounce is slightly less. We are trying to build characters and make the bowlers believe in themselves. We are going in with the same side."
Matchsummary.PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-6 Overs) :-

RR- 64/0 (10.7 rpo, 10x4, 2x6)  || CSK- 42/1 (7.0 rpo, 4x4, 1x6)

Middle Overs (7-15 Overs) :- 

RR- 75/3 (8.3 rpo, 3x4, 2x6)   ||  CSK- 83/4 (9.2 rpo, 4x4, 5x6)

Death Overs (16-20 Overs) :- 

RR- 63/2 (12.6 rpo, 8x4, 2x6)  ||  CSK- 45/1 (9.0 rpo, 5x4, 1x6)

 

 It is a memorable 200th IPL game for the Rajasthan Royals. got off to a flying start after winning the toss and electing to bat first. Yashasvi Jaiswal and Jos Buttler smashed 64 runs in the powerplay where the young left-hander played the role of an aggressor. Jaiswal compiled 77 runs off just 43 balls before falling to Tushar Deshpande. Cameos from Devdutt Padikkal and Dhruv Jurel ensure that RR posts the highest first innings score at the Sawai Mansingh Stadium. was restricted to just 42 runs in the powerplay courtesy of some disciplined bowling from Sandeep Sharma and Kuldip Yadav. Adam Zampa and R Ashwin gave nothing away in the middle overs and also kept chipping wickets at regular intervals. Zampa picked 3 for 22 in his 3 overs while Ashwin scalped 2 wickets in his 4. Shivam Dube did strike some lusty blows but failed to take CSK home tonight. A memorable evening for the Royals defeating CSK by a margin of 32 runs! 

 

MSD, Skipper: "The target was a bit above par. The reason was the powerplay as we gave too many runs initially, but at the same time, the pitch was best to bat on at that time. Even when they were batting the edges kept going for boundaries. They got a par+ score and we were not able to stop the run flow.  Matheesha Pathirana's bowling was good, not that he bowled badly. The scorecard doesn't reflect how well he bowled. Yashasvi Jaiswal batted really well and took calculated risks. I love this venue, my 183 here gave me a chance to play for another year for India. So I am grateful. "

 

Sanju Samson, RR Skipper: " It is our first win in Jaipur. It was an important win from the Team's point of view and Fan's point of view. We can't go one-dimensional in this tournament; if you're playing in Bengaluru or Mumbai, you will chase but looking at the conditions here, I took the chance to bat first. Even when we batted, all the youngsters came in and did the job. The mindset and approach is attacking which is nice to see."

 

 

Yashasvi Jaiswal is the Player of the Match

Yashasvi Jaiswal: "I was trying to hit the ball in the direction of the win and made sure that I play good cricketing shots. I have been putting in the hard yards in the nets and with the support staff in order to improve my game.  It is not about just this season, it's a continuous process. I also keep talking to senior players like MSD sir and Virat bhai which has helped me. I enjoy pressure and want to be there when there is pressure. I thrive under tough situations"

Matchsummary.MatchName: Royal Challengers Bengaluru vs Kolkata Knight Riders
Matchsummary.Commentss: Kolkata Knight Riders Won by 21  Runs
Matchsummary.TossDetails: Royal Challengers Bengaluru Won The Toss And Elected To Field
Matchsummary.TossText: Won The Toss And Elected To Field
Matchsummary.Comments: Kolkata Knight Riders Won by 21  Runs
Matchsummary.PreMatchCommentary:
The Action moves to Bengaluru where the home side will be taking on the Knight Riders from Kolkata. This is the second time that the two teams will be locking horns in this year's IPL. Although the first encounter went KKR's way, RCB is a much-improved unit now. Also, the fact that KKR is on a 4 match-losing streak makes RCB a favorite in this contest. The home side has a top order which is second to none but have not been able to get those noteworthy performances from the middle order which has unfortunately not got enough time in the middle. Mohammad Siraj who has been in sensational form will lead the pace attack in the company of Harshal Patel who looked good in their previous outing. on the other side have a lot of concerns that need to be addressed. Top Order has been inconsistent while the likes of Sunil Narine and Andre Russell have not yet come to the party. Captain Nitish Rana would be happy to see the form of Rinku Singh and Jason Roy who has just joined the side. The bowling Unit has been leaking runs so far and their mettle will be tested at Chinnaswamy Stadium which is known for its high-scoring matches. It will be interesting to see Varun Chakravarthy's tactics against a top-heavy RCB batting unit.

 

HEAD TO HEAD:
and  have clashed in 31 matches in IPL. Bangalore has clinched 14 whereas Kolkata has come out victorious on 17 occasions.

 

                                                                

 

VENUE STATS:
IPL 2023 AT BENGALURU: 
WON FIRST : 3
WON SECOND: 2
AVG 1ST INN TOTAL: 194
HIGHEST SUCCESSFUL CHASE: 213

 

PITCH REPORT: 
Pommie Mbangwa and Kevin Pietersen: " The dimensions at Chinnaswamy are quite small. The longest hit is 71 meters, which is not far by any stretch of the imagination. 102 sixes have been struck in the 5 matches played over here. When you see the surface, as a batter you need to be consistent, and being consistent means you got to give yourself a chance, after spending some time in the middle. It also looks very dry. I am completely fine with the batter turning up here thinking 'let me find my way here, and it does not look like it is going to spin". 

 

Ground Dimensions :

 

                                                        

 

TOSS:-
wins the toss and elects to first!

 

                                                         

 

 

Virat Kohli,  Skipper: "  We will bowl first. It is an evening game at the Chinnaswamy, and we've chased well over here. Captaincy is nothing new to me. It's been fun so far because of the way the team has been playing. Faf once again will be playing the impact player role. Hopefully, he will be back leading from the next game. It Looks like a great pitch, the usual Chinnaswamy pitch that we expect."

 

 

Nitish Rana, Skipper: "  Second leg of the tournament has begun, it's an important match for us. We played some good cricket and some not-so-good cricket too. It's time to step up and perform well as a group. If we play well collectively, the result 100% will be in our favor. One change from the last match which is Vaibhav Arora comes in for Kulwant Khejroliya."
Matchsummary.PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-6 Overs) :-

KKR- 66/0 (11.0 rpo, 7x4, 5x6)  || RCB- 58/3 (9.7 rpo, 7x4, 2x6)

Middle Overs (7-15 Overs) :- 

KKR- 65/2 (7.2 rpo, 4x4, 1x6)  ||  RCB- 80/3 (8.8 rpo, 4x4, 3x6)

Death Overs (16-20 Overs) :- 

KKR- 69/3 (13.8 rpo, 5x4, 6x6)  ||  RCB- 41/2 (8.2 rpo, 1x4, 2x6)

 

Delightful result for the visitors as they end their 4-match losing streak. KKR got off to a solid start courtesy of Jason Roy who scored 56 at a strike rate of 193. Venkatesh Iyer and Nitish Rana too compiled a partnership where Rana played the role of the aggressor.  The  Skipper smashed 48 from just 21 balls. Cameos from Wiese and Rinku Singh ensured that KKR posts a target of 200 for the home side. RCB looked destructive in the first couple of overs but a master stroke from Nitish Rana to turn to the young leg spinner in the powerplay turned the tides in KKR's favour. Suyash Sharma got the prize wicket of Faf Du Plessis in his first over and dismissed Shahbaz Ahmed in his next over. Varun Chakravarthy who has been KKR's top performer with the ball in the tournament ran through the middle RCB order. The mystery spinner scalped three which included a big wicket of Glenn Maxwell. Virat Kohli and Mahipal Lomror fought back but could not take the team home. Kohli compiled 54 from 37 while Lomror struck 34 at a strike rate of 189. kept losing wickets at regular intervals and never really found a way back against the spin attack of KKR. A happy day at work for Nitish Rana and Co. winning against RCB by 21 runs. 

 

                                                               

 

Virat Kohli, Skipper:  We did deserve to lose the game. To be honest we handed them a victory. We were certainly not up to the standard tonight. If you look at the game, we didn't capitalize on our chances, We dropped a few chances which cost us 25-30 runs. We set up ourselves really well in the first couple of overs but lost momentum thereafter. We kept finding fielders. Even while chasing, despite losing wickets we were one partnership away from being in the game. We needed one partnership to get us home but tonight was not meant to be." 

 

                                                                     

 

 

Nitish Rana, Skipper: " I've been saying the same thing all the time that if we play well collectively as a unit the result will be in our favour for sure. You need a lot of character in the dressing room to give a performance like this in our situation. We believe in ourselves and knew that a bounce back is around the corner. Felt like the score was not enough but there was not much dew so it did help our spinners. It didn't turn a lot but we bowled well and kept it tight. Suyash Sharma is a class act, he has always put his hand up in tough situations. He always says I'll do the job. We tell him to not look at who is batting against you, just focus on your own bowling."

 

                                                              

 

Varun Chakaravarthy is the Player of the Match

Varun Chakaravarthy: "Last match I went for 49 and this match I did well, that's how it goes. I've been more focused on accuracy rather than more variations. I didn't want to add more variations. I have been working a lot and I'd like to credit AC Pratheepan, he's been working hard with me on my bowling and even Abhishek Nayar"

Matchsummary.MatchName: Gujarat Titans vs Mumbai Indians
Matchsummary.TossDetails: Mumbai Indians Won The Toss And Elected To Field
Matchsummary.TossText: Won The Toss And Elected To Field
Matchsummary.PreMatchCommentary:
It is Match 35 of IPL 2023 where will play host to the at the Narendra Modi Stadium in Ahmedabad. The home team has had a good run so far, winning 4 out of their 6 encounters. The Top order comprising of Shubman Gill, Wriddhiman Saha and Hardik Pandya has been in good knick of things. Vijay Shankar and Sai Sudarshan have contributed well to the team's cause while David Miller and Abhinav Manohar are responsible for providing firepower finish to the team. The bowling side of things seems settled in the presence of the Spin Wizard Rashid Khan who has scalped 12 wickets so far. Mohammad Shami has found his rhythm and has bowled economically. But the defending Champions would not want to take things lightly against the five-time champions Mumbai Indians. MI has clinched three and lost three so far. Rohit Sharma, Suryakumar Yadav and Cameron Green getting runs in the previous encounter will boost MI's confidence against GT in the away fixture. The concern for MI remains their Bowling department which has not found the right balance as yet. Jofra Archer has failed to have any noteworthy performance while Behrendorff and Arjun Tendulkar have been on the expensive side. MI's only bowler that has created problems for the opposition is Piyush Chawla, it will be interesting to see his tactics on a track that is more suited to pace bowling. 

 

                                                            

 

PITCH REPORT: 
Deep Dasgupta and Matthew Hayden: " The highest number of sixes on an average has been struck at this venue along with Eden Gardens. This is a small venue. The Square boundaries are 63 metres and 68 metres, while straight down the ground is 74 metres. It is unusually humid here tonight. On the wicket, it's moist, not much tacky in any way but certainly got some moisture in it. Even though it's red soil, the bounce will be traditional, and also grip a bit due to the presence of moisture in the soil". 

 

                                                             

VENUE STATS:
IPL 2023 AT AHMEDABAD: 
WON FIRST : 0
WON  SECOND : 3
AVG 1ST INN TOTAL: 186

 

 

TOSS:-
wins the toss and elects to   first!

 

                                                         

 

 

Rohit Sharma, Skipper: " We are gonna field first. The pitch is hard. They put in a lot of water. We would like to make the best use of the conditions early on. Bowl well initially and see where the game is heading thereafter. We have 2 replacements, Rithik Shokeen misses out and Kumar Kartikeya is going to play in his place. Jofra Archer misses out as he is not well. Riley Meredith comes back."

 

 

Hardik Pandya, Skipper: "  The pitch looks good, looks watery too. It has been a batting-friendly track though. Like the way in which fought back against LSG who were in control for 36 overs almost. Credit to the boys especially the bowlers the way we came back. We showed that we never give up. Luck was on our side too. We are going in with the same team. Josh Little comes back for someone, that's it."
Matchsummary.PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-6 Overs) :-

GT- 50/1 (8.3 rpo, 5x4, 1x6)  || MI- 29/1 (4.9 rpo, 1x4, 1x6)

Middle Overs (7-15 Overs) :- 

GT- 80/3 (8.8 rpo, 7x4, 3x6)  ||  MI- 83/5 (9.2 rpo, 6x4, 6x6)

Death Overs (16-20 Overs) :- 

GT- 77/2 (15.4 rpo, 2x4, 8x6)  ||  MI- 40/3 (8.0 rpo, 1x4, 2x6)

 

A big win for the Titans at home against a top team in MI. got off to a flying start scoring 50 runs in the powerplay and losing just one wicket. Shubman Gill went on to make his third fifty of the season. Piyush Chawla picking up two wickets did try to pull things back but Miller and Abhinav Manohar had different plans at the backend of the innings. Miller smashed 46 runs from 22 balls while Manohar scored 42 from just 21. Chasing a target of 208 was never going to be easy considering the bowling that GT possesses. was restricted to just 29 in the powerplay and had already lost their Skipper Rohit Sharma at that point. GT kept chipping in with wickets at regular intervals giving no breathing space to the Mumbai Batters. Rashid Khan kept things tight and picked two wickets while Noor Ahmed complimented him well picking up three. The asking rate was always increasing and MI failed to catch up falling short by 55 runs in the end!
