Rohit Sharma,  Skipper: It's a little disappointing, to be honest, we were in control of the game for the most part and the last few conceded too many runs. Every team has different strengths and we have a good batting lineup and we back ourselves to go out and get that target on any given day, today wasn't meant to be. There was some dew and we needed someone to bat a little deeper. We came pretty close in the last game while chasing 215 but we didn't start well with the bat today." 

 

Hardik Pandya, Skipper: " I always take the call according to the situation. Captaincy for me is backing my instincts. Myself and Ashish Nehra have similar calls most times and using Noor Ahmed and Rashid Khan together was our common call. Using spinners against MI batters who love the pace on the ball was our thinking basically. Credit goes to Abhinav Manohar for the way he has been batting in the nets and it translates into his on-field performances too. Credit also to the support staff for making him bat so much in the nets."

 

 

Abhinav Manohar is the Player of the Match

Abhinav Manohar: "Lucky to be in this franchise. I practice a lot and have a lot of self-belief because of it. That's paying off. I've been gifted to time the bowl well, to do it at this level feels like a dream."

Matchsummary.MatchName: Sunrisers Hyderabad vs Delhi Capitals
Matchsummary.TossDetails: Delhi Capitals Won The Toss And Elected To Bat
Matchsummary.TossText: Won The Toss And Elected To Bat
Matchsummary.PreMatchCommentary:
The next clash of IPL 2023 is between two teams that are placed at the bottom in the point table. having won 2 out of their 6 outings find themselves at the second last position while their opponents having just one in the win column stand at the last spot. SRH have been the most inconsistent side this year especially keeping in mind the strength they possess on paper. Likes of Aiden Markram, Mayank Agarwal and Rahul Tripathi have not turned up with the bat while their most expensive buy Harry Brook has just fired in one inning so far. The bowling unit that comprises Marco Jansen, Bhuvneshwar Kumar, Umran Malik and T Natarajan is second to none but has not had any major impact so far. Mayank Markande is only positive when it comes to their bowling department is concerned. The visitors have failed to find the right balance and have been struggling so far, barring the previous encounter where the team clinched the game in the last over. David Warner is the lone wolf with the bat and would need the likes of Shaw, Pandey and Marsh to fire. Ishant Sharma making his come back looked in his element while Anrich Nortje at the other end is bowling with some serious pace. The spin duo of Kuldeep Yadav and Axar Patel has been able to curb the scoring rate and would be expected to play a big role against an SRH batting order that has a lot of Right Handers in their ranks. It will be a good battle between sides that are fighting to find winning momentum in the tournament.

 

                                                            

 

VENUE STATS:
IPL 2023 AT HYDERABAD: 
WON FIRST: 2
WON  SECOND: 1
AVG 1ST INN TOTAL: 179
AVG 1ST INN WIN SCORE: 198

 

PITCH REPORT: 
Kevin Pietersen and Pommie Mbangwa: " The Square boundaries are 69 meters and 61 meters. The straight hit is 76 meters. I don't reckon there will be that much sideways movement tonight. The ball doesn't swing for a long time here. It is not grassy enough either, for it not to spin. We think it's dry enough for it to grip a touch. If you are batting first, this is at least a 180 wicket.". 
 

 

TOSS:-
wins the toss and elects to first!

 


David Warner, Skipper: " We will bat first. Looks like a nice surface to bat on, has a nice even sheen to it. If you set a decent total, you can defend it for sure. It's about being consistent here. We got to start well in the first 6 overs with bat and ball as well. We Absolutely love this venue, I owe it to the fans out here in Hyderabad. Sarfaraz Khan comes in and Ripal Patel is in."

 

Aiden Markram, Skipper: " We would have bowled first, not too unhappy. The surface shouldn't get worse. It's an important game for us, we need to start getting points on the board. We are looking forward to the challenge. Should be a good game of cricket."
Matchsummary.PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-6 Overs) :-

DC- 49/2 (8.1 rpo, 6x4, 2x6)  || SRH- 36/1 (6.0 rpo, 6x4, 0x6)

Middle Overs (7-15 Overs) :- 

DC- 57/3 (6.3 rpo, 5x4, 0x6)  ||  SRH- 53/4 (5.9 rpo, 2x4, 0x6)

Death Overs (16-20 Overs) :- 

DC- 38/4 (7.6 rpo, 4x4, 0x6)  || SRH- 48/1 (9.6 rpo, 5x4, 1x6)

 

The Delhi Capitals come out on top in a low-scoring encounter at the Rajiv Gandhi International Stadium. got off to a decent start after electing to bat first but kept losing wickets at regular intervals. But a partnership of 69(59) between Axar Patel and Manish Pandey ensured that DC get to a fighting total of 144. Bhuvneshwar Kumar was just phenomenal from the word go, giving just 11 runs from 4 overs, and accounting for 2 wickets. Washington Sundar was the top wicket-taker with 3 against his name. In response, got off to a steady start in the powerplay but lost track in the middle overs. Mayank Agarwal held one end up but kept losing partners at the other end. Klaasen and Sundar who came into bat at No.6 & 7 managed to put a few deliveries away but eventually succumbed to the scoreboard pressure. SRH took the game very deep but failed to close it down falling short by 7 runs!

 

 

Aiden Markram, Skipper: "  We were not good with the bat. Did Not show enough intent, not excited to win a game of cricket, unfortunately. We need to go back and see how we can be free and be better. It is a difficult spot to be in, you can say all the right things but guys have to buy into it. We want to play a certain brand of cricket and if we get it wrong doing that then it won't allow sleeping well at night. Tonight we lacked intent, unfortunately, we are letting ourselves down because of a lack of intent." 

 

David Warner, Skipper: " Thanks for all the support to the audience, they always give a lot of love. A challenging game for us, it was great to get two points. Mukesh Kumar held his nerves under pressure. Well done to him and the two spinners, they've been our rock. These two are experienced bowlers, they are never going to let you down."

 

 

Axar Patel is the Player of the Match

Axar Patel: "Happy with my all-round performance. The batting especially, as that happened before. I was not prepared to bat so early but went on and took the challenge. The Two wickets were also special, especially the one where I bowled slower through the air. Need to make a bigger showcase for my trophies."

Matchsummary.MatchName: Kolkata Knight Riders vs Chennai Super Kings
Matchsummary.Commentss: Chennai Super Kings Won by 49  Runs
Matchsummary.TossDetails: Kolkata Knight Riders Won The Toss And Elected To Field
Matchsummary.TossText: Won The Toss And Elected To Field
Matchsummary.Comments: Chennai Super Kings Won by 49  Runs
Matchsummary.PreMatchCommentary:
Match No.33 of IPL 2023 will take place at the Eden Gardens Stadium in Kolkata between and . The home team has failed to find the right balance and thus finds itself in the bottom half of the points table. There have been a few good individual performances from the likes of Skipper Nitish Rana, Rinku Singh, Venkatesh Iyer, and Shardul Thakur but the team has not found a single consistent performer in the batting department. Spinners Varun Chakravarthy and Sunil Narine have fared well but have lacked support from the pace attack of KKR. They will definitely have their task cut out against a strong CSK batting order. Ruturaj Gaikwad and Devon Conway have been instrumental in CSK's success so far while the middle order too has made contributions. Having an All-rounder like Ravindra Jadeja makes the job of any captain easy. The all-rounder has been in superb form with the ball so far. MSD has led his arsenal of young pacers well and thus we see the likes of Tushar Deshpande, Akash Singh, and Matheesha Pathirana delivering in tough situations. KKR would need to play out of their skin to get past a CSK unit that is brimming with confidence! 

 

PITCH REPORT: 
Darren Ganga: " It's pitch number 4 being used. Square boundaries - 56 metres and 70 metres, straight - 70 metres. The pitch looks very good for batting, it's very typical of an Eden Gardens pitch. There's a tinge of green, the grass is even, so I expect a consistent bounce and consistent pace. What we've seen here is of course seamers dominate with wicket-taking, spinners a little more economical. The trend is to opt to chase. But if you score in excess of 200, you give yourself a very good chance of winning."

 

 

                                                                      


 

TOSS:-
wins the toss and elects to first!

 

 

Nitish Rana, Skipper: " Would like to bowl first. Looks like a good pitch to chase later on. Will be better to chase if Dew comes. If we can click in all three departments, the result will be in our favour. We have two changes David Wiese in for Litton Das. N.Jagadeesan in for Mandeep  Singh"

 

 

MSD, Skipper: " Would've bowled first as well. Players have grown in confidence, especially in the bowling department. What is important is for everyone to contribute. Take that one good catch, one good run out. I have played a lot of cricket over here. I had a job in Kharagpur which was two hours from here. The love comes from there. "
Matchsummary.PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-6 Overs) :-

CSK- 59/1 (9.8 rpo, 4x4, 4x6)  || KKR- 38/2 (6.3 rpo, 4x4, 2x6)

Middle Overs (7-15 Overs) :- 

CSK- 101/1 (11.2 rpo, 7x4, 7x6)  || KKR- 99/4 (11.0 rpo, 7x4, 7x6)

Death Overs (16-20 Overs) :- 

CSK- 75/2 (15.0 rpo, 7x4, 7x6)  || KKR- 49/2 (9.8 rpo, 3x4, 3x6)

 

 

A game that was dominated by the Yellow Army all throughout! came out all guns blazing after being asked to bat first by Nitish Rana. Conway and Gaikwad put together another half-century stand. Devon Conway went on to score his fourth fifty this year. But it was the onslaught from Ajinkya Rahane and Shivam Dube that demoralized the KKR bowling attack. Rahane smashed 71 at a strike rate of 244 while Dube compiled 50 off just 21 balls. A target of 236 was never going to be easy with the spinners in the CSK ranks. kept losing wickets at regular intervals and their top 4 were back in the hut without having any impact on the game. Jason Roy 61(26) and Rinku Singh 53*(33) did strike some lusty blows but could not catch up to the asking rate which was always creeping. win the game by a huge margin of 49 runs which will definitely boost their NRR!

 

Nitish Rana, Skipper: " Tough one to digest. It was always going to be difficult chasing a target of 236 especially if you don't have a good powerplay. Have to give credit to Ajinkya Rahane. But it's just difficult to digest that we conceded 235 which is huge. We have to work on areas. But if you don't improve and keep repeating the same mistakes against such a big team, you'll lose every time."

 

MSD, Skipper: " I will just say thanks for the support to all those who turned up today, they came in big numbers. Most of these guys will be in a KKR jersey next time. They are trying to give me a farewell, so thanks a lot to the crowd. Our pace bowlers are doing their job right, and so are our spinners in the middle. The wicket was short on one side so we needed to get early wickets and keep the pressure on the opposition. They have plenty of power hitters in the order, so we had to give respect to that fact as well. I have a clear funda, if someone is injured he can't do anything much. You just move on and motivate the youngsters to perform. We have been fortunate that all the guys coming in performs.  We realize Ajinkya Rahane's potential and what he can do when allowed to bat freely.

 

 

Ajinkya Rahane is the Player of the Match

Ajinkya Rahane: "Just had a clear mindset. If the thing between your ears is right, your mind is right then you'll be fine. I'm just trying to enjoy my game. The wicket was a bit sticky, but once you are in you have a great chance. We had a great start, and after that, I wanted to play my shots and keep the momentum. I've enjoyed all my knocks so far, I still feel the best is yet to come.."

Matchsummary.MatchName: Royal Challengers Bengaluru vs Rajasthan Royals
Matchsummary.Commentss: Royal Challengers Bengaluru Won by 7  Runs
Matchsummary.TossDetails: Rajasthan Royals Won The Toss And Elected To Field
Matchsummary.TossText: Won The Toss And Elected To Field
Matchsummary.Comments: Royal Challengers Bengaluru Won by 7  Runs
Matchsummary.PreMatchCommentary:
The action moves to the Chinnaswamy Stadium where will be taking on the in Match 32 of the Indian Premier League. RR has been the most consistent side this year and find itself at the top of the points table. The Openers Jaiswal and Buttler have been in good form and have provided flying starts in most innings. Sanju Samson has been striking the ball well too. The form of Devdutt Padikkal in the middle order remains a concern but the left-hander seems just one innings away to get back to his own. The bowling side of things seems settled with Yuzvendra Chahal doing the most damage and other complimenting him well. The leg spinner also enjoys bowling at the venue and will fancy his chance against his former teammates. Virat Kohli and Co. have been top-heavy this year as well. The bulk of the balls have been faced by Faf, Virat and Maxwell and has done a tremendous job in most games. But the concern here is the exposure the middle order has not received in that process. Dinesh Karthik, Mahipal Lomror, and Shahbaz Ahmed have not got enough game time in the middle as yet. Mohammad Siraj has been brilliant with the new ball while other have been expensive. Although Wanindu Hasaranga's inclusion will add that balance the team requires in all the departments. It will be interesting to see the lineups of the teams considering it's a day game at this venue which has a lot of runs on offer.

 

PITCH REPORT: 
Pommie Mbangwa and Aaron Finch.: " It will be tough work in the field as it is a day game at the Chinnaswamy. We are at the center pitch today, so 62m and 63m are the side boundaries. The straight boundary is 67m, so not a big hit anywhere on this ground. The surface looks dry and being a day game, the average first innings score in 158. it is a slower surface and might turn. The powerplay is so much more important on drier surfaces, as you have to get the most runs. You need to take a few chances early on. As a bowler, the best strategy is to vary your lengths and use slower balls. Doesn't matter if you bat first or bat second".

 

                                                          

 


TOSS:-
wins the toss and elects to field first!

 

                                                               

 

Sanju Samson, Skipper: " We'll bowl first. Looking at the conditions, our side and their side. So we'd prefer bowling. The dressing room is simple and honest and we need to respect the way we are playing. We are starting with the same XI, might add someone later on."

 

                                                         

 

Virat Kohli, Skipper: " It was pretty easy to choose, we'd have batted first. This wicket looks dry and it will get drier and might break up first. I didn't say that to Sanju, but I'm very happy to bat first. We both get to do what we wanted. They informed me last time saying I might have to captain a couple of games, nothing I'm not used to doing. So I'm happy to step in, ready to continue with whatever Faf has been doing. The team has responded well, we are playing with a lot of energy, and that showed in the last game. One change for us, Wayne Parnell is out and he will be replaced by David Willey. Faf continues to play as an impact sub"
Matchsummary.PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-6 Overs) :-

RCB- 62/2 (10.3 rpo, 8x4, 3x6)  ||  RR- 47/1 (7.9 rpo, 8x4, 1x6)

Middle Overs (7-15 Overs) :- 

RCB- 94/2 (10.4 rpo, 7x4, 3x6)  ||  RR- 74/2 (8.2 rpo, 5x4, 3x6)

Death Overs (16-20 Overs) :- 

RCB- 33/1 (6.6 rpo, 3x4, 0x6)  ||  RR- 61/3 (12.2 rpo, 5x4, 2x6)

 

A game of cat and mouse at the Chinnaswamy Stadium between two top sides. did well to get two early wickets after electing to bowl first. Virat Kohli was out in the first over and Shahbaz Ahmed followed soon. It was a partnership between Faf and Maxwell that swung the momentum in RCB's favor! Maxwell's 77(44) and Faf's 62(39) dismantled the RR bowling attack which had no reply to the onslaught. But some brilliance in the field from Jaiswal to get the wicket of Faf Du Plessis changed the course of the game. None of the batters going and the wickets kept tumbling like a pack of cards. RR came back strongly restricting RCB for just 189. In response, RR lost Buttler early but Jaiswal and Padikkal made sure to keep up with the asking rate. Just when RR was cruising along, a spell from Harshal Patel changed the entire complexion of the game. The bowler using his bag of tricks scalped three wickets at a crucial juncture which made things tough for RR. Patel finished with figures of 32/3 from is four while David Willey played his part by being economical in his four-over spell. RR fell short by 7 runs in the end!

                                                           

 

Sanju Samson, Skipper : "   I think when you are playing this ground, anything is chaseable. It is about getting the momentum right, normally, Hetmyer does it for us but he had an off-day today, one shot here and there does it for us. The thought keeps on changing, depending on how the wicket plays, we decide on the time when a wicket falls. With the IPL games, winnings and losings are done in very small margins, keep checking small boxes, we need to keep on checking all those. If we had two losses, we need to pull up our socks and come back stronger in the next game." 

 

                                                           

 

 

Virat Kohli, Skipper: " To be honest, we had this discussion during the toss. The pitch looked dry and I mentioned to the guys that they will have 10 overs under lights which is very difficult out here. The advantage was the ball got scuffed up. However, with the impact player rule and the extra batter, games are always on. That's why so many close games. The counter-attack from Maxi and Faf was even better than the Chennai game, it was a better surface that day. Maxi took the game away in just four overs. Harshal Patel always bowls the tough overs, not easy at Chinnaswamy. He's closed out games against DC and today as well. So massive credit to the way he has performed. We trust Him to deliver at death. Whenever Hazlewood comes in, we might look like a different attack."

 

 

Glenn Maxwell is the Player of the Match

Glenn Maxwell: "I love batting up the order. I have done it for Australia and I can do it here too. They have given me the freedom to go out there and express myself. Came into the season with good form, and have that trust from the changeroom, that makes the difference. The new ball skidded on nicely, so we had to be busy and proactive. I think the way we ended the powerplay set the foundation."

Matchsummary.MatchName: Mumbai Indians vs Punjab Kings
Matchsummary.TossDetails: Mumbai Indians Won The Toss And Elected To Field
Matchsummary.TossText: Won The Toss And Elected To Field
Matchsummary.PreMatchCommentary:
Match No 31 of IPL 2023 will be played at the Wankhede Stadium in Mumbai between and the . The home team has made a dramatic turnaround like always, winning three games after losing its first two encounters. MI although misses the services of its premium pacers Jasprit Bumrah and Jofra Archer, has managed to do well with the available resources. Behrendorff has looked good while Arjun Tendulkar has made a good start to his IPL career. Piyush Chawla has been the stand-out performer with the ball with 7 wickets against his name. Skipper Rohit Sharma and Ishan Kishan have taken the team off to good starts in their previous two encounters while Tilak Varma has been their highest run-getter. With Cameron Green getting some runs in the previous game, this MI batting unit looks formidable, to say the least. PBKS on the other side has not been consistent in the tournament. Out of the 6 games, they have won 3 and lost 3. The team has some big names but has failed to live up to the expectations so far. Liam Livingstone would be expected to come well if the team wants to get past a strong MI unit at their fortress. Arshdeep Singh has been in good form while Sam Curran and Nathan Ellis have complimented him well. While Shikhar Dhawan's injury is the concern, it will be interesting to see PBKS' tactics in the next game considering the impact player rule!

 

                                                       

 

PITCH REPORT: 
Matthew Hayden and Danny Morrison: " It is not the biggest ground going around; 65 meters on one side and 59 on the other, downtown 75. The batters will be mindful of the dimensions. It looks like a very very good batting track but the fast men could be the ones to watch out for tonight. It is a great ground to bat on and it is a chasing ground". 

 

 

TOSS:-
wins the toss and elects to  first!

 

                                                               

 

 

Rohit Sharma, Skipper: "  We are going to have a bowl first. Really nice to have some wins under the belt, winning is always nice and the atmosphere is good but the job is not done. Quite surprisingly nice and pleasant. Looking forward to this game. We have had some injuries but Jofra is back and that is the only change. Wankhede is a good pitch to bat on and it gets better as the game goes on, hopefully we restrict them and chase it down later." 

 

Sam Curran, Skipper: "Back-to-back games and not much time to think about it. No Shikhar, that's why I am here but he's recovering and should be back soon. Great opportunity for the others to put their hand and we are going with the same team"
Matchsummary.PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-6 Overs) :-

PBKS- 58/1 (9.7 rpo, 4x4, 3x6)  || MI- 54/1 (9.0 rpo, 5x4, 3x6)

Middle Overs (7-15 Overs) :- 

PBKS- 60/3 (6.7 rpo, 4x4, 2x6)  ||  MI- 95/1 (10.5 rpo, 10x4, 4x6)

Death Overs (16-20 Overs) :- 

PBKS-  96/4 (19.2 rpo, 8x4, 9x6)  ||  MI- 52/4 (10.4 rpo, 2x4, 4x6)

 

 A run-fest at the Wankhede where a total of 415 runs were scored between the two sides. got off to a good start losing just one wicket in the powerplay but the bulk of the scoring was done in the death overs where Sam Curran, Harpreet Bhatia and Jitesh Sharma cut loose and accounted for 96 runs in 5 overs. Stand in Skipper Sam Curran scored 55 from 29 whereas Jitesh Sharma smashed 25 runs at a strike rate of 357 dismantling the bowling attack. Chasing 215 was never going to be easy but the MI Skipper Rohit Sharma started positively making 44 from 27 balls. But a partnership of 75 from just 36 balls between Suryakumar and Cam Green kept MI's hopes alive. MI was cruising along until Arshdeep Singh got the wicket of Suryakumar Yadav in the 18th over of the innings. Tim David did strike some lusty blows but failed to take MI home in the end. It was Arshdeep Singh who held his nerves and showed his accuracy in bowling those yorkers under pressure. The left-arm pacer finished with 4 wickets giving just 29 runs from his four. 

 

 

Rohit Sharma, Skipper: "  Yes, a little disappointment there, we made some errors in the field which can happen, not gonna look too much into that. Just keep our heads high, we have won three and lost three, pretty even-stevens at the moment. There is a lot of time left in the tournament. We can't look down and start worrying about things." 

 

Sam Curran is the Player of the Match
 

Sam Curran, Skipper: " Pretty special. What amazing ground. The environment is incredible here. Big positive for us. I don't think I should be getting the Man of the Match considering how the boys closed the game out there. Without Shikhar, we know we had to take that responsibility. Our group is coming together really Well."

Matchsummary.MatchName: Lucknow Super Giants vs Gujarat Titans

Matchsummary.PreMatchCommentary:
Match No. 30 of IPL 2023 will be taking place at the Bharat Ratna Shri Atal Bihari Vajpayee Ekana Cricket Stadium in Lucknow between two teams that are placed in the top four on the points table.  &  have found the right balance and have looked confident in all their outings. The home team is coming off a win in a low-scoring encounter against RR which is currently topping the table. The credit goes to the bowlers Avesh Khan, Naveen Ul Haq, Marcus Stoinis, and the spinners Ravi Bishnoi and Amit Mishra. The Opening pair of Skipper KL Rahul and Kyle Mayers has done well so far and provided the vital starts to the side. But their mettle will be tested by the Likes of Mohammad Shami and Rashid Khan who have been in remarkable form with the ball. GT batting that starts with Shubman Gill, Wriddhiman Saha and Sai Sudarshan looks solid. With Hardik Pandya, David Miller, and Abhinav Manohar in the middle order, the side possesses the ability to chase down any total on board. First, of the doubleheader, Saturday guarantees a thrilling battle between two quality sides!

 

HEAD TO HEAD:
has won both their games against so far.

 

                                                     
 

 

PITCH REPORT: 
Murali Kartik and Darren Ganga: " The side boundaries are 63m on one side and 72m on the other. The straight boundary is massive at 78m and the pockets are large as well. This pitch was used in the match against SRH which was a low-scoring affair, but this looks slightly better. Very little grass on this one, spinners will have to bowl a Test match length if they're to succeed. 

 

VENUE STATS:
IPL MATCHES AT LUCKNOW IN 2023 : 
WON FIRST: 1
WON SECOND: 2
AVG 1ST INN TOTAL: 158

 

 

TOSS:-
wins the toss and elects to first!

 

                                                               

 

Hardik Pandya, Skipper: " We will bat first. Looks like a slow track, want to get the best out of it. There is no time to test our batters now. I am sure they have would have batted first as well if they won the toss. They're doing a fantastic job. I think on this wicket, the better option is to bat first. We're not worried about our record while chasing. Even if the records say that we still have to do a good job. Alzarri misses out and Noor Ahmad comes in."

 

KL Rahul, Skipper: "  I would have batted but not worried about it. We will play good cricket. We bowled against SRH as well on the same strip, we would like to restrict them to a good target and chase it down. Same 12 players. Yudhvir misses out, Amit Mishra comes in."
Matchsummary.PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-6 Overs) :-

GT- 40/1 (6.7 rpo, 5x4, 0x6)  || LSG- 53/0 (8.8 rpo, 8x4, 1x6)

Middle Overs (7-15 Overs) :- 

GT- 52/3 (5.8 rpo, 3x4, 1x6)   || LSG- 53/2 (5.9 rpo, 4x4, 1x6)

Death Overs (16-20 Overs) :- 

GT- 43/2 (8.6 rpo, 1x4, 3x6)  ||  LSG- 22/5 (4.4 rpo, 0x4, 0x6)

 


A low-scoring encounter that goes GT's way. GT managed to put up a meager total of 135 after electing to bat first on a sluggish slow track. Only Wriddhiman Saha and Hardik Pandya crossed the 10-run mark. GT Skipper scored 66 of 50 balls. Krunal Pandya was the pick of the bowlers with 2 wickets for just 16 runs. In response, made a solid start of 53 in the powerplay without losing a single wicket but lost momentum in the middle overs. Only 53 runs were scored in 9 overs which tilted the momentum in GT's favor. Left Arm wrist Spinner Noor Ahmed bowled a wily spell giving nothing away to the opposition. He finished with figures of 18 for 2 from his four. Although KL Rahul was batting till the last over, Mohit Sharma was able to hold on to his nerves and win the game for the ! As they say, it is not over until the last ball is bowled!     

 

 

KL Rahul, Skipper: "   I don't know how it happened, but it has happened. I can't put a finger on where it went wrong, but we lost 2 points today, this is cricket. I thought we were brilliant with the ball, 135 was 10 runs under par, the bowling was exceptional, we started well with the bat, but these things happen, we'll have to take it on the chin. But still a long way to go, 8 points off 7 games, we were on the wrong side of the result today." 

 

 

Hardik Pandya, Skipper: " Credit to the boys. We are a champion side, we won last year. You have to be satisfied with your results. The spirit and the atmosphere changed after getting wickets, that's a very great feeling. A win like this can boost your confidence. I think the way the wicket was playing, we could have got 10 runs more. There was uncertainty. They bowled well and made our life difficult. The batters couldn't get rhythm because of the wicket. During the strategic timeout, we spoke about the set batter going for it toward the end. We were always chasing them, and never in it. When they needed 30 runs in 30 balls, I thought they were ahead. But when they required 27 in 4 overs, I thought they were under pressure. That's where I thought we could be in the game. The way every bowler contributed, as a captain I couldn't have asked for more."

 

Mohit Sharma is the Player of the Match

"Nothing special, everything's normal, as usual. I think I have been consistent. You need to focus and prepare in the same manner each and every time, that helps. You need to keep practicing, just stick to the basics and try not to overthink"

Matchsummary.PreMatchCommentary:
The next clash in IPL 2023 is between the Chennai Super Kings and the Sunrisers from Hyderabad.  The hosts CSK have started well this year and are placed in the top 4 on the points table with 3 wins from their 5 games so far. The openers Ruturaj Gaikwad and Devon Conway have been among the runs while Rahane and Shivam Dube have also contributed to the team's cause. MSD has been able to strike some lusty blows whenever the opportunity arises. Looking at the bowling side of things Tushar Deshpande is the top wicket-taker but has leaked runs while spinners Moeen Ali and Jadeja have been able to curb the scoring rate of the opposition.

The home team would be confident going into the encounter against a team that has a very dismal record at the venue. SRH has one of the best sides on paper but has failed to replicate the same in its performances. Harry Brook scored a ton but has looked out of sorts in other games. Mayank Agarwal and Aiden Markram have not looked in their element so far. SRH possesses a bowling arsenal that can get past any batting unit. Skipper Aiden Markram will bank on the Likes of Bhuvneshwar Kumar, Marco Jansen, Umran Malik, and T Natarajan to come good against an in-form CSK batting unit. Not to forget Mayank Markande who has been doing well and can come in handy at Chepauk which is more suited to spin bowling.

 

HEAD TO HEAD:-

The head-to-head record between the two teams is heavily in favor of the . They have won 14 of the 19 matches played against the , while the latter has managed to win just 5.

 

                                                   

 

VENUE STATS:
10 IPL MATCHES IN CHENNAI SINCE 2021 : 
WON FIRST: 5
WON SECOND: 4
TIED: 1
 

 

Pommie Mbangwa: " There was a bit of drizzle earlier, but we should have a full match. One square boundary is short at 62m, the other is at 70m. The straight boundary is at 75m and some large pockets as well. This is pitch number 6 and there were a lot of runs in the last game that was played on this. There are a few cracks, but it is rock-hard. As a pacer, you need to have variations to succeed on this pitch, same goes for the spinners. But in one sentence, the batters should have a field day today."

 

 


TOSS:-
wins the toss and elects to  first!

 

                                                             

 

 

MSD, CSK Skipper: "We'll bowl first. This pitch is 50-50 because it is slightly cloudy. There might be dew so always better to chase. All packed together on the points table, we need to do well and not look at the table at this moment. Combination-wise, we have been fortunate because we haven't had all players available. The headaches start later when everyone becomes available. We are playing the same XI, and have the same impact subs as well".

 

                                                       

 

Aiden Markram, SRH Skipper: "We'd have also bowled first. We had a good game against KKR batting first, so hopefully we can take a leaf out of that. I think we need to get the whole game good together, one skill is good and the other not as much, so we are working on it. If one of them is having a good night, they have to make it big."
Matchsummary.PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-6 Overs) :-

SRH- 45/1 (7.5 rpo, 5x4, 1x6)   || CSK- 60/0  (10.0rpo, 9x4, 1x6)

Middle Overs (7-15 Overs) :- 

SRH - 57/4 (6.3 rpo, 3x4, 1x6)   || CSK- 51/2 (5.6 rpo, 3x4, 0x6)

Death Overs (16-20 Overs) :- 

SRH- 32/2 (6.4 rpo, 3x4, 0x6)  ||  CSK- 27/1 (7.9 rpo, 4x4, 0x6)

 

could not breach the fortress and yet Another comprehensive win for the Chennai Super Kings against the Sunrisers Hyderabad. After being asked to bat first, SRH could manage only 134 on the board courtesy of a brilliant bowling spell from Ravindra Jadeja who was on top of his game from ball one. MSD bowled his fours over on the trot which proved to be the game-changer for CSK. Jadeja finished with the figures of 22/3 in his four overs. In response, CSK's Opening pair of Ruturaj Gaikwad and  Devon Conway came out all guns blazing and put together an 87-run stand putting in the driver's seat. Markande bowled a good spell but Devon Conway's authentic cricketing shots kept the scoreboard moving to take CSK home with 8 balls to spare. 

 

                                                       

 

Aiden Markram, Skipper: "Disappointed again, it's never nice to lose. We were not good with the bat and couldn’t build partnerships and then you struggle to put in a good total. We certainly thought this wasn’t a 130 wicket, it was more around a 160 track. Partnerships weren’t there, we couldn’t build momentum and credit to them for the way they bowled."

 

MSD, Skipper: "Whatever is said and done, the last phase of my career, important to enjoy it. It feels good to be here. They have given a lot of love and affection. They always stay late to listen to me. You need time to pick his action Pathirana's action. We have seen that with Malinga, someone who has an awkward actions and who is very consistent with line and length. It's difficult to score off him. I was hesitant to bat second. Had the feeling there won't be much dew. Overall the middle overs were the setup. Fast bowlers bowled very well in the last few overs. I always tell them that the first preference of field setting is with you. Still, they didn't give me the best catch. I felt it was a fantastic catch. A long time back I still remember one game where Rahul Dravid was keeping and he caught one like that. Definitely, I am a bit old now, can't shy away from that.".

 

 

Ravindra Jadeja is the Player of the Match

Ravindra Jadeja: "Coming to Chennai and looking at the wicket gives me a lot of happiness. You know for sure that it is going to turn. I had in my mind to not bowl too full. It is also important to keep wicket to wicket. CSK fans always support us, no matter if we win or lose."

Matchsummary.PreMatchCommentary:
Hello and Welcome to the Live Commentary of the Second Match of the Terrific Thursday where the Delhi Capitals hosts the Knight Riders from Kolkata. KKR have played five games and have managed to win 2 of them while DC has not yet found a way to win. KKR also head back today after two back to back losses. Will  get back to their winning ways or Will this match turn the fortunes for the struggling ?

 

HEAD TO HEAD:-

A total of 31 matches have been played between the duo in which 16 has been won by  and the 14 being won by .

 

                                                           

 

VENUE STATS:- 

79 IPL matches have been played at this venue with 44 victories being claimed by the teams chasing the target. The Average 1st innings score remains at 165.

 

TOSS IS DELAYED DUE TO RAIN!

STAY TUNED!

 

TOSS UPDATE: TOSS IS SCHEDULED TO HAPPEN AT 8:15!

                                                    

 

TOSS:-
wins the toss and elects to first!

 

                                                           

 

David Warner, Skipper: " We will field first. The weather being around, you don't know what the total is going to be. We haven't been disciplined with the ball. We have two changes. Ishant Sharma comes in and Phil Salt Comes in. Abhishek Porel and Mustafizur Rahman make way."

 

Nitish Rana,Skipper: " We are playing after 3 years thanks to Covid. Everything feels new. We have four changes. Tough to remember as we have got 4 changes. But one thing is for sure If we play as a unit. It should be tough to beat us. "

 

RAIN GODS HAVE BEEN KIND ENOUGH!

MATCH TO BEGIN AT 8:30
Matchsummary.PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-6 Overs) :-

KKR- 35/3 (5.8 rpo, 6x4, 0x6)  || DC- 61/1 (10.1 rpo, 12x4, 0x6)

Middle Overs (7-15 Overs) :- 

KKR- 59/3 (6.5 rpo, 3x4, 3x6)  ||  DC- 43/3 (4.8 rpo, 5x4, 0x6)

Death Overs (16-20 Overs) :- 

KKR-  33/1 (6.6 rpo, 1x4, 3x6)  ||  DC- 24/2 (5.8 rpo, 0x4, 0x6)

 

DC finally gets one in the win column. KKR did not get the best of starts losing three wickets in the powerplay itself. Jason Roy was the only batter to hold his end up but kept losing partners at the other end. The Opening batter managed 43 in his first game of the season. Courtesy of some power-hitting from Dre Russ, KKR got to a decent total of 127 runs. In response, got off to a solid start with Warner striking over 150 in the powerplay. came back in the game after some brilliant spells from their spinners who scalped 6 wickets between them giving away just 52 runs in 12 overs. Chakravarthy, Anukul Roy and Nitish Rana were on top of their game. Steady innings from Manish Pandey and Axar Patel took the game deep and DC managed to clinch the game in the last over with 4 balls to spare. Captain David Warner was the top scorer for DC scoring 57 off 41 deliveries! Finally, after three weeks of action and Six games, the Capitals register a win in IPL 2023    

 

Nitish Rana, Skipper: "  I think we were 15-20 runs short on a difficult pitch. I take full responsibility for this, I should have stood there instead of throwing my wicket away. Credit to the bowlers that they fought with such a total on board, I think the upcoming games will be good for us if we continue bowling and fighting like this." 

 

David Warner, Skipper: " Finally a win on the board. We scrapped our way to it. We are really proud of the bowling unit to restrict the opposition to a low total. We did exceptionally well to get wickets in the PP. While Batting We lost wickets in clusters but held our nerves in the end and managed to get past the line. We are very honest with each other. We discussed areas to improve upon and we will work on them. Over to Hyderabad now"

 

 

Ishant Sharma is the Player of the Match

Ishant Sharma : "I was just waiting for my chance. I wanted to win a game for the team whenever I will get a chance. Depends on what kind of plans you have. Matter of time when you want to execute your plans. There is no lucky charm in the team. We would want to win every game from here on, qualify and hopefully win the tournament."

Matchsummary.PreMatchCommentary:
It is a doubleheader weekday and the first clash is between two teams that have not found a settled winning combination so far! will play host to the Royal Challengers from Banglore in match 27 of the Indian Premier League 2023. The hosts will be riding on the winning momentum as they went past LSG in a thrilling last-over finish. Shikhar Dhawan has led from the front and is PBKS' top performer with the bat so far. Sikandar Raza and Shahrukh Khan getting runs in the middle and at the backend of the innings provides the much-needed balance to their batting arsenal. Sam Curran did well with the ball in the previous encounter while Rabada who has just joined the side would look to get into a rhythm in this fast-paced league. PBKS will look to the bank on the fact that RCB has not been in the best of forms. started well but lost its way thereafter. But they possess a batting unit that is second to none. Faf Du Plessis has been in impeccable form while Virat Kohli has complimented him well from the other end. Glenn Maxwell has found his form and looked unstoppable against CSK in their [previous encounter where the Aussie smashed 76 runs at a strike rate of 211. Dinesh Karthik who is in charge of providing a firepower finish too got some runs under his belt. Action pact game awaits at the Punjab Cricket Association IS Bindra Stadium, Mohali between teams that stand at No.5 and No.8 currently.

 

PITCH REPORT: 
Rohan Gavaskar and Darren Ganga: " A glorious afternoon in Mohali, there was a bit of rain yesterday night and there could be a bit of weather around today as well. We're playing on pitch 4, this is a new pitch and the dimensions are pretty even. 70m on both sides and 75m on the straight boundary. Yesterday's rain has meant that the pitch hasn't been watered too much and that means the pitch is slightly dry. But there are plenty of runs on this surface and the spinners could come into the game later on". 

 

 

VENUE STATS:
IPL MATCHES AT MOHALI SINCE 2018 : 
WON FIRST: 5
WON SECOND: 7
AVG 1ST INN TOTAL: 175
AVG 1ST INN WIN SCORE: 186

 

HEAD TO HEAD:
and have clashed 30 times in IPL. RCB has clinched 13 whereas PBKS has come out victorious on 17 occasions.

 

                                                   

 

TOSS:-
 wins the toss and elects to  first!

 

                                                     

 

 

Sam Curran, Skipper: " We will field first, We did well in the last game and we'll take some confidence. Shikhar is getting closer, he should be fit soon, but he'll miss out today. He's a quality player, but the younger lot will have to shape up, Liam Livingstone is back and we have Nathan Ellis back in place of Kagiso Rabada."

 

Virat Kohli, Skipper: " Faf potentially can't be fielding today, so he'll be playing as an impact player, switching with Vyshak. We got to do what we wanted, we would have batted first, the pitch could get slow, and some scruff marks will help the bowlers go deep into the game. Taking one game at a time, focussing on our own game, making the most of crunch situations, we haven't done that so far in the tournament. No other changes for us. "
Matchsummary.PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-6 Overs) :-

RCB- 59/0 (9.8 rpo, 6x4, 2x6)  ||  PBKS- 49/4 (8.1 rpo, 5x4, 3x6)

Middle Overs (7-15 Overs) :- 

RCB- 71/0 (7.9 rpo, 4x4, 2x6)  ||  PBKS- 76/3 (8.4 rpo, 3x4, 6x6)

Death Overs (16-20 Overs) :- 

RCB- 44/4 (8.8 rpo, 2x4, 2x6)   ||  PBKS- 25/3 (7.8 rpo, 1x4, 1x6)

 

 

Virat Kohli and Co. pull off a convincing win against the home team in the first of the doubleheader. Once again it was the opening pair of Faf Du Plessis and Virat Kohli that did all the scoring for the Challengers taking the team total to 174 on a sluggish wicket. In response, PBKS lost 4 wickets in the powerplay and could not find a way back into the game. Prabhsimran Singh was going at a brisk rate from one end but kept losing partners at the other end. It was Jitesh Sharma who came in at No.7 that brought the Kings back in the game but the task was a little out of hand as he too lacked support from the other end. Prabhsimran scored 46(30) while Jitesh Sharma got 41(27). Mohammad Siraj was simply superb with the new ball and also at the death. The pacer produced his best IPL figures of 4 for 21 giving nothing away to the opposition! In the end, PBKS fell short by 24 runs.

 

                                                     

 

Sam Curran, Skipper: "  I thought we bowled well as a group. Credit to Faf and Virat for the way they played, but I think we were not good enough with the bat. They bowled well, but we lost far too many wickets, and a couple of run-outs as well.  The wicket was good today, we'll probably look back at a couple of dismissals and regret it, but we'll come back on Saturday. We are playing in Mumbai on Saturday, it's a good wicket out there and we're excited to play over there."

 

Virat Kohli, Skipper: " The table can't define your team. It's towards game 13 or 14 we can try and focus on what we need to do. Faf batted really well on that pitch. His innings ensured we had that 20-30 extra at the end. The pitch was very rough underneath, there was not enough water there I guess. There were hardly any sixes hit off the back foot against the spinners. The strategy was to bat deep to have a crack at 190. Told them (the bowlers) that the target was more than enough. Cannot afford to take the game deep, especially when they lost 6-7 wickets. The batting lineups are deeper, but we also have options in our bowling. At the halfway stage, the talk was to take the game to the opposition and you kind of break the game open when you pick up 4 wickets in the powerplay."

 

 

Mohammad Siraj is the Player of the Match

Mohammad Siraj: "First ball the length was a bit short and then I sensed the need to bowl full to get some swing and that was the plan for the first wicket. The lockdown was really important for me, I worked on my plans, my fitness, and my bowling and it's all paying dividends now"

Matchsummary.MatchName: Rajasthan Royals vs Lucknow Super Giants
Matchsummary.Commentss: Lucknow Super Giants Won by 10  Runs
Matchsummary.TossDetails: Rajasthan Royals Won The Toss And Elected To Field
Matchsummary.TossText: Won The Toss And Elected To Field
Matchsummary.Comments: Lucknow Super Giants Won by 10  Runs
Matchsummary.PreMatchCommentary:
The next contest in IPL 2023 is between two teams that are placed at the top of the points table. has won 4 out of their 5 matches while has come out victorious on 3 occasions from their 5 games so far. Jos Buttler has been the top scorer for RR providing those vital starts in the powerplay while Shimron Hetmyer has taken up the responsibility of finishing things with a flourish. Captain Sanju Samson has also been amongst the runs striking at 165 in the middle overs. The bowling unit comprising Yuzi Chahal, R Ashwin, and Trent Boult possesses the ability to get past any batting unit on any given track. The leg spinner is also the joint-highest wicket-taker having 11 against his name. He shares the spot with Mark Wood who has been lethal for the with his express pace. Ravi Bishnoi and Krunal Pandya have managed to keep things tight also, chipping in with few wickets. Kyle Mayers is the top performer with the bat but has looked a little out of sorts in the previous two games. One can expect Quinton De Kock to feature in the game in place of Mayers. Skipper KL Rahul has been doing the scoring but has failed to do so at a brisk rate whereas Nicholas Pooran in the middle order makes up for the same with his hitting prowess towards the end. The southpaw is batting at a staggering strike rate of 216 in this year's IPL. A contest more like a game of Chess between two well-balanced sides awaits at the Sawai Mansingh Stadium in Jaipur. This will be the first home game at this stadium for this year!

 

HEAD TO HEAD:
has won both their games against so far.

 

                                           

 


VENUE STATS:
7 IPL MATCHES AT SAWAI MANSINGH STADIUM SINCE 2019 : 
WON FIRST: 1
WON SECOND: 6
AVG 1ST INN TOTAL: 164
AVG 1ST INN WIN SCORE: 184

 

PITCH REPORT: 
Sanjay Manjrekar and Nick Knight: " No tall stands, so there's a bit of a breeze factor. A pretty substantial breeze that's blowing across, might come into play. This is not a dead-center pitch on this ground. The square boundary is just 62m and 68m on the other side, but the straight boundary is 70 and upwards 78m. If you're going to hit straight, make sure you've got a lot of power behind the shot. So there's an incentive to play cross-batted on this pitch. I find this pitch on the harder side. It might be a little bit two-paced as well". 

 

TOSS:-
wins the toss and elects to first!

 

 

Sanju Samson, Skipper: " We are going to bowl first. It looks like a really good wicket. We are very happy to come back to Jaipur and play after 4 years. It's all about how we react under pressure. We have a fearless attitude. We have one change. Jason comes back in for Zampa"

 

 

KL Rahul, Skipper: " We would have bowled first as well. The first game here. It's important that we start well and put a good total on the board. We've executed well in most games. We have had clarity with the bat and the ball. All three skills have been good. We are quite settled. "
Matchsummary.PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-6 Overs) :-

LSG- 36/0 (6.0 rpo, 4x4, 1x6)   || RR- 47/0 (7.8 rpo, 5x4, 2x6

Middle Overs (7-15 Overs) :- 

LSG- 73/4 (8.1 rpo, 5x4, 3x6)   ||  RR- 57/3 (6.3 rpo, 3x4, 1x6)

Death Overs (16-20 Overs) :- 

LSG- 45/3 (7.5 rpo, 4x4, 1x6)  ||  RR- 40/3 (8.0 rpo, 5x4, 2x6)

 

LSG comes out on top in a low-scoring encounter in the Pink City. were slow to start off after being asked to bat first by Sanju Samson. KL Rahul and Kyle Mayers put together 82 but took 64 balls to do the same. RR pulled things back and restricted LSG to an average score of 154. Ashwin scalped two while Boult was the most economical of the bowlers. In response, started well with Buttler and Jaiswal going at a fairly decent rate. But Marcus Stoinis led the LSG comeback dismissing Jaiswal in the 12th over and thereafter the team lost 3 more wickets for just 17 runs. Naveen Ul Haq and Ravi Bishnoi bowled economically while Avesh Khan picked three wickets giving very little to the opposition on this slow low track. Padikkal and Parag tried well but could not catch up with the asking rate. In the end, RR fell short by 10 runs.

 

                                                         

Sanju Samson,  Skipper: "  Not a great feeling after a loss, but it's okay. We would have loved to win the first game at Jaipur at our home. But We will definitely take lessons from the game and move on. With the batting line-up we have, it was a very chaseable score. But they bowled really well and used the conditions really well." 

 

KL Rahul, Skipper: " In the 10 over mark, the message I and Kyle sent out was that a total of 160 would be a good total on this track, they have some good bowlers as well who exploited the conditions. We fell 10 short but made up with the ball. And there was no dew so made it fair for both teams. I think that run-out from the impact player Amit Mishra, and the two wickets falling back to back gave us a chance to come back. We know with Rajasthan their strength is their top four, so we needed to have our plans in place to get them out."

 

Marcus Stoinis is the Player of the Match

Marcus Stoinis: "Nice to get involved with the ball, had no real plans to get Jos Buttler out that way but I just used some cricketing smarts and bowled it short into the wicket. We identified this as a difficult wicket, so we realized it soon and executed our plans accordingly."

Matchsummary.MatchName: Sunrisers Hyderabad vs Mumbai Indians
Matchsummary.TossDetails: Sunrisers Hyderabad Won The Toss And Elected To Field
Matchsummary.TossText: Won The Toss And Elected To Field
Matchsummary.PreMatchCommentary:
will play host to the in Match No. 25 of the Indian Premier League. Both the teams have had a similar run so far having won two out of their four fixtures so far. Mumbai and SRH both lost their first two games but came back strongly in the next two. SRH have one of the best teams this season in terms of their balance and the same was seen in their previous fixture against KKR. Their most expensive buy Harry Brook showed his mettle by scoring his maiden IPL Century and their Skipper Aiden Markram too looked in good form. The Pace bowling Unit consists of some good bowlers like Bhuvneshwar Kumar, Marco Jansen, Umran Malik, and T Natarajan who can give be lethal on their day and the spinners Mayank Markande and Washington Sundar too have managed to keep things tight. But they have a daunting task up their sleeve as they square off against a batting unit that looked in their elements in the previous game. Rohit Sharma and Ishan Kishan provided a good start while Suryakumar Yadav who is not been amongst runs got some under his belt. Mumbai bowling department still has a few concerns but Piyush Chawla bringing in his experience has done significantly well for MI. It will be interesting to see MI's combination in this all-important clash against SRH in Hyderabad. 

 

We have come a long way, completes 15 years today!

 

 

PITCH REPORT: 
Ian Bishop: " "There's a slight bias to the ground. To my right the square boundaries are 63 metres, that's not a big hit, players can muscle that. A little bit bigger to my left which is 68 metres. Down the ground about 73 metres. The outfield is pristine and it's absolutely beautiful. The surface is interesting. It's a light colour, a very grey colour. The grass that was there is cut very very low. I'm just wondering if the ball feels as though it'll come on to the bat on this but because the grass is cut so low, I'm not sure". 

 

VENUE STATS:
66 IPL MATCHES AT HYDERABAD : 
WON FIRST : 28
WON SECOND : 37
TIED: 1
AVG 1ST INN TOTAL: 158

 

 

HEAD TO HEAD:
and Mumbai has clashed 19 times in IPL.  Hyderabad has won 9 whereashas come out victorious on 10 occasions.

 

                                                    

 

TOSS:-
wins the toss and elects to first!

 

                                                 

 

 

Aiden Markram, Skipper: " We are gonna bowl first. Wicket looks slightly drier, hopefully, it gets better with the dew and we restrict them to a chasable total. Not in the 16 (no changes). We'll see how conditions play out and adjust from there. Our fielding needs to improve. We let ourselves down slightly in the previous games."

 

 

Rohit Sharma, Skipper: "  It's been fantastic, 15 years IPL has come off a long way. Has gone from strength to strength. Lots of good things have happened in 15 years. We have to play good cricket. We do understand the challenges of posting a total. We've to assess the conditions. Duan misses out and Jason Behrendorff comes in place of him. "
Matchsummary.PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-6 Overs) :-

MI- 53/1 (8.8 rpo, 7x4, 2x6)  || SRH- 42/2 (7.0 rpo, 4x4, 1x6)

Middle Overs (7-15 Overs) :- 

MI- 77/2 (8.5 rpo, 6x4, 4x6)  ||  SRH- 91/4 (10.1 rpo, 8x4, 3x6)

Death Overs (16-20 Overs) :- 

MI- 62/2 (12.4 rpo, 6x4, 3x6)  ||  SRH- 45/4 (9.0 rpo, 6x4, 0x6)

 

Three wins on the trot for the Mumbai Indians. Top order came out all guns blazing after being asked to bat first. Rohit Sharma and Ishan Kishan added 41 for the first wicket off just 4.4 overs while Green and Kishan compiled 47 for the second wicket. Cam Green scored his maiden IPL fifty smashing 64 off just 40 balls. A cameo of 37 at a strike rate of 217 from Tilak Varma ensured that post a score above the average score for the Sunrisers. In reply, SRH lost Harry Brook and Rahul Tripathi in the powerplay courtesy of some brilliant new ball bowling from Behrendorff. Mayank Agarwal played the sheet anchor role but could not capitalize on the start while Klaasen struck over 225 but managed to accumulate only 36. Piyush Chawla, Jason Behrendorff, and Riley Meredith picked two wickets each. kept losing wickets at regular intervals and fell short by 14 chasing 193. 

 

 

Aiden Markram, SRH Skipper: " All in all we were not at our best tonight. Credit to the boys for taking it deep. We could have done with conceding fewer runs towards the end. The surface stayed pretty much the same throughout the night, on the slower side, not bad at all. Not too bummed, there are areas we can improve on and we will look to do that to give us a good chance to win the next game."

 

 

Rohit Sharma, MI Skipper: "  I have got a lot of memories here. I played for three years here. Won a Trophy here as well. Love coming back here. To settle them in is important for us. We had a couple of guys who hadn't played IPL before. We had to back them. They are coming into their own. I am enjoying what I am doing. It is a different role. I am trying to set the tempo. Glad to get some scores in the powerplay. I understand one of us has to bat big. We have a long batting lineup. We want this guy to come out and bat freely. We watched Tilak last season. We all know what he can do. I love his approach. "

 

 

Cameron Green is the Player of the Match

Cameron Green: "I think the first couple of games were a learning curve for me and our team. Bit of a sticky situation when I walked out to bat but glad that the plans came off. I am a work in progress with my bowling at the death. hopefully, we can continue with the winning momentum."

Matchsummary.MatchName: Royal Challengers Bengaluru vs Chennai Super Kings
Matchsummary.Commentss: Chennai Super Kings Won by 8  Runs
Matchsummary.TossDetails: Royal Challengers Bengaluru Won The Toss And Elected To Field
Matchsummary.TossText: Won The Toss And Elected To Field
Matchsummary.Comments: Chennai Super Kings Won by 8  Runs
Matchsummary.PreMatchCommentary:
The Next clash of IPL 2023 is the South Indian Derby as they call it.  will lock horns with at the M. Chinnaswamy Stadium in Bengaluru. The home team put up a show for the home crowd in the game against DC a couple of days ago. RCB was in control of the game and were clinical in all the departments. Starting with Virat Kohli who scored his third fifty this season and the skipper Faf Du Plessis who has led by example in terms of pacing and innings. Maxwell has been able to provide the fire-power finish to the side while Mahipal Lomror and Shahbaz Ahmed have been making vital contributions. Looking at the bowling side of things, Mohammad Siraj has been spectacular, especially in the powerplay. Wayne Parnell fits in the side perfectly while Vyshak Vijaykumar impressed everyone on his debut at home. RCB will look to capitalize on the winning momentum against a team that is coming off a narrow defeat in their previous encounter. The responsibility to tackle the wrath of the RCB pacers will be on the shoulders of Ruturaj Gaikwad who has been CSK's top performer with the bat. Ajinkya Rahane has shown his mettle in the two games that he's been a part of. has done reasonably well winning two out of their four matches so far. Eyes will certainly be on MSD who has looked sensational with his power hitting at the backend of the innings. Ravindra Jadeja holds the key in the game, especially considering his record against the top two RCB batters, Virat Kohli and Faf. Whatever the result of the game, a mouth-watering contest is guaranteed at the Chinnaswamy stadium between two top clans. 

 

HEAD TO HEAD:
Out of the thirty games between &, 10 have been won by RCB while Chennai has come out victorious on 19 occasions.

 

VENUE STATS:
IPL MATCHES AT BENGALURU SINCE 2018 : 
WON FIRST: 17
WON SECOND: 9
AVG 1ST INN TOTAL: 184

 

PITCH REPORT: 
Pommie Mbangwa & Matthew Hayden: " A cool Bengaluru evening but it will not be too soothing for the bowlers because this ground is known for six frequency, one six every 12 balls. That's because the leg side boundary is just 60m and the other side isn't much further at 66m. The longest hit is straight down the ground at 71m. The pitch looks very good, there is a 20-run difference between the day games and the night games. There is huge potential to get big runs today. The only concern as a batter is that the middle areas of the pitch look very dry, and it is extremely hard. From the other end though it looks like a batting paradise. How much is enough? 212 wasn't enough that day and today also it is a batting paradise". 
 

 

TOSS:-
wins the toss and elects to  first!

 

 

Faf Du Plessis, Skipper: "Incredible noise, isn't it? We will field first. I think the nature of pitches will turn, but 180-200 will be a nice target to chase. It is quite a small ground and the ball travels, the surface is good and a little bit of dew could help. No changes in our starting XI but got some tricks up our sleeve for the impact player."

 

 

MSD, Skipper: "  The toss does matter because this is a venue where it is difficult to contain batters in the second innings. And not to forget the dew factor. I think what's important is not looking ahead, maybe 180-200 is a par score but we need to keep re-evaluating every 3-4 overs on where we stand and what would be a good total to get to. That is a better way to approach, rather than keeping a total in mind. We have One change tonight,  Sisanda Magala is injured and Matheesha Pathirana comes in. "
Matchsummary.PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-6 Overs) :-

CSK- 53/1 (8.8 rpo, 4x4, 3x6)  || RCB- 75/2 (12.5 rpo, 6x4, 6x6)

Middle Overs (7-15 Overs) :- 

CSK- 112/1 (12.4 rpo, 6x4, 9x6)   ||  RCB- 94/2 (10.4 rpo, 3x4, 8x6)

Death Overs (16-20 Overs) :- 

CSK- 61/4 (12.2 rpo, 2x4, 5x6)  ||  RCB- 49/4 (9.8 rpo, 3x4, 2x6)

 

Batting first and defending is not an easy thing to do at Chinnaswamy. did well to put up 226 on board after losing Ruturaj Gaikwad early. Devon Conway and Ajinkya Rahane kept playing with positive intent and made sure to lay down a foundation for the middle-order batters. But it was the partnership between Conway and Shivam Dube that put CSK in the driver's seat. Dube smashed 52 at a strike rate of 193 while Conway compiled 83 off just 45 balls. All the RCB bowlers leaked runs except Mohammad Siraj who conceded at only 7.5 r.p.o and also accounted for one crucial wicket. In response, RCB lost Virat Kohli in the first over and Mahipal Lomror in the second. But Glenn Maxwell coming to bat inside Powerplay had different plans. CSK looked helpless against the Maxwell onslaught as the Aussie went on to score 76 off just 36 balls while Faf at the other end played second fiddle scoring 62 off 33 deliveries. To add to the misery, CSK dropped four catches which almost cost them the game. CSK Spinners despite going for runs, managed to pick wickets at the right time. Moeen Ali got the wicket of the RCB Skipper Faf while Theekshana got the prize wicket of Glenn Maxwell. came back strong and pulled off a brilliant win against in Bengaluru. 

 

 

Faf Du Plessis, RCB Skipper: " I think we played it perfectly, the last five overs were set up for the finish. DK finishing the game, that's bread and butter for him, but that shows how good their bowling was. 200 was going to par, we went for a few runs toward the end. We could have minimized the damage by restricting them."

 

 

MSD, CSK Skipper: "  When you come to Bangalore, it's a good wicket. In the early part of IPL you get a lot of dew. You want to start well and then alter whatever is there in your mind. It was slightly tacky at the start. It's important to go through that and then look to accelerate. We kept it simple and tried to do as much as possible in the second half of the innings. "

 

 

Devon Conway is the Player of the Match

Devon Conway: "Very happy with the way things went tonight. I didn't quite hit the straps in the first few games. Good win for us as a group. My recipe is quote simple - try and play good cricket shots. When I'm under pressure, just try and react and take options that are best for me. I don't wanna be too predictable. Just using my crease to try and put bowlers off their lengths"

Matchsummary.MatchName: Gujarat Titans vs Rajasthan Royals
Matchsummary.TossDetails: Rajasthan Royals Won The Toss And Elected To Field
Matchsummary.TossText: Won The Toss And Elected To Field
Matchsummary.PreMatchCommentary:
Hello and Welcome to the Live Commentary of the Second Match of the Super Sunday between the table toppers  & ! Both the teams played four matches each and have won 3. They both come back after a win in their previous matches. GT has only batted second in all their matches and Rajasthan has batted first in all four. Both are yet to test their dimensions the other way round. Will it be Aave De or Halla Bol?

 

HEAD TO HEAD:-

In the three clashes the duo faced,  has won all  three games!

 

VENUE STATS:-

In 20 T20 matches played here, 12 matches have been won by the teams batting second. The average score here is 163.

 

TOSS:-

Rajasthan Royals calls right and opts to field first!

 

                                            

 

Sanju Samson, Rajasthan Royals Skipper: "We are looking to bowl. Boult is coming in place of Jason Holder and Padikkal is playing when we bat".

 

Hardik Pandya, Gujarat Titans Skipper: "It has been a belter so far. It's a good toss to lose, don't mind batting or bowling first. For us, it's important how we use the impact player and we'll use it only when required. A Forced change, Vijay Shankar isn't playing and Abhinav comes in for him. It's my home state, lot of love, everyone comes here and supports us."
Matchsummary.PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (Overs 1-6):-

 - 42/2 (7.0 RPO, 6x4, 0x6) ||  - 26/2 (4.3 RPO, 2x4, 2x6)

Middle Overs (Overs 7-15):-

 - 77/1 (8.6 RPO, 4x4, 3x6) ||  - 88/3 (9.8 RPO, 4x4, 7x6)

Death Overs (Overs 16-20):-

 - 58/4 (11.6 RPO, 3x4, 4x6) ||  - 65/2 (15 RPO, 4x4, 6x6)

 

Rajasthan Royals pull off a heist in Ahmedabad, to register their first victory over the Gujarat Titans and move to the top of the table.  Sanju Samson called it right at the toss and opted to field, and Boult provided the initial momentum for the Royals striking in the first over in yet another game, after which Shubman Gill steadied the innings with a 45 (34) and it was the Killer Miller show in the end along with a cameo from Abhinav Manohar, helping the Titans score 58 runs in the final 5 overs to put on 177/7. In the chase, Hardik Pandya and Mohammad Shami put on a display of swing bowling in the Powerplay, and restricted Rajasthan to 26/2, after which it was a Sanju Samson and Shimron Hetmyer show with both of them scoring half-centuries to pull off an amazing chase for the ages .

 

Hardik Pandya, Gujarat Titans Skipper: "To be honest I didn't expect the loss after the powerplay we had, but that's the beauty about this game. The game is never over till it's over, another lesson for us. Noor Ahmad is difficult to pick, got us the big breakthrough but the other bowlers didn't execute. It's a very long tournament, A lot of matches left and we still need to play a lot of group cricket even if we had won today. After I got out, they bowled a couple of good overs, but we should have gone a little harder and got to 200."

 

Sanju Samson, Rajasthan Royals Skipper: "When you play quality opponents on a quality wicket, you get such games. Very happy to compete in such a game and come out on top. It was important to rotate our bowlers, they were playing some quality cricket and we had to respect that. The start we had, shows how good a wicket this was. The new ball and the quality of swing bowling were good and we had to respect that. Hetmyer doesn't like easy situations, and we like putting him in difficult situations because he usually wins us such situations."

 

Shimron Hetmyer is the Player of the Match

Shimron Hetmyer: "Difficult to win against Gujarat, they beat us thrice last year but today was sort of a revenge. I practice these situations, and it helps when you practice with that mindset of knowing we are a few wickets down and chasing 100 with 8 overs to go. Noor Ahmed bowled well throughout and all I was thinking about was getting that double and taking it from there."

Matchsummary.MatchName: Mumbai Indians vs Kolkata Knight Riders
Matchsummary.TossDetails: Mumbai Indians Won The Toss And Elected To Field
Matchsummary.TossText: Won The Toss And Elected To Field
Matchsummary.PreMatchCommentary:
Hello and Welcome to the live commentary of Match 22 in the Tata IPL 2023 where the Mumbai Indians square off against the Knight Riders from Kolkata. This is the second home game for Mumbai and they would love to treat the fans with their first victory after their loss here against CSK. MI opened their account after beating Delhi Capitals last game and would look to acquire a winning streak. The visitors, KKR played four and won two out of them. Who will come out victorious today?

Suryakumar Yadav will lead the  side in the absence of Rohit Sharma as he is unwell!


HEAD TO HEAD:
 and have clashed 31 times against each other and MI are way ahead in the tally with 22 wins and KKR have got only 9 wins. But in the last three games, it was KKR who sealed those. 

 

PITCH REPORT:-

Ian Bishop: "This is a day game and the sun is scorching down. Last game we got an average score of about 180 at the Wankhede, so we are hoping for a high-scoring game. There isn't a lot of grass and some of the cracks are showing. It is still a hard surface and this surface could grip with so many spinners on show. The fast men need to work a bit harder today."

 

TOSS:-

 won the toss and elected to field first!

 

                                                  


Suryakumar Yadav,  Captain: "Obviously we would love to bowl first. The wicket looks dry. The ball comes nicely to bat on as the game progresses. Rohit Sharma is having some stomach bug, so he is out. Good to see the girls get the support they are getting here. We are going with a few change as Duan Jansen and Arjun Tendulkar comes into the XI."

 

                                                  


Nitish Rana,  Captain: "We wanted to bat first. The mood in the dressing room is good, need to improve on our bowling. We believe we can chase well. The ball might turn in the second innings. Everyone is scoring runs and it's good for us. We'll target to score around 180 on this wicket, and we have no changes."
Matchsummary.PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-6 Overs) :-

- 57/2 (9.5 rpo, 2x4, 4x6) || - 72/1 (12.0 rpo, 6x4, 6x6)

Middle Overs (7-15 Overs) :- 

 - 83/2 (9.2 rpo, 4x4, 5x6) || - 91/2 (10.1 rpo, 6x4, 7x6)

Death Overs (16-20 Overs) :- 

- 45/2 (9.0 rpo, 6x4, 1x6) || - 23/2 (8.6 rpo, 3x4, 0x6)

 

Mumbai Indians continue their home dominance against the Knight Riders as they win by 5 wickets and more importantly with 14 balls to spare! There was a change in captaincy for today's game in the MI camp as Suryakumar Yadav stepped in for Rohit Sharma after the latter was unwell. Being put into bat, Venkatesh Iyer took charge and notched up a century, which is just KKR's second 100 in the IPL after Brendon McCullum's 158* in the first-ever match of the IPL, after which the Mumbai bowlers pulled things back in the end to restrict the scoring and the Knight Riders finished their innings on 185. In the chase, Rohit Sharma had replaced Riley Meredith as the impact player and got Mumbai off to a flyer in the Powerplay, along with Ishan Kishan who scored a quickfire half-century, after which cameos from stand-in skipper Suryakumar Yadav, Tilak Varma, and Tim David ensured that Mumbai Indians get their second consecutive victory .

                                            

 

Nitish Rana, Kolkata Knight Riders Captain: "I think we were 15-20 runs short. Credit to Piyush Chawla bhai for the way he bowled. Feel bad for Venky, he scored a hundred and played so well but finished on the losing side. The whole team knows this was the second hundred for a player from KKR. They targeted our best bowlers and it paid off for them. I would want my bowling unit to deliver more. We will go back to the dressing room and talk about it."

 

Suryakumar Yadav, Mumbai Indians Captain: "We had a chat to carry the momentum from the last game, and the boys put on a show. I would have loved to finish the game but still happy with the way the team played. In the afternoon we thought the wicket was a little dry, but the way the guys batted it settled down in the evening. In day games at the Wankhede, 160-170 is a good score usually but Ishan Kishan got us off to a great start."

                                         

 

Venkatesh Iyer is the Player of the Match

Venkatesh Iyer: "Would have been happier if we finished on the winning side but happy with my performance. The management has shown faith in me and it was a very beautiful wicket to bat on. Once you score those 30-40 runs, it's just about how you continue. I think we were 15-20 runs short in the end, but given how Mumbai was going, they would've chased it down in the next few overs anyways. If we look at their last three-four overs, they didn't give away too many runs, and credit to them."

Matchsummary.MatchName: Lucknow Super Giants vs Punjab Kings
Matchsummary.GroundName: Bharat Ratna Shri Atal Bihari Vajpayee Ekana Cricket Stadium
Matchsummary.TossDetails: Punjab Kings Won The Toss And Elected To Field
Matchsummary.TossText: Won The Toss And Elected To Field
Matchsummary.PreMatchCommentary:
Hello and welcome to the live coverage of Match 21 in the TATA IPL 2023 for the second game of the day, where the Lucknow Super Giants  host the Punjab Kings  at the EKANA Cricket Stadium. The Kl Rahul-led side will look to get their third consecutive win and move to the top of the table whereas their opponents Punjab Kings will look to turn the tide, after losing consecutive matches after winning their first two. Will we see another last-over thriller, in what has been a week of such events in the IPL? This will also mark Deepak Hooda's 100th match in the IPL. 

 

The two teams had played once last season and LSG had won by 20 runs in the encounter. Will Punjab level the Head to Head or will Lucknow take the win and move to the top of the table?

 

VENUE REPORT:-

Lucknow has enjoyed playing at home, winning both their games and establishing their home advantage. The two matches played here this season have seen contrasting scores with, Lucknow posting 193 in the 1st innings in the first game and Sunrisers posting just 121 in the second game.

 

PITCH REPORT:-
Matthew Hayden: "It's hot but not too much wind. Short side on the leg side and the straight boundaries are the longest. This is a fresh wicket and it looks specky, with some green patches but some very dry areas. It is a red soil pitch, expect the ball to come on better on this track."

 

TOSS:-

SAM CURRAN HAS WALKED OUT FOR THE TOSS AND HE HAS CALLED IT RIGHT, AS PUNJAB WILL FIELD FIRST!

 

                                                 

 

Sam Curran, Punjab Kings Skipper: "We'll bowl first. First toss that we have won this season. Shilkhar picked up an injury last game, don't know how bad it is but hopefully, he won't be out long. His absence is huge, we've got two Indian batters (Atharva Taide and Harpreet Singh Bhatia) coming in and Raza is back in the XI."

 

KL Rahul, Lucknow Super Giants Skipper: "First game on this strip, it is exciting to challenge ourselves on different conditions. It is our first season here, so each game we'll assess and modify. Every game we make a few changes, settle on a 12-13 and take a call depending on the game. Everyone is enjoying the game and there is a good vibe around, really happy with the support we have got out here."
Matchsummary.PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-6 Overs):-

LSG - 49/0 (8.2 RPO, 4x4, 3x6) || PBKS - 45/3 (7.5 RPO, 7x4, 1x6)

Middle Overs (7-15 Overs):-

LSG - 62/4 (6.9 RPO, 6x4, 0x6) || PBKS - 70/2 (7.8 RPO, 5x4, 3x6)

Death Overs (16-20 Overs):-

LSG - 48/4 (9.6 RPO, 1x4, 2x6) || PBKS - 46/3 (10.2 RPO, 4x4, 2x6)

 

Punjab Kings edge Lucknow Super Giants in another final over thriller in the TATA IPL 2023. Sam Curran led Punjab tonight after Shikhar Dhawan was unavailable, and chose to field first. KL Rahul and Kyle Mayers gave Lucknow a good start in the Powerplay, with the former notching up his first half-century of the season, after which Punjab pulled back the momentum by picking up wickets in regular intervals (4 in the middle overs and 4 in the death) with the skipper Sam Curran leading from the front and picking up three wickets, to restrict Lucknow to 159/8. In the second innings, debutant Yudhvir gave Lucknow the initial momentum in the Powerplay, picking up two wickets in his first two overs, but a calm half-century from Sikandar Raza and a quickfire knock from Shahrukh Khan ensured Punjab Kings prevailed in a thriller and move into the Top 4 of the table!

 

KL Rahul, Lucknow Super Giants Captain: "We were about 10 short, the dew came in and helped the batters a bit more. When you're playing on a new pitch, you cant rely on previous games so we are taking it as it comes. If a few guys get going, we can get that 180-190 mark, but unfortunately today a few batters got caught on the boundary lines. Each player has a different role, we are 7-8 batters in our team and few are powerful enough to clear every boundary, the others have different skills. We each play our role and thats what makes the team exciting. We have power in Pooran and Stoinis, and Mayers up top takes the aggressive route. For each player taking that aggressive route can look different, you have to stick to what works best for you."

 

Sam Curran, Punjab Kings Captain: "Amazing win. I thought our spinners bowled nicely. Bit of dew came in but the wicket was offering a little for the bowlers. The way Sikandar Raza played was brilliant, and the way Shahrukh Khan finished it, that's what he's in our team to do. His role has been clear in our side. You go from ground to ground and have to come up with different gameplans. We've got so many options which is lovely to have as a captain. I've never captained before, hopefully Shikhar is fit soon."

 

Sikandar Raza is the Player of the Match

Sikandar Raza: "Feels great to be honest. When I got out, there were a few demons in my head. Credit to Shahrukh. Nice to get a fifty but if we had lost, I wouldn't have felt so good. You're here and you want to do well."

Matchsummary.MatchName: Royal Challengers Bengaluru vs Delhi Capitals
Matchsummary.Commentss: Royal Challengers Bengaluru Won by 23  Runs
Matchsummary.TossDetails: Delhi Capitals Won The Toss And Elected To Field
Matchsummary.TossText: Won The Toss And Elected To Field
Matchsummary.Comments: Royal Challengers Bengaluru Won by 23  Runs
Matchsummary.PreMatchCommentary:
Hello and welcome to the live coverage of Match 20 in the TATA IPL 2023, between the Royal Challengers Bangalore  and Delhi Capitals .  The David Warner-led side will look to get off the mark this season, after starting with 4 consecutive losses on the trot, whereas RCB have lost two in a row (conceding 200+ scores in both games) after a dominating win in their first match

Both sides will look to rewrite their fortunes coming on the back of last-ball defeats in their previous encounter and have been enriched by Overseas stars returning to their side, Marsh being available again for the Capitals whereas Sri Lanka's Wanindu Hasaranga is available for selection after national duty.

 

HEAD TO HEAD:-

                                                     

The Bangalore-based franchise leads the encounter with 17 wins as compared to 10 for Delhi. RCB have also won each of their last three encounters against the Capitals . Will RCB continue their recent domination against Delhi or will Delhi get their first win of the tournament today ?

 

VENUE REPORT:-
