The batsmen have enjoyed playing at this ground, with the average run rate at this ground being 10.1 RPO, and the average 1st Innings score this IPL is 192. In TATA IPL 2023, both matches at this venue have been won by teams batting second. Will we see another victory for the chasing side today?

 

PITCH REPORT:-

Sanjay Manjrekar & Daren Ganga: "We're playing on Pitch Number 8 and the square boundaries are at 61m and 66m while the straight boundary on one side is 70m. It looks dry and there shouldn't be a lot of lateral movement"

 

TOSS:-

David Warner has called it right at the toss and Delhi Capitals will field first. FUN FACT - All the teams that have won the toss at the venue since 2018 in the IPL have decided to field first!

 

                                                          

 

David Warner, Delhi Capitals Skipper: "We are going to bowl first. The ground looks incredible, credit to the ground staff. It's about getting one win, and the momentum follows from there. We don't want to lose wickets in the powerplay. We have one change, Marsh is back and comes in for Powell."

 

Faf du Plessis, Royal Challengers Bangalore Skipper: "Would have done the same. Hopefully, it will turn in the second innings. Will be important for me and Virat to assess the conditions early. We have been good at our home ground as a batting unit. You got to pick your best batters and bowlers. Hasaranga comes in for Willey."

 

WE HAVE A DEBUT    AS VYSHAK VIJAYKUMAR GETS HIS CAP IN THE RCB CAMP!
Matchsummary.PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-6 Overs):-

RCB - 47/1 (7.8 RPO, 6x4, 1x6) || DC - 32/4 (5.3 RPO, 5x4, 0x6)

Middle Overs  (7-15 Overs):-

RCB - 87/5 (9.7 RPO, 3x4, 7x6) || DC - 76/3 (8.4 RPO, 7x4, 2x6)

Death Overs  (16-20 Overs):-

RCB - 40/0 (8.0 RPO, 4x4, 0x6) || DC - 43/2 (8.6 RPO, 6x4, 0x6)

 

Royal Challengers Bangalore win their second game in three matches at home this season, after getting the better of Delhi by 23 runs. After being put into bat, Virat Kohli and Bangalore got off to a flyer in the Powerplay with the King notching up his third half-century of the season. Delhi Capitals pulled things back with a brilliant spell from Kuldeep Yadav and some great death bowling to restrict RCB to 174/6. The Faf Du Plessis-led side continued with the momentum in the second innings, courtesy of some fine new-ball bowling, picking up 4 wickets inside the Powerplay. Vyshak Vijaykumar had a dream debut and notched up figures of 3/20, helping RCB win by 23 runs and move to 4 points. Delhi on the other hand slipped to their 5th consecutive defeat in the tournament.

 

                                        

 

David Warner, Delhi Capitals Captain: "I said at the toss we needed to do all disciplines well, but we lost three early wickets and we didn't chase down what should have been an easy chase. Bangalore came out and started well with the ball, Siraj was outstanding. Our bowling and fielding were exceptional, and the energy we showed was great too. We have five days off and have to go back and have a hard look at ourselves. We need to do better with the bat and build partnerships at the top of the order. It is a matter of starting well with the bat. Teams have come back well from this position before and we can go on and do better."

 

Faf Du Plessis, Royal Challengers Bangalore Captain: "We needed that win to get the confidence back in the group. Defending a total is not always easy at the Chinnaswamy, so very proud of them. It's the first day game of the season. Generally, the first six overs are more important. The way we bowled was just unbelievable. Huge credit to our seamers in the first six."

 

Virat Kohli is the Player of the Match

Virat Kohli: "I was quite disappointed that I got out to a full toss. I've been playing really well. One thing I mentioned to the guys in the change room was that 175 was enough on this pitch. It slowed down considerably. We did well to get to that score and had the belief it was enough. When I've played my best cricket, those are the balls I've put away consistently. When I put away their best balls, it puts pressure on the bowlers. I back myself to hit good shots and when they come off they look good."

Matchsummary.MatchName: Kolkata Knight Riders vs Sunrisers Hyderabad
Matchsummary.TossDetails: Kolkata Knight Riders Won The Toss And Elected To Field
Matchsummary.TossText: Won The Toss And Elected To Field
Matchsummary.PreMatchCommentary:
will play host to the from Hyderabad in Match No.19 of the Indian Premier League 2023. Both teams have winning momentum on their side having won their previous respective matches. KKR was involved in arguably the greatest finish this format has witnessed. Rinku Singh smashed 5 sixes off the last over to take the team home against GT. KKR has been riding off some individual performances from their players but has not shown the collective balance that the on-paper team promises. Venkatesh Iyer and Skipper Nitish Rana returning to form are a big positive for the side while the form of Andre Russell remains a big concern. The spin trio of Narine, Chakravarthy, and Suyash Sharma is the USP of the KKR team and has fared well so far. Their role will be more significant in the face-off against the middle order which consists of Aiden Markram and Rahul Tripathi who looked in good knick of things in their previous encounter against PBKS. The form of some of their star batters like Mayank Agarwal and Harry Brook will bother SRH but as they say, you are just a shot away from getting back in form and these two very well know how to bounce back. The bowling department looks complete in presence of Bhuvneshwar Kumar, Marco Jansen, T Natarajan, and Umran Malik along with spinners Washington Sundar & Mayank Markande. One can expect a thriller of a game between two sides that are just coming to terms with the potential they possess. 

 

VENUE STATS:
LAST 25 IPL MATCHES AT KOLKATA (SINCE 2017) : 
WON FIRST : 11
WON SECOND : 14
AVG 1ST INN TOTAL : 180
AVG 1ST INN WIN SCORE : 191

THE TEAM WINNING THE TOSS HAS ELECTED TO BOWL FIRST ON ALL THE 25 OCCASIONS! 

 

                                     

 

 

TOSS:-
wins the toss and elects to   first!

 

                                     

 

 

Nitish Rana, KKR Skipper: "We'll bowl first. We've been practicing here and there has been dew. Keeping in mind, we want to chase. Same XI for today."

 

 

Aiden Markram, SRH Skipper: "  THappy either way. Would have looked to bowl, that is the trend. This is a high-scoring wicket, so happy to get runs on the board. Nice to get a win, and today is a fresh start. Hopefully, we can do well. One change, Abhishek Sharma comes in for Washi Sundar
Matchsummary.PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-6 Overs) :-

SRH- 65/2 (10.5 rpo, 7x4, 2x6)  || KKR- 62/3 (10.3 rpo, 8x4, 3x6)

Middle Overs (7-15 Overs) :- 

SRH- 92/1 (10.2 rpo, 6x4, 6x6)  || KKR- 80/2 (8.8 rpo, 5x4, 4x6)

Death Overs (16-20 Overs) :- 

SRH- 71/1 (14.2 rpo, 8x4, 3x6)  ||  KKR- 63/2 (10.5 rpo, 5x4, 4x6)

 

Back-to-back wins for the Orange Army. SRH got off to a flying start after being asked to bat first by Nitish Rana. Harry Brook announced his arrival by smashing 12 boundaries and 3 maximums and went on to score his maiden 100 in the cash-rich league. Skipper Aiden Markram and Abhishek Sharma were his partners in the on-slaught. Only Sunil Narine was able to stop the flow of runs while other were taken to the cleaners by the SRH batters. A target of 229 was always going to be a daunting task, especially after losing three early wickets for just 20 runs. Jansen and Bhuvi were spot-on with the new ball. Just when one thought the match would be one-sided, began the fireworks from Skipper Nitish Rana who was having a different script in mind. The batter smashed 75 runs off 41 balls but failed to stay till the end. Rinku Singh the star of the previous game once again hit some lusty blows but could not take the team home tonight. Rinku Singh scored an unbeaten 58 off just 31. fell short by  23 runs but did come close by crossing the 200-run mark which shows the character this team possesses! 

 

 

Nitish Rana, KKR Skipper: "  I feel the way we bowled was not according to the plans. No matter what the wicket was like, this wasn’t a 230 wicket. One odd day you’ll get innings like Rinku had the other day, but not every day. We batted really well, we wanted to take the game deep and then you never know. Home advantage is one thing, but we know Eden Gardens tracks always play this way, we expected 200 to be a par score here and have been preparing that way, but we need to bowl better." 

 

 

Aiden Markram, SRH Skipper: "Feels good winning away from home. Was always going to be a tight game. With their firepower, we knew the total wasn't safe. Our bowlers showed character. I was fortunate that we got off to a great start. Makes life easier. We bat quite deep so you get the freedom. It's a great bunch of guys. It's cricket at the end of the day, always going to teach you a lesson."

 

 

Harry Brook is the Player of the Match

Harry Brook: "Was a special night. Thankfully we got over the line as well. Got a little tense in the middle. A lot of people say that opening the batting in T20 is the best time to bat. I'm happy to bat anywhere. I've had a lot of success batting at five. Made my name there. My four Test hundreds will have to be over this one. The crowd was phenomenal tonight. I enjoyed it."

Matchsummary.MatchName: Punjab Kings vs Gujarat Titans
Matchsummary.GroundName: Punjab Cricket Association IS Bindra Stadium
Matchsummary.TossDetails: Gujarat Titans Won The Toss And Elected To Field
Matchsummary.TossText: Won The Toss And Elected To Field
Matchsummary.PreMatchCommentary:
Hello from Mohali ????

We are all set for Match 1?8? of #TATAIPL 2023 ????????@PunjabKingsIPL square off against @gujarat_titans at home ????????

Who are you rooting for? #PBKSvGT pic.twitter.com/epwW9tT5Ht

— IndianPremierLeague (@IPL) April 13, 2023


The will be playing host to the Defending Champions in Match No.18 of IPL 2023. Both the teams have had a good run so far having won two of their three matches this season. Gujarat Titans won their season opener against CSK and then went on to beat Delhi in their second. They suffered a defeat at the hands of KKR in what one can say is a game for ages. The result was disappointing but GT was ahead of the 8-ball game till the 19th over courtesy of their stand in Skipper Rashid Khan who got a Hattrick in that game.lineup will see Hardik Pandya walk into the side after recovering from illness. Sai Sudharsan and Vijay Shankar have been in outstanding form and the presence of batters like Shubman Gill, Hardik Pandya, and David Miller makes the batting look far more destructive than their opponents. will have their task cut out against a strong-looking GT bowling which has match-winners in both spin and pace departments. Shikhar Dhawan was the only batter who displayed good form against SRH in their previous fixture. But the team might include Liam Livingstone who can be the icing on the cake for the PBKS side. The pace bowling unit looks settled with the likes of Arshdeep Singh and Nathan Ellis, adding Rabada will just take it to another level. A good chance to get back to winning ways for two sides that have lost their previous respective matches. 

 

HEAD TO HEAD:
and  have clashed twice in IPL, The head-to-head record is even-steven!

 

 

PITCH REPORT: 
Murali Karthik & Chris Morris: " The pitch is an absolute beauty for the batters. The grass cover is good too. The side winning the toss Would probably look to field first. It is a Big ground with lots of pockets which means the batters will have to do a lot of running". 

 

TOSS:-
wins the toss and elects to    first!

 

                          

 

Hardik Pandya, Skipper: "We will be Bowling first. It's a beautiful track, and from whatever I've seen it seems like a track where one can chase. We are the kind of side that takes a loss with a smile and move on.  It happens. It's a fresh game. Looking forward to doing well."

 

 

Shikhar Dhawan, Skipper: "  To be honest, It doesn't bother us. We were looking to field first too. We have been playing some good cricket so far and would look to continue doing that. You lose some, You win some. Looking forward to putting up a great show tonight. We have made Two changes to our side - Kagiso Rabada comes in for Nathan Ellis and Bhanuka Rajapaksa comes in for Sikander Raza.."
Matchsummary.PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-6 Overs) :-

PBKS- 52/2 (8.7 rpo, 8x4, 1x6)   || GT- 56/1 (9.3 rpo, 9x4, 0x6)

Middle Overs (7-15 Overs) :- 

PBKS- 47/2 (5.2 rpo, 6x4, 0x6)  ||  GT- 55/2 (6.1 rpo, 4x4, 0x6)

Death Overs (16-20 Overs) :- 

PBKS- 54/4 (9.0 rpo, 2x4, 4x6)  ||  GT- 43/1 (8.7 rpo, 4x4, 1x6)

 

A low-scoring cliffhanger at the IS Bindra Stadium has been won by the Gujarat Titans. PBKS got off to a decent start but bowlers did well to curb the scoring rate in the middle overs. Mohit Sharma and Rashid Khan conceded @ 4.50 & 6.50 respectively. Mohit Sharma playing in IPL after 2020 was impressive with his slower ball variations accounting for two wickets. GT came out all guns blazing while going after a target of 154. Wriddhiman Saha played the role of the aggressor while Shubman Gill played the sheet anchor role making 67 runs and getting out in the last over of the match. somehow clawed their way back into the match after restricting GT's scoring in the middle overs. Harpreet Brar gave nothing away to the batters and also accounted for a big wicket of Skipper Hardik Pandya. But it was all left to the ICE-MAN Rahul Tewatia who kept his cool and managed to strike a blow when the team needed 4 off the last 2 balls. A tough pill to swallow but PBKS did well to make a match out of this game. 

 

                                   

 

Shikhar Dhawan, Skipper: " We did not put many runs on the board. We have to rectify that thing going forward. We playing 56 dot balls was the reason we ended on the losing side. Losing early wickets also puts you on the back foot and we need to work on that thing. But, Very proud of the bowlers the way they brought us back in the game and kept the match alive was tremendous."

 

Hardik Pandya, Skipper: "To be very honest I would not appreciate for the game to go this deep. We need to go back to the drawing board and change a few things. They bowled really well. Luckily all our batters are in good nick. We should take more risks and play shots in the middle overs, need to make sure the game doesn't go so deep."

 

 

Mohit Sharma is the Player of the Match

Mohit Sharma: "I have had a good time at this venue. I thought of sticking to my variations and had a chat with Hardik in the middle overs, luckily it paid off. You need to train hard and give your 100 percent. Need to bowl according to the situation, and stick to the basics"

Matchsummary.MatchName: Chennai Super Kings vs Rajasthan Royals
Matchsummary.TossDetails: Chennai Super Kings Won The Toss And Elected To Field
Matchsummary.TossText: Won The Toss And Elected To Field
Matchsummary.PreMatchCommentary:
In match No.17 of IPL 2023, The  will lock horns with Rajasthan Royals at the MA Chidambaram Stadium in Chennai. Both teams would be riding on the back of winning momentum having surpassed their respective opponents in their previous encounters. The Hosts Chennai Super Kings did not win their tournament opener against GT but have done well in the two games thereafter. Ruturaj Gaikwad has been in sensational form and holds the key to CSK's success. Other batters have had decent outings while MSD has finished well whenever got the opportunity. The side is yet to find its ideal combination due to injury concerns for most of their key players. Spinner Mitchell Santner has done a good job and Ravindra Jadeja has complimented him well. The bowling unit needs to come good against a lineup that has some exciting batters in their ranks. The Top Order of Yashasvi Jaiswal, Jos Buttler, and Sanju Samson can take apart any bowling unit in a matter of 6 overs. Shimron Hetmyer in the middle order makes the batting look formidable, to say the least. seems to have a sorted bowling arsenal which has fared well so far. Trent Boult has been phenomenal with the new ball while Spinners Ravi Ashwin and Yuzvendra Chahal are the best ones to exploit the spin-friendly conditions at Chepauk. One can expect a packed stadium as 'Thala' 'MSD will be leading for the 200th time in IPL.

 

VENUE STATS:
IPL MATCHES AT CHENNAI SINCE 2018 : 
WON FIRST: 11
WON SECOND: 9
AVG 1ST INN TOTAL: 156
AVG 1ST INN WIN SCORE: 172

 

                                       

 

 

PITCH REPORT: 
Nick Knight: " Lots of cracks on the track, not much grass cover. The surface is firm enough here but fully can expect the spinners and slower variations to play a major role in this such a surface. The intent of the opening batters can have an impact on the game. In the middle overs, the spinners will come handy. In the game against the Super Giants, the spinners extracted a good amount of turn. There will turn and bounce on this surface. The key will be to bowl in the right areas, the 5-6 meters area will be the ideal length". 

 

TOSS:-
wins the toss and elects to    first!

 

Mahendra Singh Dhoni, Skipper: "We will field first. The wicket might be slightly on the slower side, different from the first game. Dew might play a role and it might get better in the second innings. It feels good leading for the 200th time and also I feel the crowd has been fantastic. Also, the fact that we started in the old stadium, it was very hot and humid at that time But now it feels like we're playing in Switzerland. It's always good to play here. We have seen cricket change in terms of how T20 was played at that point of time till now, a lot has changed. The crowd has been fantastic all throughout. We have had injury concerns and players were unavailable, but still, we have done well. Mitchell Santner and Pretorius make way for Theekshana and Moeen."

 

                                  

 

Sanju Samson, Skipper: "  We would have liked to field first too. We have started well and need to continue the winning momentum. We are playing at Chepauk after a long time. It has always been a pleasure to come to Chepauk and play here. Trent Boult misses out due to a small niggle and we have a couple of changes.
Matchsummary.PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-6 Overs) :-

RR- 57/1 (9.5 rpo, 8x4, 1x6)  || CSK- 45/1 (7.5 rpo, 5x4, 1x6)

Middle Overs (7-15 Overs) :- 

RR- 78/3 (8.7 rpo, 1x4, 4x6)  ||  CSK- 68/5 (7.5 rpo, 5x4, 0x6)

Death Overs (16-20 Overs) :- 

RR- 40/4 (8.0 rpo, 2x4, 2x6)  ||  CSK- 59/0 (11.8 rpo, 2x4, 5x6)

 

Another Nailbiter in the league, certainly not for the faint-hearted. Royals lost Yashasvi Jaiswal early but a partnership of 77(41) between Jos Buttler and Devdutt Padikkal kept the scoreboard ticking. Buttler top scored with 52 for RR. Cameos from Shimron Hetmyer and Ravi Ashwin helped the side get a fighting total of 175 runs on the board. It was Ravindra Jadeja's second spell that put breaks on the RR scoring rate in the middle overs. The left-arm spinner picked two wickets conceding just 21 off his 4 overs. In response, too lost its in-form opener Rururaj Gaikwad cheaply. Devon Conway and Ajinkya Rahane played as per the situation and compiled 68 off 43 between them. Conway top scored with 50 at a strike rate of 132. CSK lost its way when the Spinners ran through the middle order. Yuzvendra Chahal and Ravi Ashwin conceded only 52 runs in the eight overs between them and also accounted for four crucial wickets. Just when the chips were down, it was Ravindra Jadeja and the old war horse Mahendra Singh Dhoni who took on the bowling but failed by a very narrow margin in the end. MSD remained unbeaten on 32 from 17 but fell short to chase down the total by just 3 runs!

 

Mahendra Singh Dhoni, CSK Skipper: "I think in the middle overs we needed a bit more strike rotation, there wasn't much for the spinners but they had experienced spinners and we could not rotate strike. It was not that difficult and the ownership should come from the batters. It was good that we could reach striking distance (of the target) as we were the last pair. It really affects NRR when you get to the last phase of the tournament. You see the field, see the bowler and what the bowler is trying to do, and after that just stand still and wait for them to commit the mistake, if they bowl in good areas then good luck to them. I would wait for it and that is something that has worked for me, you need to back your strength and my strength is to hit straight."

 

Sanju Samson, RR Skipper: "  You have to give credit to the boys. Sandeep Sharma kept his cool at the end and bowled really well, we held on to our catches. Always have had good memories at Chepauk. The ball was gripping and hence, we brought Adam Zampa in as the Impact player. We had a good powerplay with Ruturaj Gaikwad getting out cheaply. The last two overs were tense but we got away. The match is not over until this man is out in the middle. We know what he is capable of. You have to have respect for that guy and what he can do."

 

RAVICHANDRAN ASHWIN is the Player of the Match

Ravichandran Ashwin: "I surprised people I guess. That's a role given to me, we lost Sanju. i am far better at judging my strengths, I take a few balls to get going. Every batting inning, I am padded up from the start. It's not an easy thing but it is good. I came off with a good Test form. I feel I am able to get a good grip and drop the ball at the right lengths

Matchsummary.MatchName: Delhi Capitals vs Mumbai Indians
Matchsummary.TossDetails: Mumbai Indians Won The Toss And Elected To Field
Matchsummary.TossText: Won The Toss And Elected To Field
Matchsummary.PreMatchCommentary:
Hello from Delhi ????

All set for Match 1??6?? in the #TATAIPL as the @DelhiCapitals face @mipaltan at home ????????????????

Which side are you backing tonight in the #DCvMI clash ???? pic.twitter.com/Lf0vYYGhRY

— IndianPremierLeague (@IPL) April 11, 2023

The action moves to the Arun Jaitley Stadium in Delhi where the hosts will take on the five-time champions . Both teams have not won a single match so far and would look to bounce back to winning ways. Capitals enter into this contest on the back of three defeats which came against LSG, GT, and RR. Skipper David Warner has been scoring runs but the same has not come at a strike rate that is expected from the Southpaw. Prithvi Shaw has not been in the best of forms either. The Top Order must fire if Delhi wants to go long in this tournament. Axar Patel and Lalit Yadav have been doing well according to their roles on the side. The Indian Pace battery of Khaleel Ahmed, Mukesh Kumar, and Chetan Sakariya has been expensive while Anrich Nortje has not had any major impact either. The bowling unit will need to come good against a side that is filled with some super-skilled shotmakers. Rohit Sharma and Co. have not got off to a good start either as the team has lost both of its encounters so far. Suffering defeats at the hands of CSK and RCB have raised many questions on their combination in the tournament in absence of some of their top players. Form of Rohit Sharma and Suryakumar Yadav at the Top is a major concern for the MI side. Ishan Kishan managed to get some runs on the board in the previous game but failed to capitalize. The bulk of the scoring has been done by Tilak Varma who has impressed everyone with his temperament while batting in difficult circumstances. Jofra Archer and Jason Behrendorff along with other Indian Pacers have leaked runs while the spin department consisting of Piyush Chawla, Hrithik Shokeen and Kumar Kartikeya has bowled some tight overs without much success. It will be an interesting contest between two teams that are looking to register their first win in the tournament!

 

HEAD TO HEAD:
Delhi and Mumbai have clashed 32 times. has won 15 whereas has come out victorious on 17 occasions.

 

VENUE STATS:
IPL & T20I MATCHES AT DELHI SINCE 2018 : 
WON BAT FIRST: 7
WON BAT SECOND: 13
AVG 1ST INN TOTAL: 174
AVG 1ST INN WIN SCORE: 182

 

PITCH REPORT: 
Chris Morris and Ian Bishop: " The dimensions of the ground are quite unique. 60 metres and 70 metres are the two square boundaries. Down the ground, it is 73 metres. There is a  grass cover halfway down in the middle of the pitch and around the 3-4 metre length, a bit of patchy grass and a few bare patches which could mean a bit of indifferent bounce which could be a challenge. The important thing for the bowlers is to hit those bare pitches right and consistently. Quick outfield and wind can play a factor tonight". 
 

 

TOSS:-
  wins the toss and elects to    first!

 

 

Rohit Sharma, Skipper: "We will look to bowl first. We batted first in the first 2 games but didn't do well enough. The pitch looks quite dry and probably some turn on offer and dew might also be a factor here. Changes include Riley Meredith in place of Tristan Stubbs. We will see how it goes. When the chips are down you need the senior players to stand up. Jofra Archer is not available."

 


David Warner, Skipper: "  We would have done the same thing' bowl first. For me it is about finding a rhythm and as a whole group, we gotta work harder and get sharper quickly. We got a forced change to our side, Khaleel Ahmed is injured and we got Yash Dhull in his place of him. Also, Rilee Rossouw makes way for Mustafizur Rahman."
Matchsummary.PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-6 Overs) :-

DC- 51/1 (8.5 rpo, 10x4, 0x6)  || MI- 68/0 (11.3 rpo, 10x4, 3x6)

Middle Overs (7-15 Overs) :- 

DC- 72/4 (8.0 rpo, 6x4, 2x6)  ||  MI- 55/1 (6.1 rpo, 1x4, 3x6)

Death Overs (16-20 Overs) :- 

DC- 49/5 (9.8 rpo, 4x4, 3x6)  ||  MI- 50/3 (10.0 rpo, 2x4, 4x6)

 

A match that was anybody's game till the very last ball. started well after being asked to bat first by Rohit Sharma. Skipper David Warner and Manish Pandey compiled 43 of five overs before Piyush Chawla tilted the momentum in MI's favour. The leggie accounted for three Delhi middle-order wickets giving away just 22 runs from his quota of four. Another twist came when Axar Patel unleashed his hitting prowess, the all-rounder smashed 54 runs at a strike rate of 216 helping DC post 172 on the board. Skipper David Warner played second fiddle compiling 51 at a meager strike rate of 108. In reply, the MI left-right duo of Ishan Kishan Rohit Sharma came out all guns blazing. The openers put on 71 runs off just 45 balls. Tilak Varma promoted at number three did justice to the role by rotating the strike and taking calculated risks. MI was cruising along until the DC finger spinners Axar Patel and Lalit Yadav put breaks on the MI scoring. Picking three wickets in a span of six balls brought DC back into the game. It was Tim David and Cameron Green who was able to stay calm and help register their first win of this season.

 

ROHIT SHARMA is the Player of the Match
 

Rohit Sharma, MI Skipper: "Winning the game is the most important thing. We have been working hard since the first game. I say that every time, the First win is always special. It was necessary to include a spinner here.  The spinners kept us in the game. We needed to bat well to chase the total. I thought everyone put their hand up. We had to make it count for the team. I needed to make use of the powerplay, I knew we had to keep attacking and take my chances. I tried to create a partnership and had good communication with Tilak. It was important for us to have a good partnership. We have young guys who haven't played IPL before, so it's important to have faith in them."

 

 


David Warner, DC Skipper: "  If You look at the last three IPL games we have witnessed all three have been amazing. We ended up on the wrong end of it today, but the guys were fantastic. Rohit played a fantastic knock at the top of the order for MI. Anrich Nortje is a world-class bowler and that's what we expect from him also Mustafizur Rahman was up to the mark. I think from the last three games, we've had some positives but we shouldn't lose wickets in clumps. Axar Patel should bat in the top four the way he is striking the ball. So, a lot of positives to take from the matches that have gone by so far.

Matchsummary.MatchName: Royal Challengers Bengaluru vs Lucknow Super Giants
Matchsummary.Commentss: Lucknow Super Giants Won by 1  Wicket
Matchsummary.TossDetails: Lucknow Super Giants Won The Toss And Elected To Field
Matchsummary.TossText: Won The Toss And Elected To Field
Matchsummary.Comments: Lucknow Super Giants Won by 1  Wicket
Matchsummary.PreMatchCommentary:
will play host to Lucknow Super Giants in Match No.15 of Indian Premier League 2023. The Hosts started the tournament with a win at home but were completely outplayed at Eden Gardens against KKR. Virat Kohli and Skipper Faf du Plessis looked in outstanding form in the first game but failed to fire in the second. Their previous encounter saw the batting unit fall like a pack of cards as they managed only 123 while chasing 204. RCB bowlers have not had any major impact so far, only David Willey and Karn Sharma have kept the scoring in check while the rest of the bowlers have leaked runs going over 10 r.p.o. Their mettle will certainly be tested by the batting department which consists of KL Rahul, Kyle Mayers, Nicholas Pooran, and Marcus Stoinis. Mayers has been in sensational form along with Nicholas Pooran who has been destructive at the backend of the innings. Skipper KL Rahul will be expected to return to his original form at the venue where he happens to be a local boy. LSG bowling has fared well so far, especially in the spin department. Krunal Pandya, Ravi Bishnoi, and Amit Mishra can trouble any batting lineup even with little assistance on offer. A battle that can decide the fate of the game is the contest between the RCB top order and LSG Spinners. LSG has won both their home games but failed to win in the away fixture, will this be the night KL Rahul and Co. change the narrative? 

 

HEAD TO HEAD:
The two teams have faced each other twice in IPL. has come out victorious on both occasions.

 

 

VENUE STATS:
IPL MATCHES AT CHINNASWAMY SINCE 2018 : 
WON BAT FIRST: 6
WON BAT SECOND: 8
AVG 1ST INN TOTAL: 175
AVG 1ST INN WIN SCORE: 192

 

PITCH REPORT: 
Simon Doull: " It is the exact same pitch that was used earlier for the Mumbai Indians game. The hard length seemed to work for the pace bowlers. It might not turn much. There's a little bit of grass cover on it. It's a very mosaic-looking surface. With not much of seam movement and not much of spin either. With the dimensions of the ground, 200 here is a must. "

 

TOSS:-
  wins the toss and elects to    first!

 

                                 

 

KL Rahul, Skipper: "We will field first, Going by the history at the venue. Quite simple and straightforward. It is still home for me. I have grown up here and played all my cricket at this venue. Won two home games and the game against CSK went down to the wire. Few changes. Wood comes back in and Romario Shepherd misses out and Avesh Khan is back in place of Yash Thakur."

 


Faf du Plessis, Skipper: "  Does look a little bit dry, to be honest. We were not sure whether to bat or bowl first. We chased last time around so We were thinking of changing it around this time. We are looking forward to this contest. Wayne Parnell is in for Bracewell and Mahipal Lomror comes in as well. "
Matchsummary.PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-6 Overs) :-

RCB- 56/0 (9.3 rpo, 5x4, 3x6)  || LSG- 37/3 (6.1 rpo, 4x4, 0x6)

Middle Overs (7-15 Overs) :- 

RCB - 81/1 (9.0 rpo, 3x4, 5x6)  ||  LSG- 134/2 (14.9 rpo, 10x4, 11x6)

Death Overs (16-20 Overs) :- 

RCB- 75/1 (12.5 rpo, 4x4, 7x6)  ||  LSG- 76/2 (15.2 rpo, 3x4, 0x6)

 

This is what IPL does to you! Have you at the edge of your seat till the last moment! Chinnaswamy Stadium witnessed a thrilling game of Cricket between two sides that were neck to neck till the very last moment. RCB after being sent into bat got off to a flying start courtesy of their opening pair of Virat Kohli and Faf Du Plessis. The duo put together 96 runs before Kohli was dismissed by Amit Mishra for a score of 61. Thereafter it was Glenn Maxwell who joined the Skipper Faf to put on 100 runs off just 44 balls to take the team total to 212. Maxwell smashed 6 sixes and 3 fours in his 59-run knock. LSG lost 3 wickets in the first four overs with just 23 runs on the board. A partnership between KL Rahul and Marcus Stoinis kept the LSG hopes alive but the asking rate increased with every ball passing. Stoinis departed after compiling 65 off just 30 balls and made way for Nicholas Pooran who took over the responsibility to lead LSG home. The left-handed swashbuckler reached his fifty in just 15 balls and turned the game on its head. Pooran smashed 62 off just 19 balls before falling to Siraj in the 17th over of the game. Ayush Badoni the last of the recognized batter held one end up but was unlucky as he was out HIT-WICKET to a ball which he scooped for six! It was Team LSG that displayed nerves of steel and chased down the total on the last ball of the innings! LSG register their first win against Royal Challengers!

 

 

KL Rahul, LSG Skipper: "This is the Chinnaswamy, the only venue where so many last-ball finishes are possible. From the position we were in, to end up winning it is superb. We had to go hard and the ball swung early, and they got 2-3 wickets to put the pressure on us. The only reason we got two points today is for the way the lower order batted."


Faf du Plessis, RCB Skipper: "  Very Disappointed. They played well through the middle. One ball one run. We backed ourselves to get a run-out. Just looking at the wicket, from 7-14 it was quite slow. In the last five overs, it started skidding. Really good for some good cricketing shots. Stoinis and Pooran played everything off the middle. They took on one of our main bowlers in his first couple of overs. It is a difficult place to bowl at the death."

 

 

NICHOLAS POORAN is the Player of the Match

Nicholas Pooran: "I want to dedicate this performance to my wife and newborn. We knew that the game was on, and Stoinis and KL had a wonderful partnership. Stoinis kept us in the game and I knew this was a nice wicket. We could chase even over 50 in the last four, it was about cashing in. The second ball I came in and smashed a six. It isn't about getting a look in, if it is in my slot then I will smash it for six"

A thoroughly entertaining contest that kept everyone on their toes!

Here's a quick round up of the emotion-filled #RCBvLSG clash which had twists and turns like no other ???? #TATAIPL pic.twitter.com/2CMUFu9K8I

— IndianPremierLeague (@IPL) April 11, 2023

Matchsummary.MatchName: Sunrisers Hyderabad vs Punjab Kings
Matchsummary.TossDetails: Sunrisers Hyderabad Won The Toss And Elected To Field
Matchsummary.TossText: Won The Toss And Elected To Field
Matchsummary.PreMatchCommentary:
Hello and welcome to the second match of the doubleheader day where the Sunrisers Hyderabad hosts the Kings from Punjab. One team -  did well in both their matches and won those while the other team - could'nt find a way to open their account yet. PBKS won both their matches defending the target and their batting and bowling looks quite fixed. SRH suffered in their batting department and are yet to make a score more than 131. The Orange Army will back their team today. Will PBKS continue their streak or will the hosts rise tonight?

Pitch Report:
Simon Doull and Simon Katich: "Here we have come from red soil to black soil. It's very dry with a few cracks. The team winning the toss will bat first potentially. We can expect a little bit of swing with the new ball. We can witness more spin than the other day. All in all, a pretty good surface. Bat first, put runs on the board."

 

TOSS:

 won the toss and elected to field first!!

 

                              

 

Aiden Markram, SRH Skipper: "We will have a bowl first, happy to chase. Looks like a good surface we can bowl well upfront hopefully. The atmosphere has been pretty calm. Hopefully we can claim our first victory here. Mayank Markande and Heinrich Klaasen are making their debut here today."

 

Shikhar Dhawan, PBKS Captain: "We wanted to bat first however. We would like to put a big total. They lost two games while chasing, so we'll like to put them under pressure. It looks like a very good wicket. The whole team is performing, that's very important and happy for that. We have an experienced bowling side. In the batting, we have experience and youngsters. We have a change as Matthew Short comes in for Bhanuka Rajapaksa."
Matchsummary.PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-6 Overs) :-

PBKS- 41/3 (6.8 rpo, 6x4, 1x6)  || SRH- 34/1 (5.6 rpo, 6x4, 0x6)

Middle Overs (7-15 Overs) :- 

PBKS - 47/6 (5.2 rpo, 7x4, 0x6)  || SRH- 84/1 (9.3 rpo, 11x4, 3x6)

Death Overs (16-20 Overs) :- 

PBKS- 55/0 (9.1 rpo, 4x4, 5x6)  ||  SRH- 27/0 (12.8 rpo, 5x4, 0x6)

 

started strong after getting a dismissal of the very first ball of the innings.  The visitors lost three top-order wickets inside the powerplay with just 41 on the board. Only two PBKS batters managed to get double-digit scores. Shikhar Dhawan carried his bat through the innings. The left-hander was batting on a different track altogether. Dhawan remained unbeaten on 99 off 66 balls playing with a boundary percentage of almost 80. Mayank Markande was impressive with his wily variations which fetched him 4 wickets conceding only 15 runs. While chasing 145, SRH started well but lost both their openers by the end of the ninth over. It was a Rahul Tripathi show from there on which took the team home with 17 balls to spare. Aiden Markram and Tripathi's 100-run stand made sure that the team does not have any more hiccups. Tripathi and Markram remained unbeaten on 74 & 37 respectively!

 

SHIKHAR DHAWAN is the Player of the Match

Shikhar Dhawan, Skipper: "Very happy with my knock. As a batting unit, we lost too many wickets and couldn't put a big total on the board and this is the reason we lost the game. 175-180 would have been a reasonably good score. It was seaming and swinging a bit, we couldn't tackle that and fell short. We had to apply ourselves on this wicket. I was pleased with the bowling, there was not much to defend, lot of learning for us from this game. I am grateful for the 99 and I am very happy. I was playing according to the situation and kept scoring boundaries when it was needed." 

 

Aiden Markram, SRH Skipper: "It was special. It was a little rough for us at the start but we are happy to win today. I am super happy for Mayank Markande. He bowled really well tonight. Also, Rahul Tripathi . He is a special talent. He is only a couple of balls away from something special and he showed his class tonight. Things get easy with Rahul at the other end. Great franchise to be a part of and it's our first win of the season, it means a lot to me as a Skipper of the side."

Matchsummary.MatchName: Gujarat Titans vs Kolkata Knight Riders
Matchsummary.Commentss: Kolkata Knight Riders Won by 3  Wickets
Matchsummary.TossDetails: Gujarat Titans Won The Toss And Elected To Bat
Matchsummary.TossText: Won The Toss And Elected To Bat
Matchsummary.Comments: Kolkata Knight Riders Won by 3  Wickets
Matchsummary.PreMatchCommentary:
The action moves to the Narendra Modi Stadium in Ahmedabad where the    will take on the   . Both teams have momentum on their side having won their previous respective encounters. Titans have played two games so far and have won both their matches showing why they are the defending Champions of the cash-rich league. Shubman Gill, Sai Sudarshan, and Vijay Shankar have been doing the scoring with the bat while David Miller's inclusion provides that firepower finish that the Titans need at the backend of the innings. The bowling unit is well balanced with the likes of Mohammad Shami, Rashid Khan, Alzarri Joseph, and Skipper Hardik Pandya himself. GT has played some exciting cricket so far and would look to go past KKR taking their win tally to three. KKR under a new leader Nitish Rana has won 1 out of their two previous games this season. They won the game against RCB in a dominating manner and showed their true capabilities in both departments. It is KKR's bowling that has impressed everyone, especially their spin trio of Sunil Narine, Varun Chakravarthy, and Suyash Sharma. Tim Southee and Umesh Yadav make for a strong pace bowling pair that can be lethal with the new ball. Having players like Shardul Thakur and Andre Russell with all-around abilities makes the balance of the side even better. It will be interesting to see  Nitish Rana's strategy against a solid team like Gujarat Titans. 

 

HEAD TO HEAD:
 and   have faced each other in IPL. Titans came out victorious.

 

VENUE STATS:
IPL MATCHES AT AHMEDABAD SINCE 2021 : 
WON FIRST: 2
WON  SECOND: 6
AVG 1ST INN TOTAL: 157
AVG 1ST INN WIN SCORE: 175

 

TOSS:-
wins the toss and elects to    first!

 

                            

 


Rashid Khan, Skipper: "We will bat first, looks like a nice fresh wicket, hopefully, we can put up a good score and later defend it. Hardik Pandya is not playing today. Just slightly unwell, so don't want to take any risks. As a team, we will try and play good cricket. We have just one change, Vijay Shankar is in for Hardik Pandya".

 

Nitish Rana, Skipper: "  We wanted to bat first as well because of the weather conditions. I felt defending might be comparatively easier. Also, so that our spinners can make use of the surface in the second half but it's okay. We have two changes. Lockie Ferguson comes in for Tim Southee and Mandeep Singh makes way for N.Jagadeesan."
Matchsummary.PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-6 Overs) :-

GT- 54/0 (9.0 rpo, 7x4, 0x6)  || KKR- 43/2 (7.1 rpo, 4x4, 2x6)

Middle Overs (7-15 Overs) :- 

GT - 78/3 (8.6 rpo, 7x4, 2x6)  || KKR- 106/1 (11.7 rpo, 8x4, 8x6)

Death Overs (16-20 Overs) :- 

GT- 72/1 (14.4 rpo, 4x4, 5x6)  || KKR- 60/4 (12.0 rpo, 3x4, 5x6)

 

A game that could have gone either way. It was a good toss to win and bat first for the Titans. All the GT batters got to decent starts but it was the duo from Tamil Nadu; Sai Suddharsan and Vijay Shankar that did maximum damage.  Sudharsan registered his second fifty of the season while Vijay Shankar played a destructive knock of 63* off just 24 balls to help the team post a target of 205. Narine was the pick of the bowlers getting three wickets while Umesh Yadav bowled economically conceding 8 r.p.o. The run chase did not start that well for the Knight Riders as they lost Rahmanullah Gurbaz and Jagadeesan cheaply within the powerplay. But a partnership of 100(55) between Impact Player Venkatesh Iyer and Skipper Nitish Rana kept KKR's hopes alive. It was Alzarri Joseph who tilted the momentum in GT's favor picking both the set batters in quick succession. The Skipper Rashid Khan who was not having the best of days came back out of nowhere accounting for the first Hattrick of IPL 2023  dismissing any chance of a win for the visitors. Who knew Rinku Singh had other plans? The batter smashed 31 runs off the last over to take the team home in an emphatic fashion! Rinku Singh remained unbeaten on 48 off 21 balls.  

 

 

Rashid Khan, GT Skipper: "It's a tough game for us, especially for me as a captain. You need 30 plus in the last over, the same thing happened for us last year when we won. We will learn from it, more importantly a good game of cricket and the fans would have loved it.".

 


Nitish Rana, KKR Skipper: "  Honestly, We had a little belief. Rinku did something like this last year too, although we didn't go onto win that game. When the second six was struck, we started believing more because Yash Dayal wasn't executing that well. As a captain, it's important to have the belief. But this is a 1 in a 100 chance for something like this to happen and really glad that Rinku took us home the way he did."

 

 

RINKU SINGH is the Player of the Match

RINKU SINGH: "Had the belief that I can do it. Last year too I was in a similar situation in Lucknow. Had the belief back then too but could finish for the side.  Those shots just happened one after the other. Glad that this time we ended on the winning side"

Matchsummary.MatchName: Mumbai Indians vs Chennai Super Kings
Matchsummary.Commentss: Chennai Super Kings Won by 7  Wickets
Matchsummary.TossDetails: Chennai Super Kings Won The Toss And Elected To Field
Matchsummary.TossText: Won The Toss And Elected To Field
Matchsummary.Comments: Chennai Super Kings Won by 7  Wickets
Matchsummary.PreMatchCommentary:
Hello and welcome to the live coverage of the biggest clash in the TATA IPL, where the Chennai Super Kings  take on the Mumbai Indians  in the El-Classico of Indian Premier League ! CSK and Thala Dhoni head into the match on the back of a win at Chepauk. Mumbai on the other hand have played only one match so far in the tournament and will look to register their first victory of the tournament tonight.

 

Head to Head:-

The Rohit Sharma led side have had the advantage at Wankhede, winning 7 of the 10 games against CSK there. However, in the last 3 seasons the Head to Head between these two giants is 3-3 each. Who will turn out on top today?

 

Pitch Report :-

Ian Bishop: "Short leg-side boundary for the right-hander, just 63m and the fine-leg boundary is just 54m. Expect a lot of ramps today. The average score here in 2022 was 167, but teams will be hoping for more than that on a ground with these dimensions. There is a lot of grass, all the way through but no clear big patches, so the ball might do a little bit earlier. Hoping for a really good cricket match."

 

DHONI HAS CALLED IT RIGHT AT THE TOSS AND CSK WILL FIELD FIRST!

 

                            

 

MS Dhoni, Chennai Super Kings Captain: "We will bowl first. One of the most memorable venues, not only the 2011 win but when we won in 2007, when we came back the reception we got was great. We have a few injury concerns, Stokes has an injury, Mo is not available. Ajinkya and Pretorius are playing. These are the two changes we have made."

 

Rohit Sharma, Mumbai Indians Captain: "It's a good pitch, always a good pitch to bat. Always something in it for the bowlers, and we just have to play good cricket. We have been really well in the last few days, spoke about what went wrong in our last game in Bangalore, hopefully we can get the result tonight. Unfortunately we have got an injury, I would not call it an injury but it is just a precaution - Jofra is not playing, we have got the other guys. It is a great feeling to be back at the Wankhede. The crowds have always been loud, look forward to playing in front of our home crowd."
Matchsummary.PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-6 Overs) :-

MI- 61/1 (10.1 rpo, 9x4, 1x6)  || CSK- 68/1 (11.3 rpo, 6x4, 3x6)

Middle Overs (7-15 Overs) :- 

MI - 48/5 (5.3 rpo, 2x4, 1x6)   ||  CSK- 66/2 (7.3 rpo, 5x4, 2x6

Death Overs (16-20 Overs) :- 

MI- 48/2 (9.6 rpo, 4x4, 3x6)   ||  CSK- 25/0 (8.1 rpo, 3x4, 0x6)

 

A dominating win for the Chennai Super Kings against Mumbai Indians in Mumbai. got the team to a flying start accumulating 61 runs in the powerplay. Both Ishan Kishan & Rohit Sharma got starts but failed to capitalize on the same. Spinners Ravindra Jadeja and Mitchell Santner brought about a shift in the momentum running past the MI top & middle order. Left-arm spin accounted for 5 wickets between them giving away only 48 runs in 8 overs. A cameo of 31 from Tim David helped MI get to a respectable total of 157 which was always a tough one to defend against a deep batting lineup of . Jason Behrendorff provided the early breakthrough that MI needed but Ajinkya Rahane had different plans. The local boy smashed a 19-ball fifty and took the game away from the Mumbai Indians within the powerplay. Rahane scored 61 off 27 while Ruturaj played second fiddle remaining unbeaten on 40. In the end, CSK won the game comfortably by 7 wickets and 11 balls to spare!

 

Rohit Sharma, MI Skipper: "We lost our way in the middle and did not capitalize on the start we got. It was a good pitch and we were about 30-40 runs short. Have to give credit to their spinners, they bowled well and kept us under pressure. You need to try out different things, you need to attack and be brave. We have got a couple of young guys on the side and we got to give some time to them. They have real talent and we have to back them and show trust in their ability. The senior guys need to step up starting with me. We know the nature of this tournament, when the tournament starts we need to get some momentum and when we don't it is tough to get going. Just two games and all is not lost still. If you win, you can win a few on the trot, and when you lose it is hard to come out of that momentum. ." 

 

MS DHONI, CSK Skipper: "It was not easy after losing Deepak Chahar in the first over,  He is our new ball bowler and Mangala is playing his first match. The good thing is spinners bowled well and got us the game. It was a bit two-paced after 7 overs and started turning as well.  Mangala was good and so was Pretorious in their second spells. Also, Deshpande, We believe in his abilities and when you're new you are under pressure but playing in the IPL for a few years brings different pressure. He had a great domestic season, he is improving. I and Ajinkya Rahane spoke at the start of the season and I told him to play to his strengths and use his ability to manipulate the fields. I told him to go and enjoy himself, don't take the stress and we'll back him. That is exactly what he did."

 

 

RAVINDRA JADEJA is the Player of the Match

Ravindra Jadeja: "When we were bowling, the odd ball was turning. So I and Mitch wanted to bowl in good areas because they have so many power hitters. Every time we come here, the wicket plays differently, sometimes it is flat, and sometimes it is sticky. I and Santner discuss everything and whoever starts advises the other person on what lengths to bowl. We keep talking and advising each other."

Matchsummary.MatchName: Rajasthan Royals vs Delhi Capitals
Matchsummary.TossDetails: Delhi Capitals Won The Toss And Elected To Field
Matchsummary.TossText: Won The Toss And Elected To Field
Matchsummary.PreMatchCommentary:
Game 11 of Indian Premier League 2023 will take place at the Barsapara Cricket Stadium in Guwahati between the Home Team and . The visitors have played two matches so far and have lost both. The Skipper David Warner has been scoring runs but has not been at his best in terms of the strike rate of the opening batter. Mitchell Marsh and Prithvi Shaw both have not fired so far which restricts the capitals from getting off to a flying start. A few good knocks have been played by Sarfaraz Khan, Rilee Rossouw, and Axar Patel but have not created any impact. The pace department consisting of Mukesh Kumar, Khaleel Ahmed, Chetan Sakariya has not lived up to the expectations so far but the arrival of Anrich Nortje will just help lift their morale in the coming days. Spinners Kuldeep Yadav and Axar Patel know how to bounce back from tough situations and will be expected to step up against a Royals setup that is filled with some Powerpack performers. Jos Buttler, Sanju Samson, and Yashasvi Jaiswal have already given glimpses of what they are capable of. All three top-order batters have registered a fifty to their name. Yuzvendra Chahal has been doing the damage with the ball alongside Trent Boult who has been terrific in the powerplay. Jason Holder and R Ashwin have kept it tight from the other end. It will be a tough ask to get past a well-balanced Side which is determined to give a winning experience to the home crowd!

 

 

TOSS:-
wins the toss and elects to first!

 

                              

 

HEAD TO HEAD:
This is a tiebreaker of the head-to-head contest between the Royals and the Capitals. Both have won 13 apiece against one another.

 

VENUE STATS:
IPL & T20I MATCHES AT DELHI SINCE 2018 : 
WON FIRST : 8
WON SECOND: 12
AVG 1ST INN TOTAL: 174
AVG 1ST INN WIN SCORE: 182

 

David Warner, DC Skipper: "Don't know what's gonna happen. Hopefully we will start well. Marsh has gone home to get married. All the best to him. There is one forced change with Powell coming in for Marsh. There are changes. Lalit comes in as well for Sarfraz. Manish Pandey comes in".


Sanju Samson, RR Skipper: "  I think it looks a good wicket to bat on. Should be a high scoring game. Let's see how we turn up. With the impact rule, we can balance the side both ways. We can kind of manage. Jos is alright. We have a couple of changes. I am a bit confused. I will have to see the sheet as it keeps changing thanks to the impact rule."
Matchsummary.PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-6 Overs) :-

RR- 68/0 (11.3 rpo, 14x4, 0x6)  || DC- 38/3 (6.3 rpo, 6x4, 0x6)

Middle Overs (7-15 Overs) :- 

RR - 62/3(6.8 rpo, 4x4, 2x6)   ||  DC- 75/2 (8.3 rpo, 7x4, 0x6)

Death Overs (16-20 Overs) :- 

RR- 69/1 (13.8 rpo, 5x4, 5x6)   ||  DC- 29/4 (5.8 rpo, 2x4, 0x6)

 

The Rajasthan Openers came out all guns blazing after being sent into bat by the DC Skipper David Warner. The left-right duo was going over 11 r.p.o when the fielding restrictions were on. A partnership of 98 off just 50 balls shattered the DC bowler's confidence early in the innings. It was a total shift in momentum after the wicket of Jaiswal and DC managed to pull things back a little. But Hetmyer had other plans. Hetmyer remained unbeaten with 39 off 21 balls to his name. Jaiswal and Buttler smashed 60 & 79 respectively. Chasing a target of 200 under lights was never going to be easy especially after losing 2 wickets off the first over itself. Boult hit the first blow by picking Shaw and Pandey in the first over itself. Warner did get going from one end but failed to score at a brisk rate. Lalit Yadav was the only batter who played as per the required rate while the rest failed to cross even the 20-run mark. Trent Boult and Yuzi Chahal picking three wickets apiece gave nothing away to the DC batters. DC managed to score only 140 losing the game by a huge margin of 57 runs. 

 

David Warner, Delhi Capitals Captain: "When you are chasing 200, you need to start well. It is just about executing your skills. It is frustrating to hit to the fielders. Just didn't go to plan."

 

Sanju Samson, Rajasthan Royals Captain: "Almost everything went to plan. The way I play this format I take a few balls to settle in and then go out there and express myself. My role in the team is very clear. Last game when we played here, it was a swimming pool and we were not able to keep the ball dry, we will have to get used to wet balls. Yuzi and Ash bhai know how to do it with the wet ball. The ball being new was very crucial for us and Ash bhai got through two important overs."

 

Yashasvi Jaiswal is the Player of the Match

Yashasvi Jaiswal: "I have worked hard. Learning and growing as a young player is important for me. In my mind, I was like if it is a loose ball I will hit it. I knew I can take on a few bowlers."

Matchsummary.MatchName: Lucknow Super Giants vs Sunrisers Hyderabad
Matchsummary.GroundName: Bharat Ratna Shri Atal Bihari Vajpayee Ekana Cricket Stadium
Matchsummary.Commentss: Lucknow Super Giants Won by 5  Wickets
Matchsummary.TossDetails: Sunrisers Hyderabad Won The Toss And Elected To Bat
Matchsummary.TossText: Won The Toss And Elected To Bat
Matchsummary.Comments: Lucknow Super Giants Won by 5  Wickets
Matchsummary.PreMatchCommentary:
The action moves to the Bharat Ratna Shri Atal Bihari Vajpayee Ekana Cricket Stadium in Lucknow for the 10th Game of the Indian Premier League 2023. Both the teams have lost their previous respective games and would be looking to change the momentum in their favour with a win. The have won one and lost one out of the two games so far. Although they lost their previous game against CSK, they had a good first game at their home against the Delhi Capitals. Kyle Mayers has been the top performer with the bat and has taken the team off to a flying start in both games. The opener is striking at 215 while his teammate from West Indies Nicholas Pooran is striking the ball well too. it will be interesting to see the batting order with the inclusion of Quinton de Kock in the LSG camp. Looking at the bowling side of things, Mark Wood has bowled steamy spells and has picked 8 wickets so far in the tournament. Ravi Bishnoi has kept things tight and also chipped in with wickets at crucial moments. on the other side faltered against Rajasthan Royals in their tournament opener by 72 runs. Only Mayank Agarwal and Abdul Samad got starts while the rest of the batters failed to cross even the 20-run mark. T Natarajan was the only bowler who conceded less than 8 r.p.o while the rest of the bowling unit consisting of Fazalhaq Farooqi, Bhuvneshvar Kumar, Umran Malik, and  Washington Sundar went for more than 10 r.p.o. SRH will expect a change in fortunes with the return of their Skipper Aiden Markram. 

 

HEAD TO HEAD:
have come out victorious in the only encounter between the franchises.

 

VENUE STATS:
T20s AT LUCKNOW : 
WON FIRST: 5
WON SECOND: 1
AVG 1ST INN TOTAL: 160
AVG FIRST INNINGS WIN SCORE: 172

 

WICKETS TAKEN BY PACE: 51

WICKETS TAKEN BY SPIN: 19

 

PITCH REPORT: 
Simon Katich: " We have got a black-soil pitch tonight, which means less pace and bounce as compared to the last game that was played on a red-soil pitch. We are not expecting much dew either Here, batting first could be the better option" 
 

 

TOSS:-
wins the toss and elects to first!

 

                             

 

Aiden Markram, SRH Skipper: "We will look to bat first. The wicket looks quite dry. Ideally we first need to get to our first win. The guys are looking pretty excited. We have made two changes to our side. One of them is me."

 

KL Rahul, LSG Skipper: "  We ended up batting well in the previous game. We will look to adjust and play well tonight. We can come in with a set plan as we are playing for the first time here. Mark Wood will miss out. Avesh is taking a break as he got himself injured. Our plan will be to be aggressive and get the wickets."
Matchsummary.PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-6 Overs) :-

SRH- 43/1 (7.1 rpo, 5x4, 1x6)  || LSG- 45/2(7.5 rpo, 5x4, 1x6)

Middle Overs (7-15 Overs) :- 

SRH - 40/3 (4.4 rpo, 2x4, 0x6)  ||  LSG- 73/3 (8.1 rpo, 8x4, 1x6)

Death Overs (16-20 Overs) :- 

SRH- 38/4 (7.6 rpo, 3x4, 2x6)  ||  LSG- 9/0 (9.0 rpo, 0x4, 1x6)

 

121 Was never going to be enough against an in-form LSG batting unit. SRH failed to take advantage of the powerplay and also kept losing wickets at regular intervals. The decision to bowl Krunal Pandya in the powerplay did wonders for KL Rahul. The left-arm finger spinner scalped wickets off consecutive deliveries in the 8th over and thereafter there was no way back for the SunRisers. Pandya conceded only 18 in his 4 overs and accounted for 3 wickets. Ravi Bishnoi too bowled beautifully giving nothing away to the batters. Amit Mishra chipped in with two wickets which took him to the number four position on the list of highest wicket-takers in IPL. In response, LSG got to a good start scoring 45 in the powerplay which took them well ahead of the asking rate. Kl Rahul played the sheet anchor role to perfection and Krunal Pandya played the role of the aggressor taking LSG home with four overs to spare. LSG is slowly and steadily making this stadium their fortress which is yet to be breached! 

 

Aiden Markram, SRH Skipper: "Not enough runs on board, tried to get near to 150-160 but lost too many wickets in that process and didn’t get any momentum going our way. We realized it wasn’t going to be a great wicket to bat in terms of history, but we were happy to fight it out. Credit to them for bowling brilliantly according to the conditions. Good effort from our bowlers, but we didn’t give them enough runs to play with ." 

 

KL Rahul, LSG Skipper: "We've been here for a couple of weeks now. We now are aware of the nature of the wicket here. Even when Jaydev bowled a few cutters, it was gripping. Was a no-brainer to bowl spin early on. First instinct when I saw both pitches was that we'll need to bat smartly here. We've adapted well as a batting unit. Each person plays very differently.Good to see the players are going there and putting in the practice."

 

 

KRUNAL PANDYA is the Player of the Match

KRUNAL PANDYA: "Was a Very good day at the office I can say that for sure. Enjoyed my bowling as well as Batting. Runs, wickets - everything is hard-earned. Everything is special. More right-handers in their lineup so I knew that I'd have a role to play tonight. This year I'm in a good headspace altogether. Once you have clarity up there, things fall in place. I'm very process-driven and don't think about results. Want to dedicate this to my wife who has always supported me"

Matchsummary.MatchName: Kolkata Knight Riders vs Royal Challengers Bengaluru
Matchsummary.Commentss: Kolkata Knight Riders Won by 81  Runs
Matchsummary.TossDetails: Royal Challengers Bengaluru Won The Toss And Elected To Field
Matchsummary.TossText: Won The Toss And Elected To Field
Matchsummary.Comments: Kolkata Knight Riders Won by 81  Runs
Matchsummary.PreMatchCommentary:
The iconic Eden Gardens Stadium at Kolkata will host Match No.9 of the Indian Premier League 2023. The Home team   did not have the best of starts suffering a defeat at the hands of Punjab Kings in a rain affected match. Umesh Yadav and Varun Chakravarthy bowled economically but Tim Southee , Shardul Thakur and Sunil Narine conceded above 10 r.p.o. Nitish Rana who has just taken up the leadership role for KKR could have been tactical with his bowling changes as a few bowlers in the side were not utilised despite others leaking runs. WHile chasing 191, KKR lost early wickets and failed to get the momentum on their side. Impact Player Venkatesh Iyer and Nitish Rana looked in good touch while Rana got a start but failed to capitalize. It will be interesting to se KKR's game plan against RCB that is coming off a win against the five time champions Mumbai Indians. Mohammad Siraj was lethal in the first game and Karn Sharma too chipped in with wickets. the run-chase of 171 was made to look too petty courtesy of some impeccable batting from Skipper Faf du Plessis and King Kohli. A partnership of 148 between the openers gabe no chance to the opposition to stage a come back. Kohli smashed an unbeaten 82 (49) while Faf made 73 at a strike rate of 170. This is also one of the oldest rivalry in IPL as RCB & KKR contested the first ever IPL Match in 2008. Crowd will be thrilled to welcome their home team for the first time after 2019.

 

HEAD TO HEAD:
In the 30 clashes between them, Knight Riders  have won 16 while 14 matches have been clinched by the Royal Challengers !

 

PITCH REPORT: 
Danny Morrison: "The square boundaries are pretty short at the Eden Gardens - one of them being 58 meters, and the bigger one at 70 meters. The straight boundary is slightly longer at 75 meters from one end. 195 is the average first innings score here over the last nine matches" 


 

 

VENUE STATS:
IPL & T20I MATCHES AT KOLKATA SINCE 2022 : 
WON FIRST : 3
WON SECOND: 2
AVG 1ST INN TOTAL: 184
HIGHEST FIRST INNINGS SCORE: 207

 

TOSS:-
wins the toss and elects t o field first!

 

                             

 

Faf du Plessis, RCB Skipper: "We are going to have a bowl. There was dew last night and Hoping it will get skiddy in the second innings. That's a long way away. Today is a completely new game. Really motivated to put in a good performance. Forced change with Topley being injured. Willey comes in..".

 

Nitish Rana, KKR Skipper: " We would have bowled first as well. Nothing new, Dew is a factor here so it is always better to field first. Also, the new Impact Player rule helps if you are batting second. We have one change, Anukul Roy is replaced by Suyash Sharma."
Matchsummary.PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-6 Overs) :-

KKR- 47/2(7.8 rpo, 4x4, 1x6)   || RCB- 50/2 (8.3 rpo, 6x4, 2x6)

Middle Overs (7-15 Overs) :- 

KKR - 93/3 (10.3 rpo, 7x4, 5x6)  ||  RCB- 52/7 (5.8 rpo, 4x4, 1x6)

Death Overs (16-20 Overs) :- 

KKR- 64/2 (12.8 rpo, 7x4, 3x6)  || RCB- 21/1 (8.7 rpo, 2x4, 1x6)

 

It was a good toss to win for as they curtailed the batting to 89 for 5 in the 12th Over. Only Rahmanullah Gurbaz from the Top order got going. The opener scored 57 runs but kept losing partners at the other end. The shift in momentum came when the onslaught from Rinku Singh and Shardul Thakur started to dismantle the RCB bowling attack. Both put together 103 runs off just 47 balls taking the team total to 204. Rinku Singh played second fiddle compiling 46 off 33 balls while Shardul Thakur took on the bowlers and accumulated 68 at a mind-boggling strike rate of 235! In response, RCB came out all guns blazing but lost the wickets of both their openers Kohli and Faf within the powerplay itself.  Sunil Narine and Varun Chakravarthy bamboozled the RCB batters who were clueless about their mystery. Chakravarthy scalped four while Narine grabbed two wickets. Suyash Sharma the debutant too joined the party accounting for three wickets. Eden Gardens erupted to see their team decimate a big team like RCB and win the game by a huge margin of 81 runs!  

 

Faf du Plessis, Skipper: "We had set it up nicely with the ball initially, probably at 90/5 around 13 overs, we kind of gave away 20-25 runs extra on this wicket. Shardul played incredibly well, he took the game away from us and KKR's leg-spinners bowled brilliantly. They got on top of us, with Narine and Chakaravarthy, they put the squeeze on us really well." 

 

Nitish Rana, Skipper: "In the previous match, there were a lot of positives. We were seven down but still, we fought. Today we showed great fight. Gurbaz played a brilliant knock at the top of the order and Thakur changed the complexion of the game. Credit should also be given to Rinku as he played second fiddle to Thakur and paced his innings well. Umesh and Southee started decently with the ball. Then, our spinners bowled really well."

 

 

SHARDUL THAKUR is the Player of the Match

Shardul Thakur: "I don't even know where it came from but looking at the scorecard at that time, everyone would have thought we are struggling. But your subconscious mind takes over. You also have to have skills to do that at a higher level, but we also work hard in the nets. There is a period where we can slog it in the nets. The coaching staff do the throwdowns and gives us the option of range-hitting. And you know the pitches - they always suit the batsmen, don't they?."

Matchsummary.MatchName: Rajasthan Royals vs Punjab Kings
Matchsummary.TossDetails: Rajasthan Royals Won The Toss And Elected To Field
Matchsummary.TossText: Won The Toss And Elected To Field
Matchsummary.PreMatchCommentary:
Match No.8 of IPL 2023 will see two teams that have started on a high note. The beat Sunrisers Hyderabad while went past  Kolkata Knight Riders in their respective season opener. Sanju Samson led RR won in a dominating fashion courtesy of their batting which decimated the opposition in the powerplay itself. The Top order which consists of Jos Buttler, Yashasvi Jaiswal, and Sanju Samson smashed half-centuries and also crossed the 100 run mark in just 7.4 Overs which is their quickest in the Cash Rich League. Their Premier Bowler Trent Boult too started in an emphatic manner dismissing two of their top three in the first over of the innings. Likes of Jason Holder, KM Asif, and Ravi Ashwin kept things tight while Spin King Yuzvendra Chahal kept picking wickets at regular intervals. The Purple cap holder of the previous season scalped four wickets conceding 17. The bowling unit will have to be on their guard going against A lineup that was terrific against KKR the other day. All of the seven batters that got a chance to take the field got off to a start and most importantly played according to their roles. Bhanuka Rajapaksa top scored with 50 at a strike rate of 156 while Skipper Shikhar Dhawan compiled 40 playing the sheet anchor role. While defending 191 Left Arm Pacer Arshdeep Singh provided early breakthroughs while Spinners Rahul Chahar, Sikandar Raza, and Brar bowled economic spells. PBKS would also be excited to welcome Kagiso Rabada and Liam Livingstone who will strengthen both their batting and bowling against a tough opponent. The Clash will take place at the Barsapara Cricket Stadium in Guwahati which is Rajasthan Royals' second home ground.

 

 

HEAD TO HEAD:
In the 24 clashes between them, have won 14 while 10 matches have been clinched by the !

 

PITCH REPORT: 
Daren Ganga: "The dimensions of the ground are quite unique in a way that the square boundaries vary from one another. The pitch seems like a belter. There is a very little cover of live grass also what we can see is some dryness on the wicket. Players with the ability to swing the ball will prove to be effective. Likes of Boult, Arshdeep can be in business" 

 

TOSS:-
wins the toss and elects to  field first!

                             

Sanju Samson, RR Skipper: "We would like to first here. Expecting some dew later on in the night. We will use the opportunity to bowl first and take advantage. It is a great thought by the franchise to have a game here to promote cricket in Assam. Totally Loving it here. The players have also gotten used to the conditions. We are going in with the same side tonight.".

 

Shikhar Dhawan, PBKS Skipper: " We all know that dew is a factor later on, In fact there is already Dew as you can see. We too wanted to bowl first. It is alright, does not matter much. We are used to such conditions. Let's take it day by day. Not putting too much pressure on myself and on the team. It is the process that matters the most. We are going in with the Same eleven from the last game."
Matchsummary.PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-6 Overs) :-

PBKS- 63/0 (10.5 rpo, 9x4, 2x6)  ||  RR- 57/3 (9.5 rpo, 6x4, 3x6)

Middle Overs (7-15 Overs) :- 

PBKS - 89/1 (9.9 rpo, 7x4, 3x6)  ||  RR- 67/3 (7.4 rpo, 3x4, 2x6)

Death Overs (16-20 Overs) :- 

PBKS- 45/1 (9.0 rpo, 3x4, 2x6)  ||  RR- 68/3 (13.6 rpo, 4x4, 5x6)

 

Punjab Kings after being sent into bat by Sanju Samson came out all guns blazing. The openers got the team off to a flying start smashing 63 runs in the powerplay. Prabhsimran Singh scored 60 off just 34 balls while the Skipper Shikhar Dhawan leading from the front remained unbeaten on 86 off 56 balls. Holder was amongst wickets and Ravi Ashwin bowled economically but PBKS managed to set a big target of 198 for the Royals. RR had a new pair of Yashasvi Jaiswal and Ravi Ashwin to start with in absence of Jos Buttler who came in at number three. Batters were playing as per the asking rate but kept losing wickets at regular intervals courtesy of some brilliant bowling from Nathan Ellis who accounted for four middle-order wickets. Sanju Samson top scored with 42 (25) at a strike rate of 168. The momentum had totally shifted in PBKS' favour until a partnership of 62 off 27 balls between Shimron Hetmyer and Dhruv Jurel almost got RR home. Hetmyer scored 36 from 18 while Jurel remained not out on 32 from 15 balls. PBKS manage to win the game by 5 in a nail-biting finish at the Barsapara stadium in Guwahati! 

 

Sanju Samson, RR Skipper: Honestly, it was a very good track to bat on, not much movement with the new ball and they batted well, had the momentum their side in the powerplay. Our bowlers used the variations well on a high-scoring wicket and I thought we did quite well to restrict them to 197.I was expecting the dew to come in the second innings, but it was evident that it was there right at the start, need to be prepared better for such things in the next game. 

 

Shikhar Dhawan, PBKS Skipper: "There were some nervous moments, I was trying to keep my calm and discussing plans with my bowlers. Was happy with the score we put up. We scored 197 and my bowlers gave those early wickets and then Nathan came in and bowled superbly. It was a full team effort."

 

NATHAN ELLIS is the Player of the Match

Nathan Ellis: "Just stoked to get the win under the belt, pleased to get some awards but from a team's point of view nice to get that win. In T20 every ball matters, staying in the moment is the key. When I was bowling in the backend, I was trying to get my variations right and calculate what the best ball is at that time. For me it's cross-seam and it worked out really well tonight."

Matchsummary.MatchName: Delhi Capitals vs Gujarat Titans
Matchsummary.TossDetails: Gujarat Titans Won The Toss And Elected To Field
Matchsummary.TossText: Won The Toss And Elected To Field
Matchsummary.PreMatchCommentary:
The Defending Champions coming off an impressive win against the Chennai Super Kings will head to the Arun Jaitley Stadium to take on the . The Titans picked up from where they left the previous season ticking almost all the boxes. Shubman Gill looked in sublime touch smashing 63 off just 36 balls while Wriddhiman Saha, Sai Sudarshan, and Vijay Shankar complimented the Opener from the other end. The presence of the likes of Hardik Pandya, Rahul Tewatia, and Rashid Khan makes for a destructive middle order that can dismantle any bowling attack. Pace Bowlers Mohammad Shami and Alzarri Joseph had a good first game while the Left Arm pace battery of Joshua Little and Yash Dayal conceded at 10.20 and 14 r.p.o respectively. Rashid Khan's all-round performance helped GT win the season opener by 5 wickets But the team will definitely miss the services of Top order batter Kane Williamson who is ruled out of the tournament due to an injury sustained in the previous game. The Capitals on the other side would want to come back stronger in their own backyard after suffering a heavy loss at the hand of LSG in their season opener. Dropping Kyle Mayers early in the match cost them the game against LSG. All the DC bowlers were taken to the cleaners and Khaleel Ahmed was the only bowler who conceded less than 8 r.p.o. Likes of Mukesh Kumar and Chetan Sakariya coming off an impressive domestic season would want to replicate their performance in the cash-rich league while the Spin department consists of Axar  Patel and Kuldeep Yadav possesses enough experience to bounce back after a bad day at work. Delhi is a formidable unit, especially its batting department which has some big names like Skipper David Warner, Prithvi Shaw, Mitchell Marsh, and Rovman Powell. A high-scoring match can be anticipated between sides that is filled with some clean strikers of the cricket ball. 

 

VENUE STATS:
IPL & T20I MATCHES AT DELHI SINCE 2018 : 
WON FIRST: 7
WON SECOND: 12
AVG 1ST INN TOTAL: 174
AVG 1ST INN WIN SCORE: 182

 

 

PITCH REPORT: 
Aaron Finch: "Dimensions of 64 meters on either side and 70 metres down the ground. This wicket is smack bang in the middle. Remember what we saw a couple of weeks ago in the Test match, there was not a blade of grass to be seen. This wicket has a nice even covering of grass. This is an unbelievably flat wicket. I expect there will be a little bit more pace and a little bit more carry to assist the swing and the seam bowlers. But there are a couple of parts on this wicket that are very dry. Even though they are dry, don't expect that to have a huge influence on this game. 165 is the average score here. The trend of this tournament has teams wanting to chase. Personally, I wouldn't be against trying to bat first." 

 

 

HEAD TO HEAD:
got the better of   in the only encounter between the franchises!

 

 

TOSS:-
wins the toss and elects to field first!

                               

Hardik Pandya, GT Skipper: "Going to have a bowl first. Not really sure how the pitch is going to play. Obviously losing Kane Wiilanson is disheartening. David Miller comes in his place. Sai Sudharsan comes in for Vijay Shankar. We don't do much of talking. Just about keeping our plans simple and focusing on controllables.".

 

David Warner, DC Skipper: " Looks like a nice wicket to bat. Have to come out with positive intent and post a good total on the board. Hopefully we can entertain,  Win in front of the home crowd and make it our fortress. Anrich Nortje and Abhishek Porel come in. Rovman Powell misses out."
Matchsummary.PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-6 Overs) :-

DC- 52/1 (8.2 rpo,7x4, 0x6)  || GT- 54/3 (9.0 rpo, 8x4, 2x6)

Middle Overs (7-15 Overs) :- 

DC - 69/4 (7.6 rpo, 5x4, 3x6)  || GT- 63/1 (7.0 rpo, 4x4, 0x6)

Death Overs (16-20 Overs) :- 

DC- 41/3 (8.2 rpo, 2x4, 3x6)   || GT- 46/0 (14.8 rpo, 3x4, 3x6)

 

The Capitals got off to a decent start after being asked to bat first by Hardik Pandya. The momentum changed in the 9th over when Alzarri Joseph got the wickets of David Warner and Rilee Rossouw off consecutive deliveries. Mohammad Shami's spell in the powerplay accounted for two crucial top-order wickets of Shaw and Marsh which dented DC's scoring rate. Sarfaraz Khan and Debutant Abhishek Porel managed a few runs but failed to convert the same into big scores. Axar Patel's cameo at the backend ensured that DC reaches a respectable total of 162. In response, GT did not get the best of starts either, Shubman Gill, Wriddhiman Saha, and Skipper Hardik Pandya were back in the hut before the powerplay but the run rate was well above the asking rate at that point. A partnership of 53 between Sai Sudharsan and Vijay Shankar steadied the GT Ship and ensured that DC has no way to come back into the game. Some lusty blows from Miller sealed the game for the Titans with 11 balls to spare. Sudharsan top scored with an unbeaten 62 off 48 balls while Shankar and Miller scored 29 and 31 respectively. Gujarat Titans do not have many big names in the side but all the players are capable to change the course of the game on a given day. Role definition is the key here!

 

David Warner, DC Skipper: Don't think I was surprised with the early movement that GT seamers got. It did swing more than anticipated. Also, from the other end, it kept a little low. They showed how to adapt to such situations. We Got another 6 games here so we have to get things on track. Have to be on point and expect that swing in the first few overs. We were in the game till the end but they played well. Sai Sudharsan batted well. Miller does what he does. With the dew also, it'll be challenging if you don't get 180-190. 

 

 

Hardik Pandya, GT Skipper: It was actually funny at the start, we didn't know what was happening honestly, but something was happening. The way the bowlers pulled back was amazing. I go with my instinct when it comes to deciding when to bowl whom. I like to back myself. Most often than not, I punch first rather than taking the punch. It helps you take the right decisions. The team is doing well, Someone's putting their hand up and taking responsibility. Speaking about Sai Sudharsan, he has been batting terrifically. His hard work is showing!

 

SAI SUDHARSAN is the Player of the Match

Sai Sudharsan: "I am a little bit nervous as this is my first award. I was thinking about what needs to be done right. I wasn't under any pressure. It was a bit low and skidding initially, my plan was to take the game deep and take it forward from there. Weathering the storm was more satisfying."

Matchsummary.MatchName: Chennai Super Kings vs Lucknow Super Giants
Matchsummary.Commentss: Chennai Super Kings Won by 12  Runs
