Matchsummary.TossDetails: Lucknow Super Giants Won The Toss And Elected To Field
Matchsummary.TossText: Won The Toss And Elected To Field
Matchsummary.Comments: Chennai Super Kings Won by 12  Runs
Matchsummary.PreMatchCommentary:
Action Returns to Chepauk in Match No.6 of IPL, 2023 where the Chennai Super Kings will be host to the Super Giants from Lucknow. CSK will be playing in their own backyard after four long years. All eyes will be on Mahendra Singh Dhoni who is just 8 runs short of Landmark 5000 runs in IPL. The four-time champions did not have the best of starts having lost to Gujarat Titans in their first match of the season. Ruturaj Gaikwad looked in brilliant touch smashing 92 runs off just 50 deliveries but lacked support from the other batters while Rajvardhan Hangargekar bowled his heart out picking three crucial wickets. Skipper, MSD did not get enough time in the middle but did manage to hit one lusty blow out of the park. The Home crowd will anticipate the likes of Moeen Ali, Devon Conway, Ben Stokes, and Ravindra Jadeja to put up a show at the fortress against a team that is riding high on confidence. LSG has been consistent in its performances throughout the last season and has started the 2023 edition with a win. LSG went past the Capitals in a dominating manner winning the match by a margin of 50 runs. The West Indian duo of Kyle Mayers and Nicholas Pooran were instrumental in the Team's success but the main damage was done by Mark Wood who accounted for 5 scalps conceding just 14 runs. Wood was previously a part of the CSK setup in 2018 where he played just one game for the yellow army. LSG is a formidable side with the right balance considering the presence of All-rounders in their ranks. But it all comes down to how the KL Rahul team handles the pressure of playing the Chennai Super Kings at the MA Chidambaram Stadium in Chennai! 

 

VENUE STATS:
MATCHES AT CHENNAI SINCE 2018 : 
WON BAT FIRST: 10
WON BAT SECOND: 9
AVG 1ST INN TOTAL: 153
AVG 1ST INN WIN SCORE: 167

 

 

                                  

 

HEAD TO HEAD:
and have encountered only ONCE, LSG came out victorious chasing down 211 and winning by 6 wickets!

 

TOSS:-
win the toss and elect to field first!


KL Rahul, LSG Skipper: "We'll field first. We want to know the target & what we are chasing. It was a really good performance against DC, all boxes ticked. We need to turn up again today and better those performances. Jaydev Unadkat misses out, Yash Thakur comes in and Krishnappa Gowtham comes in place of Ayush Badoni.".


Mahendra Singh Dhoni, CSK Skipper: "Does mean a lot to be back here in Chennai. IPL started in 2008 but we've not played a lot of cricket here thereafter. Only about 5-6 seasons we've been here. This is the first time the full stadium will be operational. Really glad that we get to play all our home games here at Chepauk, means a lot to all of us. We are going in with the Same squad for this game. Need to keep assessing our situation and keep revisiting our targets, keep a realistic goal in mind and take it from there."
Matchsummary.PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-6 Overs) :-

CSK- 79/0 (13.1 rpo, 6x4, 4x6)  || LSG - 80/1 (13.3 rpo, 10x4, 2x6)

Middle Overs (7-15 Overs) :- 

CSK - 85/3 (9.4 rpo, 6x4, 5x6)  || LSG- 70/4 (7.7 rpo, 2x4, 5x6)

Death Overs (16-20 Overs) :- 

CSK- 53/4 (10.6 rpo, 3x4, 4x6)  || LSG- 55/2 (11.0 rpo, 3x4, 6x6)

 

CSK got off to a flying start courtesy of some brilliant batting from Ruturaj Gaikwad and Devon Conway who put up 110 runs off just 54 balls. Gaikwad scored his second fifty of the season while Conway complimented him with 47 of just 29 balls. Ravi Bishnoi did manage to pull it back a little after dismissing Gaikwad but cameos from Shivam Dube, Ambati Rayudu, and MSD helped CSK reach a huge total of 217. An asking rate of 10.85 was always going to be a difficult chase with the spinners available in the CSK ranks. LSG did make the most of the powerplay courtesy of some hard-hitting by Kyle Mayers who was on fire once again. Mayers registered his second fifty finishing with 53 of just 22 balls. CSK Spinners Mitchell Santner and Moeen Ali put breaks on the scoring rate and also kept picking wickets at regular intervals. The spin duo conceded just 47 from their 8 overs. Ali was the pick of the bowlers accounting for 4 LSG wickets. LSG did good to reach 205 but fell short by 12 runs to breach the fortress!

 

KL Rahul, LSG Skipper: "Not the ideal start after winning the toss. The first couple of overs it was a bit sticky and there was a bit of movement, but we did not bowl in the right areas and they got that flier. When you have quality batters in the opposition, they make you pay. Something for us to learn but the way Rutu and Conway played was brilliant. It does take time to learn what lengths to bowl on a surface, but to go for 70-odd in six overs isn’t ideal. We batted well but we didn’t capitalize on the small momentum.".

 

Mahendra Singh Dhoni, CSK Skipper: " All of us were thinking how the wicket would play. I initially thought it would be much slower. But it was a wicket where you could actually score runs. Fast bowling needs to improve. Bowlers Need to bowl according to the conditions. What is important is to be aware as to what the opposition bowlers are doing and going about with their plans. One more thing if they'll have to bowl no no-balls or wides they'll have to find a new captain. It will be my second warning and then I'll be off. Only reason we've scored those runs is if the surface is nice."

 

 

Moeen Ali is the Player of the Match

Moeen Ali : "They have big hitters. Almost tried to bowl like Test cricket. Tried to spin the ball. The combination was nice (with Santner). The partnership worked well. MS knows what he's doing. He knows when to bowl players.."

Matchsummary.MatchName: Royal Challengers Bengaluru vs Mumbai Indians
Matchsummary.Commentss: Royal Challengers Bengaluru Won by 8   Wickets
Matchsummary.TossDetails: Royal Challengers Bengaluru Won The Toss And Elected To Field
Matchsummary.TossText: Won The Toss And Elected To Field
Matchsummary.Comments: Royal Challengers Bengaluru Won by 8   Wickets
Matchsummary.PreMatchCommentary:
The second encounter of the super Sunday Double header is between the two powerhouses of the Indian Premier League,  and . MI is one of the most successful Cricket franchises in the world with five IPL titles to their credit. The side has done wonders under the captaincy of Rohit Sharma in the past few years. But the team would look for a better season after a disastrous 2022 outing. MI will not have the services of their star bowler Jasprit Bumrah for this season but the addition of Jofra Archer can fill up that pace bowler slot for the Mi bowling unit. The inclusion of All-rounder Cameron Green provides a lot of balance to the MI lineup. Ishan Kishan, Suryakumar Yadav, and Skipper Rohit Sharma make for an amazing Top order and the presence of Tim David, Tristan Stubbs and Dewald Brewis in the middle order completes the batting requirements. The Pace attack consists of Archer, Cameron Green, Jason Behrendorff, Sandeep Warrier, and Arjun Tendulkar while the spin department has the likes of Hrithik Shokeen and Kumar Kartikeya. Looking at their opponents, RCB had a good outing in the previous season where they made it to the playoffs. A big plus for the side is the current form of Virat Kohli. Faf du Plessis has been able to find the right combination of having both youth and experience in the side. The side needs Glenn Maxwell their T20 specialist to come well if the team has to go the distance. Other Overseas stars in the RCB ranks are Finn Allen, Michael Bracewell, David Willey, Wanindu Hasaranga and Reece Topley. The Indian contingent consists of Mohammad Siraj, Harshal Patel, Suyash Prabhudessai, and the finisher Dinesh Karthik who can feature in the playing eleven. It will be a cracker of a contest between two teams containing a lot of firepower!

 

Head to Head :-

Both the teams have squared off against each other 30 times with  leading the tally with 17 wins. Who will begin their campaign with a win this year?

 

Venue Stats:-

In a total of 81 IPL matches played here, 44 of them have been won by the teams chasing the target. 169 is the average first innings score here!

 

TOSS:-
RCB win the toss and elect to field first!

 

Faf du Plessis, RCB Captain: "We are going to bowl first tonight. There's a bit of weather around. There has been a bit of dew in the practice games too. Myself, Bracewell, Maxwell, and Topley are the four overseas players. We have been so excited to get started to tonight. This is one of the great stadiums to play cricket in. The goal is to make it to the playoffs and take one game at a time.

 

Rohit Sharma, MI Captain: "With this new Impact player rule teams are backing themselves to chasing totals. At the end of the day, you have to come out and play good cricket to win. We know we have to bat first here and we are prepared. The pitch looks good, we just have to come out with positive intent. Our Four overseas players are Tim David, Cameron Green, Jofra Archer and Jason Behrendorff. Last season was a disappointment for us but again, we know exactly where we went wrong so we will try and correct those mistakes this time around. We have got some new faces as well so hopefully, those guys play freely and express themselves."
Matchsummary.PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-6 Overs) :-

MI- 29/3 (4.8 rpo, 3x4, 1x6)  || RCB- 53/0 (8.8 rpo, 5x4, 3x6)

Middle Overs (7-15 Overs) :- 

MI - 73/2 (8.1 rpo, 6x4, 3x6)  || RCB- 95/1 (10.5 rpo, 5x4, 7x6)

Death Overs (16-20 Overs) :- 

MI- 69/2 (13.8 rpo, 6x4, 3x6)  || RCB- 24/1 (20.0 rpo, 1x4, 3x6)

 

It was a good toss to win and bowl first for the Royal Challengers. MI top order was back in the hut before the powerplay got over and the run-rate was less than 5 r.p.o. Skipper Rohit Sharma, Ishan Kishan and Cameron Green fell cheaply while Surya got a start but failed to convert it into a big score. The only batter who looked in form was Tilak Varma who played a blinder scoring an unbeaten 84 off 46 deliveries. In response to a target of 172, Virat Kohli and Skipper Faf du Plessis came out all guns blazing. The duo added 148 runs in 14.5 overs and took the game away from the opposition. Faf was the one who started the onslaught and Virat Kohli followed the path. Faf's 73 (43) and Virat's unbeaten 82 (49) ensured that RCB secure the total with 3.4 overs to spare. It was a treat to watch batters like Virat Kohli and Faf du Plessis in such a kind of form!

 

Rohit Sharma, MI Captain: "Didn’t have a great start with the bat in the powerplay. But, it was a really good effort from Tilak Varma and a few other batters in the end. But, we didn’t execute well with the ball too. Tilak Varma is a positive person, and quite talented as well. Some of the shots he played, showed a lot of courage. Hats off to Tilak to get us to a competitive total of 171. We didn't even bat to half of our potential. Probably 30-40 runs more would have been ideal. Without Jasprit Bumrah, Of course, this is a different setup but someone needs to put their hand up and step up. We can't keep dwelling in the past. Injuries are not in our control, we can't do much about it. The other guys in the setup are quite talented as well. We need to give them that support. Just the first game of the season, there's a lot to look forward to."

 

FAF DU PLESSIS is the Player of the Match. 

 

Faf du Plessis, RCB Captain: "Nice to start the way we did. Initially in the powerplay , Siraj had the tail up and he set the tone for us. Right through the innings, our bowlers stuck to the plans and executed them perfectly.  If you took pace off the ball, it wasn't too easy to play and there was something in it for the spinners too but as a batter if you got into good positions you could score runs on this track. My first time playing here as a home player and it's a special feeling, especially batting with Virat Kohli. Energy bounces off him.   This start will be huge for us as a team."

Matchsummary.MatchName: Sunrisers Hyderabad vs Rajasthan Royals
Matchsummary.TossDetails: Sunrisers Hyderabad Won The Toss And Elected To Field
Matchsummary.TossText: Won The Toss And Elected To Field
Matchsummary.PreMatchCommentary:
The next encounter of the Indian Premier League 2023 will see the take on the Royals from . The home team has made a lot of changes in their previous season's squad where they finished 8th in the points table. The Englishman Harry Brook was their most expensive buy for a whopping 13.25 cr. Mayank Agarwal coming off a brilliant domestic season is another name that can change the fortunes of the Sunrisers. They also have a new leader in Aiden Markram who will miss the first game and Bhuvneshwar Kumar is set to take charge for the season opener. The other overseas players to watch out for includes Glenn Phillips, Adil Rashid, and Fazalhaq Farooqi. The Indian talent consists of the star performer with the bat last season Rahul Tripathi, Abhishek Sharma, Washington Sundar, and speed guns Umran Malik and T Natarajan. The Royals camp on the other side has not made many changes to their squad after a good outing last year where they finished Runners-up. Skipper Sanju Samson, Jos Buttler, Shimron Hetmyer, Devdutt Padikkal, and Yashasvi Jaiswal make the batting look destructive, especially after the inclusion of the All-rounder Jason Holder who adds a lot of balance to the side. The spin department oozes with class in presence of Ravi Ashwin and Yuzvendra Chahal while Trent Boult will spearhead the pace attack. Both the teams have some exciting talent that can ensure a mouth-watering contest in the first of the super Sunday doubleheader. 

 

HEAD TO HEAD:
and have rubbed shoulders with each other in a total of 16 matches in the IPL so far and it's all even as both sides have managed to win eight games a piece.

 

VENUE STATS:
DAY MATCHES IN HYDERABAD IPL 2018 & 19 : 
WON BAT FIRST: 2
WON BAT SECOND: 1
AVG 1ST INN TOTAL: 191

 

Pitch report Sanjay Manjrekar : "Once again a fantastic venue, the pitch is more or less central- pretty even boundaries all along. The pitch looks pristine, a bit like how an English pitch would be, covered by dried grass and white in color. There won't be the ready-made turn for the spinners. Hyderabad has been a high-scoring venue, teams that have won chasing have an average score of 190. So that tells you this is a venue where you are better off chasing, because sometimes in the pressure to get runs on the board, you end up with just 150-160. The pitch is perfect, one where you would want to chase. In the afternoon, maybe there might be some turn."

 

TOSS:-
SRH win the toss and elect to field first!

 

Bhuvneshwar Kumar, SRH Skipper: "We will bowl first, looks like a good batting wicket. Will take advantage with the chase. About Captaincy, I'll try my best and do what is needed for the team. Farooqi, Harry Brook, Adil Rashid, Glenn Phillips are our four foreigners.".

 

Sanju Samson, RR Skipper: "This is a new IPL with new rules. We have to respect the opponents and play to our strengths. Always feel good to wear this jersey, looking forward to playing in Jaipur. I and Sangakara,  We have a good relationship with each other. We always discuss things regularly before games. Four foreigners today's game for us are - Buttler, Holder, Boult and Hetmyer.."
Matchsummary.PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-6 Overs) :-

RR- 85/1 (14.1 rpo, 13x4, 3x6)  || SRH- 30/2 (5.0 rpo, 4x4, 0x6)

Middle Overs (7-15 Overs) :- 

RR - 75/2 (8.3 rpo, 6x4, 3x6)   || SRH- 55/5 (6.1 rpo, 1x4, 2x6)

Death Overs (16-20 Overs) :- 

RR- 43/1 (8.6 rpo, 2x4, 2x6)  || SRH- 46/4 (9.2 rpo, 3x4, 3x6)

 

Last Year's finalists Rajasthan Royals get off to a winning start in the TATA IPL 2023, defeating Sunrisers Hyderabad by 72 runs. Last year's Orange Cap winner Jos Buttler continued from where he left off, scoring a half-century in the Powerplay, helping the team get off to a flyer. Yashasvi Jaiswal and Sanju Samson also scored fifties to help Rajasthan put on the first 200-run total of this IPL. The team from Jaipur continued their momentum with the ball, with Trent Boult starting with a double wicket maiden, after which last year's Purple cap winner Yuzvendra Chahal continued to weave his magic with the ball, picking up 4 wickets today, helping Rajasthan post a comfortbale win and move to the top of the table.

 

Bhuvneshwar Kumar, Sunrisers Hyderabad Captain: "We did not bowl pretty well, first match of the season and a lot to improve. South Africans are coming back and we definitely will be a much better batting side, we have to move forward from this game."

 

Sanju Samson, Rajasthan Royals Captain: "Was wondering how we'll start this season, very happy with this. Having batters like Buttler and Jaiswal, the mindset with which they play the Powerplay we can expect such starts. We are a very good side and we need to keep our heads down. Today was a very good start but we are looking at finishing things well. We will find out if there are any weaknesses as the tournament goes on."

 

Jos Buttler is the Player of the Match

Jos Buttler: "Fantastic start. We had a really good last season but this is a great marker for this time. I plan a bit but react on the day, assess the conditions and try and put pressure on the bowlers. Enjoying my cricket at the moment, playing with a clear mind."

Matchsummary.MatchName: Lucknow Super Giants vs Delhi Capitals
Matchsummary.GroundName: Bharat Ratna Shri Atal Bihari Vajpayee Ekana Cricket Stadium
Matchsummary.Commentss: Lucknow Super Giants Won by 50  Runs
Matchsummary.TossDetails: Delhi Capitals Won The Toss And Elected To Field
Matchsummary.TossText: Won The Toss And Elected To Field
Matchsummary.Comments: Lucknow Super Giants Won by 50  Runs
Matchsummary.PreMatchCommentary:
Lucknow Super Giants will face the Delhi Capitals in Match No.3 of IPL,2023. LSG impressed everyone with their performance in their first season last year as the KL Rahul-led side finished third on the table. DC on the other side did not do that well last year but has been playing consistently for some time now. DC will miss the services of their Captain Rishabh Pant and David Warner is set to take charge in his absence. The site consists of some super strikers like David Warner, Prithvi Shaw, Mitchell Marsh, Rovman Powell, and Manish Pandey in the ranks who can take apart any bowling unit on a given day while the bowling unit comprises Anrich Nortje, Mustafizur Rahman, Chetan Sakriya , Axar Patel and Kuldeep Yadav which can trouble any batting unit on any track. They will have their task cut out against an LSG batting Unit that has some quality players like KL Rahul, Quinton De Kock, Nicholas Pooran, Deepak Hooda, and Marcus Stoinis. Their bowling responsibility will rest on the shoulders of Mark Wood, Avesh Khan, Jaydev Unadkat, and spinners Ravi Bishnoi and Krunal Pandya. In a tournament where momentum matters the most, both teams would want to get off to a flying start. 

 

PITCH REPORT: 
Ian Bishop: " The 22-yards is interesting because there's very little grass at one end. It's very bare and the ball may grip on this half. As we walk down, you can see the disparity. You get to the middle, you start seeing more grass, and it's patchy as well. So it's a pitch with contrasting halves. There's so much more grass on one side, but it's patchy grass. So when it hits the bald areas, it could hold. Hoping that the red soil makes the bounce and carry." 

 

Delhi Capitals won the toss and elected to field first!

 

David Warner, Delhi Capitals Skipper: "Going to have a bowl. For us it's about trying to assess conditions early and knowing what to chase. Choosing the impact player can be quite confusing, maybe stressful at times. I'm excited to be back. We send our best wishes out to Rishabh."

 

KL Rahul, Lucknow Super Giants Skipper: "That's how most IPL teams work, they want to make their home ground their fortress. We haven't played here. We're going in with no expectations, for all you know, it might be a good batting wicket. The Impact Player is new, still getting used to it. It gives teams a chance to be in the game or come back in the game. It's fun. Hopefully it's a good change."
Matchsummary.PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-6 Overs) :-

LSG- 30/1 (5.0 rpo, 1x4, 1x6)  || DC- 47/2 (7.8 rpo, 8x4, 0x6)

Middle Overs (7-15 Overs) :- 

LSG - 100/3 (11.1 rpo, 2x4, 9x6) || DC- 63/3 (7.0 rpo, 5x4, 1x6)

Death Overs (16-20 Overs) :- 

LSG- 63/1 (12.6 rpo, 2x4, 6x6)  || DC- 33/4 (6.6 rpo, 2x4, 1x6)

 

LSG start their campaign in an emphatic manner in front of their home crowd. It was Kyle Mayers who put up some show with the bat smashing 73 of just 38 balls. Mayers hit 7 maximums and 2 boundaries which set the tone for LSG to set a big total on board. Nicholas Pooran and Ayush Badoni playing vital cameos helped the team reach a score of 193. Khaleel Ahmed was the most economical of the bowlers but dropping Mayers early on in the innings proved to be the party spoiler for DC. LSG bowlers too came out all guns blazing. It was an out-and-out Mark Wood show, the Englishman dismissed Shaw and Marsh of consecutive deliveries and went on to pick 5 wickets in total. DC Skipper David Warner and Rilee Rossouw were the only batters that got some runs under their belt while the rest of the unit failed to get going. DC never looked like chasing down the total once the asking rate was over 10 r.p.o. Avesh Khan and Ravi Bishnoi chipped in with two wickets each while the impact player Krishnappa Gowtham made sure that the run rate was in check. DC ultimately lost the game by 50 runs which is a huge margin in a T20 match. 

 

KL Rahul, LSG Captain: "It was a great start. We were clueless about the pitch but read it well. We'll take confidence from this win into our next games. Toss is not in our hands but with the new rules, you get to play with the team you want. Gives great depth in the bowling and batting department. I thought we were 30 runs above par after the first innings. The way Kyle Mayers batted took the game away from the opposition. We took an aggressive approach against the spinners and put them under pressure straight away. I thought they started pretty well, but we came back well to pick wickets at the right time. It was Mark Wood's day today, it's a dream for a fast bowler and a team. He made it count."

 

David Warner, DC Captain: " It was a bit of a challenge. We had some early momentum with the fast bowlers, they bowled very well in the powerplay. A few dropped catches and the momentum shifted there but you can't take anything away from Lucknow. They batted very very well. I thought 170 was a par score but they did an exceptional job. Momentum is a big thing in this game. Don't take it away from Wood, he's an exceptional bowler and he showed his true talent tonight. "

 

MARK WOOD is the Player of the Match. 

 

Mark Wood: "Last time I played for CSK, but it didn't go quite well. But I wanted to make an impact in this game. The landing area was a bit of an issue, but I am pleased with my rhythm as I managed to take wickets. We have trained here, so we knew dew was going to be a factor. Tried to keep things simple, the planning with Morne helped me"

Matchsummary.MatchName: Punjab Kings vs Kolkata Knight Riders
Matchsummary.GroundName: Punjab Cricket Association IS Bindra Stadium
Matchsummary.Commentss: Punjab Kings Won by 7  Runs  (D/L Method)
Matchsummary.TossDetails: Kolkata Knight Riders Won The Toss And Elected To Field
Matchsummary.TossText: Won The Toss And Elected To Field
Matchsummary.Comments: Punjab Kings Won by 7  Runs  (D/L Method)
Matchsummary.PreMatchCommentary:
Two teams that start their IPL 2023 campaign are the Kings from Punjab and Knight Riders from Kolkata. Both Teams failed to create an impact in the previous season finishing in the bottom half of the points table and would definitely look to start the season on a winning note. Another thing in common between the two sides is the change in leadership. Shikhar Dhawan will captain the PBKS side while another Delhi boy Nitish Rana is set to lead KKR in absence of the injured Shreyas Iyer. The Knight Riders have retained a lot of their players from the previous season and look formidable. Overseas ALL Rounders like Sunil Narine, Andre Russell, Shakib Al Hasan, and David Wiese provide a lot of balance while the Indian contingent of players like Shardul Thakur, Umesh Yadav, and Varun Chakravarthy make the bowling department look settled. PBKS on the other side have stars like Kagiso Rabada, Liam Livingstone, Bhanuka Rajapaksa, and the most expensive buy in the history of IPL, Sam Curran. The PBKS bowling department too is filled with Indian Bowlers like Arshdeep Singh, Rahul Chahar, and Harpreet Brar. It will be interesting to see the two lineups, especially considering the new set of players inducted and the new Impact Player Rule. will expect a reversal in fortunes this season while two-time champions would want to taste the success once again. Let the Game Begin! 

 

HEAD TO HEAD:
Both the Teams have clashed 30 times and KKR has had the better of the opposition winning 20 games while PBKS has managed to win 10 matches.

 

PITCH REPORT: 
Daren Ganga: "The pitch is light brown in colour which means there is not a lot of moisture. It's also very hard, so it might be more even for teams batting first and chasing. There's a good covering of grass, looks quite even. Dimensions of the ground are unique. If you go to the eastern side, it's the larger of the two boundaries - 72 meters in distance, and also against the wind. That's not where you want to hit. Down the ground is 77 meters. Spinners would want to capitalize on that." 

 

VENUE STATS:
MATCHES: 15 
WON BAT FIRST : 3
WON BAT SECOND: 12
AVG 1ST INN TOTAL : 159

 

TOSS:-
win the toss and elect to field first!

 

Nitish Rana, KKR Skipper: "We will bowl first, it has rained in the last two days so there would be some moisture. I am excited because very few people get this opportunity. It is a game of cricket after all.  so not taking much pressure."

 

Shikhar Dhawan , PBKS Skipper: "We would have fielded first. Getting the impact player in the second innings can create more of an impact. Happy to bat as well. We have got a balanced side, so hopefully, we will do good. The team preparation has been good and we will look to dominate the game, hoping for a great season ahead"
Matchsummary.PostMatchCommentary:
PBKS start their 2023 campaign with a win in this rain-affected contest at Mohali. PBKS put up 191 on board after being sent into bat by Nitish Rana. It was the partnership of 86 between the PBKS Skipper Shikhar Dhawan and Bhanuka Rajapaksa that shifted the momentum in their favour. All the PBKS batters got to a start which is a good sign going forward in the tournament. Umesh Yadav and Varun Chakravarthy were economical but the rest of the KKR bowlers conceded above 10 r.p.o. In response, KKR lost three wickets in the powerplay after which the going got tough for the Knight Riders. Skipper Nitish Rana, Impact player Venkatesh Iyer and Andre Russell did strike some lusty blows but none of the three went on to get a big one which resulted in KKR managing just 146 falling short by 7 runs (as per DLS method). Arshdeep picking up three out of the four top-order wickets was the pick of the bowlers for PBKS with help from the spinners Rahul Chahar and Harpreet Brar bowled tight overs from the other end. A win is a win and taking winning momentum in the next contest is always vital in this format. 
 

Shikhar Dhawan, PBKS Captain: "It's a great feeling to start the tournament with a win, we'll try to take the momentum in the next game and carry that confidence ahead. According to the situation I used those bowlers, good thing we have got plenty of bowlers on the side. I knew Raza was going to be handy against the left-handers, so he gave us three quality overs. Also have experienced bowlers like Sam Curran and Arshdeep on the side. Wanted to be aggressive and at the same time smart. They are youngsters and they are learning. We all are living our dream and we should be happy about it. As a leader, I make sure the team stays relaxed and in a happy state of mind."

 

Nitish Rana, KKR Captain: " Was thinking of using Anukul with the ball but didn't find the right situation for it. Russell not bowling at the death wasn't because of any injury issue. I just felt like going with my five main bowlers. They batted well, and judged the wicket better than us."

 

Arshdeep Singh is the Player of the Match

 

"All I tried to do is be unpredictable. The wicket was also good for batting so I was trying to mix it up. Players were expecting that I will bowl yorkers so I tried up to surprise them a bit by bowling those bouncers and slow bouncers. There was some drizzle around so the wicket had become skiddy that is why I was using the conditions on offer. I am enjoying myself and the atmosphere around the dressing room is also very good. Will try to keep enjoying and keep winning games for the team. "

Matchsummary.MatchName: Gujarat Titans vs Chennai Super Kings
Matchsummary.TossDetails: Gujarat Titans Won The Toss And Elected To Field
Matchsummary.TossText: Won The Toss And Elected To Field
Matchsummary.PreMatchCommentary:
Hello and Welcome everyone, It is time has come for the biggest sporting festival of the country, The Indian Premier League. The tournament opener of the 16th edition of the league will be held at the iconic Narendra Modi Stadium where the defending Champions Gujarat Titans will lock horns with the four-time Champions Chennai Super Kings. The audience in attendance will not only be excited to see their home team perform in front of them but also for the return of 'Thala' Mahendra Singh Dhoni who takes the field in what might just be his last tournament. The season introduces a new set of rules which makes the format even more interesting, the most exciting of which is the 'IMPACT PLAYER RULE' which allows the teams to include a player who is not a part of the Playing 11 in the side at any moment in either inning. Another rule is the one that gives the bowling side a provision to take DRS for a 'Wide or No Ball' called by the On-field Umpire. Also, the captains will now be allowed to name the playing 11 after the Toss takes place.
The Titans will look to start their campaign on a winning note considering the success they had against their opponents in the last year's edition. Super Kings exited the tournament in the group stage last year but can never be taken lightly as the team is no short of firepower and experience in the camp. Both sides have some exciting talents in their ranks which ensures a cracker of a contest, to say the least. CSK side looks star-studded with the likes of MSD, Rururaj Gaikwad, Ravindra Jadeja, and the newly included Ben Stokes who makes the balance of the side a lot better. GT on the other side has not made many changes to their winning combination which includes the likes of Skipper Hardik Pandya, Shubman Gill, Rashid Khan, and the newly inducted Kane Williamson who brings a lot more solidity to their batting unit. Let the contest between the Master MSD and apprentice Hardik Pandya begin! 
 

HEAD TO HEAD:
Both the clashes between  and  have been won by the Titans. 

 

VENUE STATS:


The Average first innings score at the Narendra Modi Stadium is 154. 
Winning Total at the venue is 175.
Out of the 7 IPL games, 5 have been won by the team batting second.

 

TOSS:-
  win the toss and elect to field first!

 

Hardik Pandya, Gujarat Titans Captain: "We'll field first. It is always good to play here being the home team. New start, new season, it is quite exciting with the whole build up to the tournament. I have been a huge fan and admirer of MS and have looked to learn from him whenever playing with or against him.  Want the team to go out there with a smile and enjoy themselves and the Result will take care of itself. The Playing combination is something that I leave up to Ashish Nehra who does all the thinking being the coach of the team." 
 

Mahendra Singh Dhoni, Chennai Super Kings Captain: "We would have bowled as well. Looks like a good wicket and I don't think it will change much during the course of the game. Not sure if there will be dew because it rained last night.  This stadium's capacity is twice the of other stadiums in the country so it would be some experience in this Fantastic atmosphere. The preparation leading up to the tournament was good. We assembled quite early for the camp and trained together with the unit. The new rule introduced makes it interesting and it's a luxury to have an impact player which can be introduced depending upon the situation."
Matchsummary.PostMatchCommentary:
Powerplay (1-6 Overs) :-

CSK- 51/2 (8.5 rpo, 7x4, 2x6)  || GT- 65/1 (10.8 rpo, 7x4, 3x6)

Middle Overs (7-15 Overs) :- 

CSK- 82/2 (9.1 rpo, 2x4, 8x6) || GT- 73/3 (8.1 rpo, 5x4, 2x6)

Death Overs (16-20 Overs) :- 

CSK- 45/1 (9.0 rpo, 1x4, 3x6)  || GT- 44/1 (10.4 rpo, 3x4, 3x6)

 

It was a good call from Hardik Pandya to bowl first as the Titans ended up on the winning side in the first match of IPL 2023.  got off to a decent start in the powerplay but kept losing wickets at regular intervals. It seemed like Ruturaj Gaikwad was playing on a different track altogether as the opener smashed 92 of just 50 balls at a staggering strike rate of 184. None of the other batters got going and CSK managed to set a target of 179 for the defending Champions. In response,  started well Saha, Gill, and Sai Sudarshan all got off to good starts and played as per the situation demanded. Shubman Gill top scored with 63 of just 36 balls putting the titans in the driver's seat in the run-chase. CSK did come back in the match after the dismissal of Gill but some valuable cameos from Vijay Shankar, Rahul Tewatia and most importantly Rashid Khan took GT home with 4 balls to spare. Khan smashed 10 runs off 3 balls when the team was needing 10 runs per over. The first match of IPL 2023  delivered as promised as the match could have gone either way till the very last over! 

 

 

Hardik Pandya, Gujarat Titans Captain: "Obviously very happy with the outcome. We did put ourselves in a difficult situation in the end but Rahul Tewatia and Rashid Khan did brilliantly. We were happy at the mid-innings because at one point CSK were going well and looked like getting 200 plus, but we got those couple of wickets to pull things back. Having Rashid Khan is a real asset, he will get you wickets and get you some runs too. As batters we need to take responsibility so the lower order does not have pressure when they come into bat, This is something which we will look to improve upon, our shot selection. 

 

Mahendra Singh Dhoni, Chennai Super Kings Captain: "There was always going to be dew but the batting unit could have done a bit more. Ruturaj Gaikwad was brilliant throughout and deserved a century, it is a pleasure to watch him bat when he times the ball like this. I think it is important for youngsters to step up. I think Raj Hangargekar has good pace and will only get better with time. 

 

RASHID KHAN is the Player of the Match. 

Rashid Khan: "So very happy to receive this crucial Man of the Match. It Will give me a lot of energy for the rest of the tournament. I always try to do my best in all three formats and give it all in the practice and training sessions too. The plan is a bit hard to bowl to lefties, but the idea was to keep it tight and I knew in my mind that if I keep it simple and get two wickets, we will be definitely back in the game. Very happy with the way things went"
